text: Rude managers.Outdated food and ambiance.0/5 stars.............................................
Bad attitude's EVERYWHERE. Been wanting to come here for years and finally did. Never again.

I am hesitant to write this review for two reasons. First of all, Bottega Louie is one of my all time favorite restaurants in LA and second, I'm going to admit that for the first time in my life I gave a bad tip. I wish it all went to the barback.I got in at 1030pm solo and knowing the palace closes at 11pm I planned to sit at the bar. 7 of the stools at the bar were taken up by a 3 person party with bags on the stools beside them, and one stool in between each of them as well. several bar tables behind them were seated, I imagine they may have wanted bar seating but, who can guess? I took the remaining far corner seat next to the wall, not an issue for me, I thought.I sat for several minutes but worried the kitchen may be closing I finally called out to the barback and he came over and I asked if I could still have dinner, which he said yes. After the barback pointed me out and several long minutes the bartender finally realized I was there and gave me a menu. I wished they just told me no.I ordered over $100 worth of items. After I gave the order I wanted a soda too but had to wave my arm in the air after waiting 5 minutes to get the bartender's attention. When my food came after 5 minutes of staring at him, I had to wave my arm in the air to get the bartender's attention for chilli and parm. After my drink was visibly empty for awhile, I had to wave my arm in the air for the bartender to fill it. I wondered if he could at least just check on me once without me having to call out or raise my hand. He finally at the end, came without me calling him.....  to give me the check.TIPS acronym: "To Insure Prompt Service".

Of all the ribbon Colors that are on display here you have to pay $1.50 for a ribbon and you don't have a choice of ribbons. You only have one choice which is pink no other choice and they try to shove all your shit into one bag smashing all of your cakes.
Very expensive for average food

Looking for top rated pizza in DTLA and this place was rated number one.  I ordered a $30 margarita pizza and asked to have it tin and crispy.  Server told me it was always thin and crispy.  It arrived thick, doughy and undercooked.  I asked if I can have it cooked more and was told they would make me a new one.  When the second one came, it was only slightly better.  I wanted to send this one back as well, but decided to just deal with the loss.  A $30 pizza shouldn't look like an out of the oven Digiorno frozen pizza, and that is what it literally looked like.  They need to teach the pizza maker how to use a brick oven.   Who ever rated this number one should share whatever they are smoking.
Entire experience there was terrible. Never going there again. Would not recommend anyone

text: Your website states that you don't need reservations because your restaurant has 255 tables. So our party of 8 showed up on a Thursday night and we were told that there would be a 2 1/2 hour wait! That is simply absurd! You don't take reservations but expect people to wait two and a half hours for a table? You should make exceptions and take reservations for big parties. So don't waste your time here. We went around the corner to H&H Brazillian Steakhouse and were happy to give them our money for an amazing dinner experience and extremely friendly service! I gave Louie Bottega one star for their pastries which we did purchase to go after we ate dinner at H&H Brazillian Steakhouse.

Mediocre service and food. I ordered the Chicken Milanese which is supposed to be a breaded chicken cutlet topped with a lemon caper sauce.  Instead I got the cutlet but no sauce and a handful of lettuce thrown on top.  WTF was that! Salad arrived the same time as the main course.  For the price they charge they need to do it right. There are far better Italian restaurants to be found downtown at much better value.

I had to come on here to let it be known that your customer service is seriously lacking. I call the other morning and spoke to a girl named Sophie. She spoke to me in such a condescending tone with some of the simple questions I asked her and kept telling me "you need to speak up", I don't need to anything and she should learn how to converse to customers and be more hospitable.

The noise in this restaurant during prime eating times is beyond endurance. I asked the waiter why they had to play music over the already loud ambient noise and he told me that it helps to turn over the tables. While I appreciated his candor I don't like being manipulated. The food is OK and the service is not bad but until I become deaf I am not returning to this restaurant.

Food is over hyped. Service is rushing people out of there..  price is okay. I went twice and ordered the same dish. And it looks and tastes completely different????? Servers are super condescending for no reason just cause you work at a better restaurant??? Bye. Not recommended.
Expectations were higher.. Not to mention came across rude people here who seem to not care about there job!

text: This place is not up to par anymore. Super duper soggy pizza! Also they add 4% charge on your bill now. Not sure what that is for. Came here for Saturday dinner and it was half empty. I had a terrible experience at the restaurant. They should be ashamed of the quality of the service and the food. I asked for a steak without sauce or butter as I have a dairy allergy. The food came, and alas, it was covered with butter. They made a new one, but by the time it came, my friends were pretty much done eating. AND, the steak was terrible. Overcooked, almost burnt to a crisp. It's far too expensive, and nights out with good friends are far to rare, for this sort of thing to happen. Shame on you Bottega Louie. I had to stop at Ralph's on the way home and get myself something to eat. Looking for a dinner night out? Look elsewhere.

Please don't ignore other review sites that why they are giving low ratings. It is a such a Farmers Markets in white elegant restaurant. Very very noisy. You will have an experience to see just opening and closing mouth without sound like a goldfish when your party talk.   awful and terrible.

yes, the food is good and the service given by mostly white hipster/model ish looking  waiters is ok but the reason I never go there even though I can just walk over on any given day is its terrible design.  make no mistake, this place doesn't need your business since it's always packed but that fact combined with the lack of sound absorption makes having a normal conversation a painful task. You will feel as if you are inside the latest nightclub since everybody is yelling, except the music is not loud enough and you will hear everybody else's convos. on top of that the greedy owners have put the tiny tables right next to each other and the concept of personal space is unknown to them. - James

Overpriced! I originally had a high expectation of this place. The first thing I notice is the noise level of this place. Because of the high ceiling, during lunch time, you can barely have a nice conversation with other on the same table. The service was horrible as well. We waited for so long to be seated. Worst of all the food is super overpriced.

Reached the place around 6:15 p.m.  We were told that the wait time was 30-45 minutes.  Could not find standing room anywhere.  Tried to order 4 cocktails.  There was no line and could not make out where to order.  Finally found someone who took our orders.  When it was brought to us, someone in the crowd accidentally brushed us and half of one of the cocktails spilled.  It is good that the waitress stood by the spill till it was cleaned (no offer to refill the cocktail even though it was spilled as she was handing it over to us).  Got seated for the dinner.  A small roll of bread, was thrown on to the paper on the dinner table (why not use a plate even though the paper is changed after each sitting).  The roll was so hard, like a piece of hardened plastic; not much taste.  The dinner portions and the dessert were so little, that I was still very hungry.  I ordered hanger steak verdura with a black truffle demi-glace.  The glace indeed had a very fine taste, I did not much appreciate the big salt crystals (kosher salt or sea-salt?) on the steak.  Even though it stated that it comes with farmers market vegetables, it practically had no vegetables (it had a few pieces of tiny mushrooms and a few tiny baby carrots).  I tasted all four dishes we ordered.  Except for the crowded atmosphere, nothing attractive or too tasty.

REVIEW ABOUT DR. MATIAN  FARIBORZ  DDS-   DENTIST  02/23/2015                             Morella Esparragoza and I, Freddy Castillo, went to Dr. Matian Fariborz DDS Inc located at 19900 Ventura  Blvd #200, Woodland Hills,California 91364 for dental services in December 2010. I am dissatisfied the way his business handled the billing to my two dental insurance providers They filed the claims with errors, omissions some 10 months later and some over a year later. He failed to submit claims on time for the 2010  allowance and nothing was billed to the insurance provider and same occurred with the claims the following year. The claim were denied by the insurance companies due incomplete report, late filing. I have found similar complaints against Dr. Matian, with the Better Business Bureau  for the same reasons. He performed procedures not previously approved by me or my wife neither by the insurance companies and he went after his clients for payment over those procedures, demanding full payment ,  rather than the prices under contract with the insurance providers. This practice is unethical and misleading to his patients. On every occasion he misled  us into believing that the  large majority of the expenses were to be covered by the insurance providers.  Four years later he is requesting payment for his services for an amount almost double of the original estimate given to us. We are in court proceeding  and appeals to resolve the disputed amount,  I offered to settle for a more reasonable charge but he refused to accept the offer. No bills, invoices, or phone calls were ever made to me despite of my request to solve this issue. I was sent to collection  to harass me and my wife while  we were in court. The paper work at his office is in complete disarray as far as documenting the claims,  making you responsible for payments after the claims are denied. His behavior is reprehensible and despicable. I will never use his services again or recommend this Dentist to anybody.

I WENT HERE TO GET A RETAINER FOR $300.00 AND WALKED OUT WITH A BILL OF $9,000.00, HERE ARE THE DETAILS OF WHAT HAPPENED.  I went to Dr Noor to get implants on my right side where I did not have any teeth on the lower back three, I told Dr Noor that is what I needed, she arranged a date to put me to sleep and do the work I needed, I went there and l was put to sleep, when I woke up I had a crown on a tooth that did not need it on the opposite side and a inlay on another tooth on the opposite  side, still no teeth implants, Dr Noor charged $7,000.00 up front before I was put to sleep, I thought about the work I still needed and I let Dr Noor put braces in my mouth and I had braces put on for another $5,000.00, braces removed that Dr Noor put in my mouth, I was in a lot of pain, the braces were to tight and every time I went back to Dr Noor and let her know that I was in more pain and the braces were to tight she would make them tighter, Dr Noor pulled number 28 tooth so hard Dr Noor pulled it in to the place of number 29, I had to get some body - anybody - to remove the braces, I already knew what Dr Noor would do, so I checked out Dr. Daniel Binafard to get the wires off and get a retainer for $300.00, I was in so much pain I could not think straight, Dr. Daniel  Binafard suggested if he put a bridge on I would not need the retainer, still wanting the wires off because of the pain I told Dr. Daniel  Binafard to go ahead, it did not take Dr. Daniel Binafard long to grind off all of my straight teeth and put a cantilever  attached to the bridge to fill in the area where I did not have teeth on the back right on the bottom, the teeth numbers Dr. Daniel  Binafard ground off was numbers 21,22,23,24,25,26, 27, 28 ,29, the cantilever ever was over the top of the gum for teeth number, 30,31,32, that was the teeth I wanted Dr Noor to do implants on,  this was all one piece and felt like they molded it on a marble table in Mexico, plus he ground the gum down so far on number 27 it was three sixteenths of an inch (" 3/16'ths" )  lower then the gum in all the other area's, from  Dr. Daniel  Binafard and and his grinder  the tooth that was in that spot was three times bigger then all the other teeth,  it looked like it belonged to a hourse, After I went to Dr. Daniel  Binafard office I called him Dr Grinder, when I left Dr. Daniel  Binafard office I owed $9,000.00. I tried to sue both of them or at least get some of my money back, it is very hard to sue a dentist, I did report them to the dental board and the bbb. I did have to replace all the work in my mouth, I had $12,000.00  at Dr Noor and $9,000.00 at Dr. Daniel  Binafard, I am only glad I did not have dental insurance till after I left, I had all my dental work redone for about $17,000.00 in Korea town, best dentist in the world in Korea town.

The place is very noisy, can't enjoy company. The food mediocre.

once again back at BOTTEGA LOUIE ordered the usual ITALIAN SALAD only this time i found a hair in it 100% it was from the chef  he is the only one without a hairnet or hat paid and will never be visiting BL again PS thank you CHEF!
Been here couple times, and both times the food was mediocre. For the price and high reviews I was expecting better.
Incredibly rude hostess. Ruined the whole evening.

The breakfast pastries and coffees are a 5 STAR for the AM!However, dinner is noisy, overrated and expensive. My food came out average temp. Their famous  fried portobello mushrooms were not freshly fried, and caesar salad had no caesar flavor in the dressing... just romaine!  Wasted my $40. Perhaps their other entrees are better, like pasta.
Worst f*ing service of my life. Seriously.

CAl OSHA should inspect this place for noise violation. This place is one of the laudest work-places I have ever visited. Workers should wear earplugs. Bottega Louie is hazardous to your hearing. Design and construction are beautiful, visit only after the restaurant is closed. One star for the after hour look. I will never visit or eat there in the future.

I recently took three colleagues to Bottega Louie for lunch. We waited an hour to be seated, after being told the wait was 15 minutes. The Host kept seating people who came AFTER my party. I approached the Maitre'd who simply ignored me. When I complained to the manager, he told me loudly that they could not "babysit everyone waiting for a table", in a rude, insolent tone and manner. He then told us that it was "irrelevant" that groups who came in after us were seated before we were. Obviously, I disagree, and I suppose money was changing hands. The management at this restaurant are the most obnoxious and self-important two men I have ever encountered ANYWHERE. This is my first Yelp review, and I hope never to have the occasion to write such a review again. However, I feel compelled to share this disgusting experience.

I have been a long-time customer of Louie and I love their food. Recently however, the service has been so bad I almost walked out before the food even got to the table. This past Saturday was the second time that we have complained to the manager. The waitress was rude and inattentive. Her answers were short and disdainful. I asked what kind of coffee they had (because I wasn't sure if  they had rotated espresso brands) and she looked at me exasperatedly and said, "Cappuccino, espresso, lattes." Don't worry, I SAW the gigantic espresso machine when I walked through the door. I kind of figured there would be espresso drinks on the menu. Thanks for clarifying the obvious. Then when I asked how much a double shot would cost in comparison, she ignored my question and left. The server brought something to our table that we had asked for early to eat with an appetizer, and then took it off of our table to give to another customer when they asked for it. It doesn't matter what kind of restaurant it is, that is unprofessional. As a manager of a restaurant in Aspen, CO, I was appalled by this action. Once you have brought something to a customer's table, you leave it there and go get another one for the next customer. I'm sure there wasn't a shortage of condiments. Even if there is, you leave it with the customer you initially gave it to unless you ask and explain the situation. Then when we asked the server to please give us what he had taken away from our table, because we were using it, he said "yeah, I'll bring it before your food comes." The food it accompanied was already there.When we called the manager over to tell him about our waitress's attitude and the actions of the server, he said "Look, what do you want me to do about it?" A manager should NEVER act like this is a personal affront. He should NEVER get defensive, and I was stunned that he behaved so immaturely. We were not rude when we spoke to him, nor were we, at this point, upset. I was stunned at his behavior. He was young, but he should have had some sort of managerial skills. We were simply letting him know that this was ruining a special evening. At a place like that, you expect good service. After this, he ignored us. So too did the waitress. She then forgot my coffee, which took two conversations to order. She took away my date's drink when it was half full, without a replacement and returned it ten minutes later after we asked where it had gone.Because our waitress was blatantly ignoring us, we had to call over the manager again as he was the only one around, to ask if I was ever going to get my coffee. I had been waiting over 25 minutes and had almost finished eating. At this point, another table asked him if they were ever going to get their order and asked for the check instead because of the waitress' attitude. Apparently she hadn't brought a birthday dessert the girls had ordered as a surprise for their friend and had just been sitting there with empty glasses and un-cleared plates for a while. Their friend had found out about it because of the long wait time and they just decided to leave to go somewhere else for dessert, as their surprise had been ruined.I think the manager finally got the idea that his servers were terrible and he finally apologized, albeit, he shouldn't have had to had he trained his employees well.I have recommended Louie to friends and family for months now, yet the fact that this is the second time I have had a horrible experience at Louie, (the first being two months ago when the waitress ignored all of her tables and everyone in her section was trying to get anyone's attention) I will not be a patron of theirs again. I hadn't been back in two months because of the horrible service last time. I absolutely love their food, and I don't mind the wait, but I do not appreciate the rude abuse dished out by their staff. If I want to go on a date, or even on a business lunch, I will be taking my business and friends elsewhere.Also, the cupcakes were dry and the icing had too much butter in it. It tasted oily.
good atmo.

VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE CUSTOMER SERVICE! I went there with coworkers for lunch on Dec. 16, 2010. We were a group of 12 and the restaurant didn't take reservations. They prepared a table for us and it was very surprising. They set up a 5-foot round table and tried to fit all of us in one table! We were all thinking - REALLY? They didn't offer to break us into two tables until several of us had asked why we were crammed in one table. They didn't really seem to want to listen to our complaint. We literally didn't have any elbow room even before the plates were served. HMMM...I DON'T WANT TO PULL THE "RACE" CARD BUT I'M WONDERING IF IT HAD SOMETHING TO DO WITH US BEING ALL ASIAN. There were several tables available that could be configured for our group size but the staff didn't want to do it.The food was good but the customer service was very much disappointing! I WOULD NOT GO BACK TO THIS RESTAURANT!

I've never met a boutique I didn't like.  The tiny little boxes pristinely packaged with fantastic bows cinched over the tops and sides, the sparkling artifacts exemplified on pedestals in the storefront windows, realizing that the number of items for sale is directly proportional to the number of years it will take to pay for one item at full price, having to ask to see everything...four times: just lovely.  When asked to go eat at Bottega Louie in Downtown LA the other night, I was excited.  I was more than willing to go super-extra early when the senior citizens eat because the place DOESN'T ACCEPT RESERVATIONS, no problem.  Knowing that the place gets very crowded at the stroke of 8:30 pm, it must be delightful.  Bottega, in Italian, means small store or boutique.  What's the worse that could happen?LESSON LEARNED: Don't judge a bottega by it's storefront glass. (if you wanna be a stickler, don't judge a book by it's cover.) Red Flag #1:  I walked inside and was pleasantly greeted by a glass case of sugary delights.  Glistening cupcakes, éclairs, and cookies were staring back at me... but as I turned the corner, the fluorescent light seemed to grow more harsh and the once-full glass case of goodness was beginning to look empty.  Had Bottega Louie already thrown in the towel?  Thought to itself "I already reeled her in, no more effort necessary?" I was startled by the lack of sweetness and the over abundance of neon white glow.Red Flag #2:As any good media whore would do, I checked into my social outlets to let my fans know of my whereabouts (aka, feed my addictions).  I checked into yelp, Facebook, and foursquare.  Right away, I got the JUST DESSERT badge.  This was a sign. Red Flag #3:Yes, 'regentrification' seems to be what LA is all about these days.  I get it.  Well done for it has worked on me.  You have successfully lured me into a brand new, yet still old, but strangely new (let's settle on retro), building that was supposed to be torn down but that is now a hip, cool, ultra louge-hangout-hotspot-eatery-wateringhole-cupcakery-datingspot-ithink.  While I used to be really scared about driving to the projects where missions serve homeless people who have lost cognitive function years ago and now babble at parking meters, I know park at those same meters and walk by myself to Bottega Louie.  However, you forgot to think of the function of the space.  It is a concrete and marble high-ceiling LARGE partitioned space.  Since no one stopped to think about acoustical engineering, (or even art on the walls let alone anything to break the monotony from the ceiling) it is a wretched spot for a restaurant.  I couldn't hear a thing.  It is probably best served as a space for a screaming contest.Red Flag #4:One of the great things about LA is that waiters and waitresses (I don't know, is that even PC anymore?) are beautiful.  The commercially artistic yet unemployed (ie. Actors, singers, artists, dancers, musicians, and other pretty faces) go to high-end restaurants and submit their headshots (yes, headshots) for jobs.  The idea of it is deplorable, but while sitting at a table, I don't really mind.  At Bottega Louie, it's fairly obvious that the wait staff was more carefully selected than that of the cast of Gossip Girl.  However, I'm not quite sure our waiter was actually literate.  Even worse, I'm not sure what's more annoying that not finding your waiter than having an overly attentive one.  He stood 2 FEET FROM THE TABLE.  EVERYTIME I LOOKED UP at anything ANYTHING (!), HE CAME OVER.    Red Flag #5:Refer to #2.  When we received our food, some of it was inedible.  DO NOT ORDER THE HEIRLOOM CARROTS.  Peter Rabbit, after a cleanse, wouldn't eat those.  People at the next table over were pointing and making gag faces.  Seriously, if I was at the next table over, I would ask the waiter to take these carrots away.  They were THAT BAD.  Also, I was taking home an entrée for my boyfriend.  Now, it's really difficult to mess up Chicken Parm, but somehow Bottega Louie managed to figure out a way.  Yes, Louie, the breading calls for an egg.  NO, YOU DO NOT THROW THE ENTIRE EGG INTO A FOOD PROCESSOR, SHELL AND ALL.  I'm not making this up. THERE WERE SO MANY EGG SHELLS IN HIS CHICKEN PARM, I wonder if a monkey had broken into the kitchen, tied everyone up, and started messing with the orders.  We ordered dessert and it was actually really good.  The Foursquare badge was right.  None of this fiasco would have happened if we had JUST ORDERED DESSERT.  Again, Lesson learned:  Don't judge a bottega by it's storefront glass case....

Beautiful Disappointment The presentation was great but the WORST service EVER! Not impressed! Very beautiful restaurant, the desserts look very good and the atmosphere felt fun, the problem.....bad service. We had to ask for the menus and the had 4 different servers bring our food, they were not attentive at all! We saw as the employees shoot the s#*t with each other and "managers" walked around sipping coffee but did not pay attention to what matters....the COSTUMER :) A brief count showed 30 employees on duty including 5 "managers". One drinking coffee one sitting at a table chatting. Not once were we asked if we need refills or if the food was good. Nothing not once. The servers one brought water, one brought drinks, one brought salad and one brought pizza all different and not one was attentive (except for the first who was actually a bartender not a waiter or server) The pizza was not fully cooked, we waited to get our check and waited and waited but finally we got up and asked for our tab. A beautiful first impression impression with a disappointing ending :(

Normally, I would never post a negative blog about waiting in a popular restaurant; however, I found it very offensive about the treatment I received on my visit.  Let it be said that service is NOT exceptional in this restaurant.  When I arrived on a weekday, I was told that the wait is 15min, which turned out to be an hour.  I had a party of 3 and I was seated at the end of the booth with my other 2 guests next to the pizza oven, which is obviously too small and uncomfortable.  Additionally, the extremely rude hostess told me that we will be seated at the next available table; however, preference was given to parties of 2 and 4s.  This was so obvious when dinning guests, who arrived well past my arrival time, had to wait less than 15min to be seated...what a way to ruin a great evening!

Lousy service, lousy food.  And now the particulars...  Went on a Saturday morning with an out-of-town guest.  The pix don't do justice to Bottega Louie: twenty-foot cielings, white tablecloths, white marble... very unexpected in Los Angeles (and I've lived here all my life).  However...  Though staff was numerous, it took 15 minutes just to order coffee and juice.  The juice didn't arrive for nearly half an hour (the wait-person had to be reminded, and didn't apologize for the delay).  The food took 45 minutes.  My wife and I ordered frittatas (she, the capresi; I, the roasted vegetable).  The frittatas were the worst I've eaten.  If there were vegetables anywhere in the egg, they were very elusive.  The thing was smothered in melted cheese - so much that it was oily.  Happy to get out of there.  Despite all, I may go back - the place was full by the time we left, and maybe we just caught a bad table on a bad day.  Even so: among the worst dining experiences I've had.

I have been going to this place for a very long time and each time I come I order their delicious fruit tart. Just yesterday I went to go get one since the place had shut down and I was very disappointed. They changed the way they made their fruit tart. They added a fruit jelly mixed in with the créame, and the créame was more dense than fluffy. I only come to this place because the créame was so unique and delicious compared to all other places I had been. The fruit tart tasted like something I have had somewhere else for a better price. I hope this was just what they tried for the week and not a permanent change.

Looks good enough. This place is not okay! The plates are hella dirty and unwashed. Brings you the wrong food. Nobody here is giving an f* to care for anything. Waitress not taking your order, it takes an hour for the waitress to come. They don't care what you want, They just want money. SO expensive for some very small things you can buy at the dollar tree. Soda was 45 bucks and I could buy a can of soda in dollar tree for 0.87 cents.WORST PLACE EVER
Not good food. The drinks taste great but they're very conservative with how much alcohol they put it in the drinks.

to whom it May concern :I feel very disappointed at the attention and service I received from this Restaurant Bottega Louie last Saturday.I had to drive about 1:20 minutes to get to the restaurant and 10 minutes left and at the reception Mr. MICHAEL HANG behaved in a very discourteous way and with very little education and told me that it was already closed and without listening to me He said he would retire and that they could not attend us and I told him that we came from far away and without any education he told me that if he did not listen that they could no longer attend me, as if I were asking for a favor. So I left very angry and upset and promised never again to go to this restaurant for anyone deserves to be treated as this person did with me.Large companies are due to the good treatment of their customers.shame about Restaurant that everything is lost by bad attention.Dr: Marco Antonio Avalos.                                            562-239 -6885
Loud, slow and sub-standard food. Skip it.
**update: management has reached out and handled the situation. Thank you**

The food was ok, and the service during our meal was fine. They came to check up on us, and even helped surprise my friend for her birthday!However, the issue came after we paid. The bill had included an additonal surcharge, which after a quick glance, we assumed to mean that tip was included. The waitstaff, Geofferey, chased us down and interrupted us mid-conversation, and badger us about if his service was subpar. After explaining we thought the surcharge was a tip, he rudely said, "No.", shook his head, and continued asking about why his service didn't warrant a tip.1. We understand why he is upset. However, since when were waiters and waitresses to rudely interrupt conversations and openly make a scene about a tip?2. Upon looking more closely at the bill, we see that it's only 4%, and it is to help mitigate the employees' wages and benefits. While I'm all for supporting higher wages, we came to pay for food and service,  not wages that an employer is too cheap to pay. You own a bougie restaurant. Please pay your employees fairly and with benefits!3. We would have appreciated a brief explanation of what the surcharge, as it would be polite to do so instead of being so defensive. We would happily tip, he gave great service during our meal, it was simply a misunderstanding. However, the reaction and response to the circumstances made us second guess our judgement of your service.Conclusion: Please teach your waitstaff to respond to stressful situations politely. And please pay them their fair wages without taking from your guests.Update----Thank you; we spoke with management about this issue, and they were very kind to us and took care of the matter.

The foods are definitely overhyped. The atmosphere is cute! Their pastries were good, but the dishes were just mediocre. I tried the Pasta and the pizza which were just "OK to semi-GOOD" level. I've defnitely experienced much better foods. Please note this location gets very crowded.

service is too slow...i was waiting for like 30 minutes and the people that came here after me they are getting seated faster than me?? When i ask for the employee right there they just kept on telling me to wait, after waiting for like almost 1 hour i finnaly able to get a seat, the food right there is just meh, probably because of the waiting time that caused me to be bias...

My god. Overpriced everything should be their slogan. Seriously I get you're in down town LA but come on. They clearly haven't been to Europe...I think I get better sweets at Starbucks. The pizza was good. That's about it.

This place wants to be cool, but is a little to sterile. There is no decor or real personality here. The place is white, everyone is wearing the same white outfit, boring. The food is okay, nothing to write home about. The service was good, but very basic. No piazzas! The bakery though is reall nice and stacked with option, if I were there for sweet not lunch they may have got another star. The prices are not to bad, but maybe that is there filtration process.
too expensive.......no parking ... i don't like the place
I think this place is way over rated. Big , loud, and the food is medicore.

This place is loud. The walls are bared, and the noises echo off the walls making dining here unbearable. I don't know what my food tastes like because my head was hurting.Note to owners: some noise dampening walls treatment will go along way to prevent hearing loss in customers.
Cute place. Desserts are ok. Resturant is way too loud since there is no soft surface.
Sub par food, overpriced, bad decor, too much echo. Bad. Ended up here way too many times, can't stand it. Will not back again

It was disappointing when I notice there was a service charge on my bill. I asked the waiter was that for gratuity and he said no its for our insurance. Then of course I ask so you get insurance and the waiter said no was not offer. Next question so the people who has been offer received free insurance and again no. Wow I call that taking advantage of the customers ad the employees, not cool.  For that reason stop going to this place
Overcrowded, extremely loud, wait time takes forever, but cool hip spot to hand out and get deserts for a very expensive budget!
Ok first of all this place needs to figure out how to fix the loud echoes in there. It's so hard to enjoy your meal when it's so loud. You just want to run out. Sorry but figure it out.
Terrific food but VERY noisy! Difficult to carry on a conversation with dining companion with the din of the restaurant. Sorry. I won't go back. It's just no fun with all that racket.

I did not appreciate the service or lack there of.  Wait was too long for the dining area and so we opted out and decided to partake on macarons and other sweet treats, and because of this, were quarantined in the front section. I understand why this is the case, but what I can't justify is not being able to make my selections without feeling rushed by someone on the other side of the counter who clearly did not enjoy working there. The look of the place did not match the feel.  Pass!
beautiful spacebut so loudand too expensive for not outstanding food

The food was good but the noise level in the restaurant was so loud that it made dinner conversation impossible. It may be fine for young people but for middle aged folks such as myself, the ambient noise ruined what should have been a lovely dinner. I won't go back. There are plenty of great restaurants in LA where I can have great food AND great conversations with my dining companions. This ain't one of 'em.
I love the desserts there, please the restaurant was too noisy. They need more soft surface
Food was dry and over priced, pizza was a great size but lacked flavor.  Staff was great.
What can I say. This place was overpriced with mediocre pasta and pizza at best. The macaroon was pretty decent though.
Meatball Parm Sliders for $16? 3 little balls with brioche bread tiny sauce & cheese, awfully steep in price for what you get. I left hungry
I expected a little bit better service and food. The atmosphere was alright, not the most welcoming place. The food took longer than usual.
this place overated and too busy for what you get. blah

I was excited to visit this place. Now I know its just over rated. Breakfast was horrible my eggs were dry my bacon was burnt my wife and I spent over  $70 bucks for a mediocre breakfast. The only thing that was good was the over priced $7 dollar juice and the macaroons which made me leave 2 stars otherwise I would leave no stars.
I went here last month, food has gone down, and the noise is too much. They really need to do something about the sound.
Yeah, no.
This place is over rated and expensive. Not worth the money.
Its a nice place.. A little pricey for what it really is.. But man is it loud.

This place sucks, the reason for the two stars is that it space is very nice but the food for the price is totally not worth it and very low quality. They are slow as molasses and inattentive. It's nice that you provide health benefits and paid vacation for your employees but having a sign up stating as such almost as an excuse for your prices is tacky.
Could be better.
My ears are still ringing.  LOUD.Food was meh, service was meh, atmosphere was meh.   Meh.

Good was very good but was completely shocked and dismayed when there was a 3% service charge to pay for healthcare for their employees... Ummm take that up with President Obama... I just paid 21.00 for a glass of wine... I don't think I need a service charge on top of the menu prices. Totally unacceptable...

This place is extremely overpriced, in Europe you can get a lot better Macarones. The location is okay, although parking can be difficult. The place has a nice design, but honestly I do not get the hype around it.
1 star for price and lunch menu3 star for desserts5 star for presentation

I don't understand why this place has so many good reviews. The service is slow, and very snobbish. I came here a while ago and had a bad experience. My friend has been begging me to go with her, and I reluctantly accepted, hoping it would change my mind about it. Sadly, my opinion of this establishment remains the same. The place gets two stars because the food and desserts are good. However, for the prices you would expect better servings on the entrees. I was left so hungry after ordering two appetizers and two entrees (between my friend and I). The burrata pizza was actually pretty good. I got the hanger steak verdura, and the steak was not cooked properly. The glaze was good, but a little too over powering though. The tomato bruschetta was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. I will say, the Lobster Nage was good and my friend and I finished it pretty quickly.Once we were finished with our meal ordered the tiramisu, which is my favorite dessert, and this one was pretty good. Service: Was awful, we had to flag down our waiter multiple times. When we couldn't get him, another waitress told us she would find him and pass along our request to him. However the couple of times this happened, nothing came of it. It was frustrating having to keep looking for our waiter instead of being focused on our meal.Setting: It is so loud inside!!! Throughout the dinner I had a hard time hearing my friend. Upon looking around I realized it is due to the high ceilings. The acoustics inside are horrible, magnifying the sound of everyone inside so much more. And so every one is left basically shouting over one another trying to hear their friends. They really should figure something out with that because it really was an issue.

I've tried this place more than I probably should have thinking somewhere on the menu is a jewel that can match the amazing desserts, sadly that was not to be. No, the decor is great,  the open kitchen a nice talking piece when with company, but it's not the food or the service in the restaurant portion of Bottega Louie that makes this place great. The Pastry Counter on the other hand.....wow, Every single thing in that little counter is amazing and believe me I've tried every singe one of them. The service is also much better at the pastry counter and much more friendly and professional. Try the passion fruit tart or any of the macaroons and you'll agree these are little bites of heaven. Over all not a win but the desserts make you forget that it's too loud takes too long to be served and the food is over priced for the quality and service provided. Still, none of that matters because even though it has it's bad qualities, like that bad relationship or lame birthday party, I still keep coming back for the dessert.
I think it's over-hyped. Period.
Hugely overrated, expensive, long wait and no parking.

Very weird ordering system, I just placed an order for a Red Velvet cake and asked for extra rose petals on the cake, and was told that they don't make modifications on the cakes over the phone. Well I said I want extra petals, then the lady (who is just doing her job) said that that's how the cake comes and they can't make any changes to it... my response to that was " are your cakes pre-made???? I mean all you need to do is drop extra petals on it FOR GOD'S SAKE!!!" And then the lady goes on by saying, apparently I have to go into the bakery one day ahead and request that, and then the next day go and pick up the cake. Now the whole reason for me placing an order over the phone is so that I don't go into the store.  Who ever came up with this idea is truly don't know what they are doing. Not a very customer friendly way to place orders over the phone.
macaroons are decent, but nothing special, definitely not worth the price!
Great food but way too noisy. I won't be back.

I read the reviews for this place on yelp and gave it a shot.   I was actually looking forward to the experience on a day I was exploring downtown L.A with a group of friendsWe were all starving by the time we got there.   We ordered different stuff on their menu from salads, to pizzas, sandwiches, to deserts, and coffee.   The food was really at best mediocre, the prices was why too much for the quality of food.   The place is huge and clean but the noise level is way to high to a point I was hard to carry conversation at the table.   The only thing that really stood out and was certainly memorable about this place was the quality, professionalism of their staff.   They have some of the best friendly and professional waiter and waitresses I have ever seen.   But I won't be coming back.
Over priced and over rated.
Nice but very noisy...
WTF is up with the service here?Rude people at the counter
I only come here for the macarons! Dinner menu isn't really that impressive. The dining room is very loud that you can barely hear the person across from you. I do love their soufflé.

Meh.....If I could give 2.5 I would but I'm not feeling super charitable at the moment so I rounded down. The space itself is a 4 or 5. The looks for the deserts and pastries is a 5. The food is a 2 or 3. The concept is awesome. You feel like you are in a New York cafeteria or commissary of some sort. The acoustics are deafening and so it's not a super place if you need to discuss important details during a business meeting. I occasionally stop in for their awesome club sandwich or a salad. Again, it's good... Not great. I def give them major props for having over 10K reviews and being able to maintain their 4 star rating. It's definitely a good place to bring some out of towners if your stuck for a place to eat in DTLA that looks and feels kinda fancy shmancy but won't break the bank either.

We ordered Mache Salad, Ahi Tuna salad.   Both were awful.  My Mache salad was overly sour with unripe avocado, hardly any chicken and mostly lettuce.  I would recommend any of the Trader Joe's prepackaged salads over this one.  After questioning the authenticity of the Ahi tuna the waiter was apologetic but only after talking to the manager did they offer to replace the item but we declined.  The tuna tasted like canned albacore tuna from a supermarket not real Ahi, there was some explanation of an Italian process of preparing it - which sorry does not fly.  Check out this LA Times article on fish fraud   Save your stomach - walk ten more steps and stop at BS Taqueria. Sorry we did not.

The wait was very long, so I decided to go to the pastry counter, where I was ignored. We were finally seated, ordered apps and drinks. Waited and waited and then the waited came over and took our dinner order. The apps came at the same time, so our table was over crowded. The waiter was nice, and food was ok.
I had Valentine's Day dinner here, February 2013. Cutesy spot, not terribly impressed with the food items. I had the lasagna.

This white emblazoned interior is loved by about every woman I know.  Basic fare of pizzas, pastas, etc.  Full bar.  Super popular, seems to be crowded even on a random Tuesday at 3:00 p.m.  No reservations.  Go there at a prime time hour and a 45 minute wait is not unusual.  Food is good, not great.

I don't understand the amount of hype this place has. Everything here is average or less than. The food is just whatever and the noise level is beyond what's necessary. The last time I was here the whole place smelled a little funky as well. Kind of like a rotten egg lingering in the air. No thank you, not again.
overrated! food sucks. But if youre in DTLA late night, this is probably your best option

This is the type of place women take their girlfriends, businessman take their counterparts and people take their significant other to impress them.And the place definitely fulfills those expectations. It's expensive, pretentious and loud, very loud since the walls have nothing to absorb the sound creating a horrible cacophony. In short, this place is to downtown what the walk of fame is to Hollywood. The food tastes alright but the chef is pretentious and redundant, so it will be served in a pompous fashion. Nothing in the menu is worthy except for the pizza, the pizza is really very good.

I think this place kind of sucks! It looks impressive, but to say the least, I am not a fan. It is extremely noisy, I HATE THAT! I don't understand why they don't do some sound improvement. It should be quite easy. The food and the price does not go hand in hand. I have to say though, I love their macaroons but I will not go here if I can avoid it.
....displeased  with customer service  after I took about  2 minutes  to decide what my friends wanted. Rude.
Gabriel lopez tree service is the best , they have liscence and hes loves taking care of your trees he does all kind of work for good prices , i recomend him (626)483-6213
its a very nice place but food is just ok.
I thought it was overrated and packed.  The food was ok, the desserts were fun, but it was too expensive for what you get.
yum
Ugh!  This place is way over-rated and too noisy!
Meh! nothing amazing about this place other than it being a cash cow
Meh. I've experienced better.

1-1/2 weeks ago we went to Chi Chi's for dinner with friends.  We ordered the Antipasto Salad which is always wonderful.  In addition, we ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and I asked if it was possible to put broccoli in it, she said sure (but didn't way it would cost extra and how much extra).  I was very surprised as when we got the bill, they charged us $4.00 for the additional broccoli. That was too much of an additional charge!We then visited again last night and ordered the Chicken Parmesan which came with a very small side of spaghetti.  I don't know what they did or how they prepared the breaded chicken in the 'Chicken Parmesan', but it felt and tasted like it had been prebreaded and frozen for a quick fix.  It was terrible.  Dry and tasteless..I really likde Chi Chi's when we first began going there, but not now.  It seems their prices have grown and the quality is quickly fading!  Too bad!
Not realy liked.
Good food but too noisy. can't even hear myself there.I m more into quiet places.
overhyped. Slow service and rude as well. IMHO go to Toms Urban instead at la live for a much better meal and better experience.
dont like how this place smells

Had breakfast here. Although I may be a bit partial, the New York Egg Sandwich was really nothing special; it was good, but not great.  It was certainly not worth $10.  Not really sure what qualifies this as a "New York" egg sandwich...perhaps just the Kaiser roll?  I used to grab comparable sandwiches on the way to work from the neighborhood bodegas, carts, etc. at a fraction of the price.  I realize I'm paying for the ambiance and service, but come on...$10 for a simple egg sandwich?  I'll probably come back to give it another shot -- and try another dish -- but until then, going to stick with 2 stars.
Disappointed...
The food is excellent. The space is too. I can't go back because I can't hear you.

Walking into the restaurant one would expect to pay a premium for a great meal. Especially when it felt like walking into a very busy michelin starred cafe in central Paris. I was right about the price but with great disappointment the food was nothing short of mediocrity. The smoked salmon eggs Benedict was nothing special, i've had better for half the price. The coffee au lait was awful; it was probably the worst coffee i've drank in LA. Pros: great environment and lots of pastries to choose from. Cons: portions were small and not worth the premium. Verdict: Overpriced and overrated. Stick with pastries.
very overpriced.

After hearing all the "hoop-la" tried it. Granted it was Sun. brunch menu.  I was less then impressed. They did have a great selection in the bakery tho. Food was 2 1/2 stars at best.  One person ordered a simple club sandwich - Weber's white bread is tastier - don't know how you mess that up. Food was less then fair in my opinion. Skip the meal and visit the bakery or just stop in for a drink.
address: Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, CA

Not a good date place because it is so loud you can't even hear your dining partner. The food wasnt that good either.
Food is ok. Service is too slow. I don't know why this place is so popular. It's also obnoxiously loud.
crowd gets 2 pts food is wack
its ok. Not bad.
Foods ok, noise is unbearable.
Way too loud!
Too pricy and too loud!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Disappointed with the initial service level - very slow to take an initial drinks order and a pretty disinterested serverFood was very averageThe restaurant is a great atmosphere - if not maybe a little noisyBut the lack of service could not be recovered fromStill sitting in the restaurant and she is going to notice it when it comes to the tip!
ambiance is great food so so
Mediocre food at an exorbitant price.

I truly feel this place is over rated. I always feel like its packed when I come here. There are way too many people and its a bit noise in there during dinner time. I ordered the chicken carciofi and I thought it was a bit too salty for my taste. The macaroons were delicious thought.
loud, mediocre, lines of sheep.

Came here for lunch excited to try the famous food. Maybe I expected too much, but it was only average at best. Maybe we went on an off day, but the food was a bit dry and the flavors just weren't there.Also it's so loud inside, so you really can't enjoy.

Had lunch at Stonefire Grill in Westlake today, a very disappointing experience.Waited  quite a while for ribs and chicken/beef. Our salad arrived immediately which meant I, my wife and daughter were full by the time the entrees arrived.Beef was burnt and mashed potatoes were cold. They should also take a fresh look at their curtains. It appears there's a grease buildup present.Not a very good experience. Too bad, since our office is adjacent to the restaurant.
Unfortunately pricey and overrated.

Was just here on Wednesday and upon entering I was in love with macaron display and the design of the restaurant. But immediately lost interest when management did not want to sit our large party) together in a booth, so instead we opted for a bunch of little tables lined up together. Our waiter was very friendly until he began to talk "ghetto" because we were black. He did this the entire dinner service. It wasn't funny and some of the girls found it very offensive. The food was OK at best. we sent a few plates back due to it being over or undercooked. The lasagna was terrible. The lamb chops are OK, I've had better at the former Cafe Entourage's all in all I will not be returning

Bleh, this place is seriously just a hype. Don't let those pretty macarons fool you! They taste okay, definitely not the best. I had lunch here, the food was okay, nothing special but the price was decent.

This place is just okay, I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. Everyone keeps saying "Reggie, you have to go to Bottega Louie". Really? Why? Because they have marzipan cakes in the window? Because it looks like some strange toy factory inside? The food is meh and the service is eh. I found myself wondering why they staff so many people and yet can't seem to give consistent service. Try your luck elsewhere.
too loud... food was average... pretty decor and dessert section. But I would not recommend for romantic or intimate dinner..way too loud..
Very disappointing food. I would just go there for coffee and desserts.
hmmm No COMMENT.... love the macaroons though :)
In the restaurant nothing special. Good food, good service. One time is enough

I really used to love this place. Then they changed chefs and things went a bit downhill.  I get the pasta and brussel sprouts mostly but have had a lot of other things on the menu. It's disappointing when the simple things cannot be done. What's up with the chopped up brussel sprouts or may be they were chewed up. Whatever, the dish was ruined for me after that. I sent it back the first couple of times it happened. Then was told that's how they've always made them. No, I've been going since they first opened. I asked right after getting my food if they had a new chef that's how often I went. They said yes about a week or two ago, how can you tell. I said my food isn't as good.  I guess chopping it makes it look like more but with less sprouts but yet at the same price. The table next to me was disappointed too they heard me complain and had their say. The desserts are still fab though. Food isn't as good as it used to be.

Waited a long time for a table, though it seems that others who "knew people" did not have to wait (when they don't take reservations).  Perhaps typical for LA, but a turn-off.Pizza was ok, pasta was ok, and portions rather small for everything being a la carte and the price you pay.  Friends had chicken and fish, which seemed better - maybe you get what you pay for (as theirs cost about twice as much as mine).It was very loud, but very crowded.  If you want to be "seen", I guess this is the place in Downtown LA - but not really a place to go because you want something great or unique.Seems like they are trying way too hard to be NY, when LA is just not NY.  Why not have your own identity?

What a shame that nothing remains the same since it startedLess for More?  Looks like they went from being truly unique and special to quickly becoming yet another boring place that stops increasing their profits out of the diminished service and quality it provides.
Trendy place with good service. Food is ok and portions are on the small side. Not enough for me to want to go back.
Desserts = 5 starsService = 2 stars in dining room - 4 stars at bar tablesNoise level = 1 starHost stand - 1 starSlip the host $20 and you'll be seated in half the time.  Not cool.

Over-priced and over-rated (at least where the restaurant portion is concerned).  I went there for the first time today and experienced more lows than highs.  Not only would I not recommend a visit or revisit, I wouldn't introduce it to anyone either.  Sounds a bit harsh, but why spend your money on something mediocre when a mom and pop up the way would leave you more satisfied.  Mind you I did give the restaurant 2 stars, not for the overall experience but solely for the incredible fried potrabellas.  The portabellas were the highlight.  So if you are with a group just order several rounds of the portabellas.  The salads are very fresh and light and the pizza was pretty good. But the pasta was truly so disappointing that I recommend avoiding that entire column of choices.  Then If you desire any wine, champagne or cocktails, please order them while you are waiting to be seated them you may receive them before you finish your meal.  As my plate was being taken before I finished my pizza, I was trying to order a 1/2 of spumante as a close to my meal.  Not only had everyone at our table finished their meal, along with more conversation, we received our bill 15 minutes later and still no glass of champagne.  So I told our server to cancel it as she casually laid the bill on our table.  Her response was, 'Then I'll have to remove it from the tab.'  My response was, "Yes (nod), you do that!"  Then she had the nerve to pass by later and say, "No worries about the champange."  To which I replied, "No kidding."  As she was walking away she says, " I just had the bartender to pour it back in the bottle."  I gave no response to that.  I jus t thought to myself.  Some nerve.  Who waits 15 minutes for a half a glass of champagne.  If the bartender already had it poured, it was probably warm or flat by that time anyway.  But the bakery was impressive.  So if you must see what all the hype is about, try the bakery to go.Recommendations for the restaurant:  Warm your bread before dropping it on the table, it will lead to bigger tips for your servers.  And hire a second bartender or a faster one for the lunch rush.

this 2 stars is for their decors and settings....the whole black and white classy look. But hey...I would say it's only the look. cold bacon....mediocre coffee.......not too tasty pastries....not for me.....I think most of the cooks there are some kind of interns or part timers. The parking there sucks too!!! VERY VERY EXPENSIVE...

This is the most ridiculous place I have ever stepped foot into.  It felt like I was in the grade school cafeteria with 40,000 kids, 26 donkey and a grip of chimps!  IT WAS SO EFFING LOUD.I just left.

There's so much hype around this restaurant but the food is truly terrible. I've gone 3 times and have yet to find something on their menu that I like. 1st trip - pasta2nd trip - chicken and a whole bunch of side items3rd trip - pizzaThe pasta was decent but the chicken was under cooked! I pointed this out to the server and he apologized and took it back to his kitchen. He later came back and apologized again after talking with the kitchen. But that was it. No manager and they didn't even take the chicken off my bill! That's such crap. I paid $15 for under cooked chicken that I couldn't eat and that they took away. 3rd time I went it was because I had no other choice. Friend's bday and she chose the place. Decided to order the pizza since that seems to be the item that everyone else was getting so I thought it was a safe bet. Adding the fire oven, you'd think that it'd have to be pretty amazing. Mediocre at best. I think I will stick to Pit fire pizza from now on. If i'm going to be downing that many calories, at the very least it should be worth it.The only reason I gave it 2 stars is for non-food related issues. One star for their wide open space and one star for their hot hot waiters.

A mixed bag on this one...POSITIVES: Cool, cavernous space; open, lively kitchen; good looking people (good people watching); a few great dishes (meatballs, chocolate-peanut butter terrine); doesn't immediately feel like an LA establishment, more like something you'd see in New York, until...NEGATIVES: S-l-o-o-o-w as molasses table service (seriously, you can't have lunch there in less than 2 hours); a lot of the wait staff has major LA attitude (good luck getting seated if you're not as pretty as they are); some dishes are definitely overrated (skip the pizza, very bland; and a lot of the baked goods are also strangely bland--though they look delicious, especially the brownies and cookies); extremely noisy acoustics (it's tough to have a conversation without going hoarse); and ultimately it's pretty pricy for the portion sizes.Soooo, if you want to dine with pretty people, can tolerate so-so food and the hit on your wallet, by all means...

2 stars just because the place looks appealing.Food sucks...let me re-phrase that I ordered the ravioli and it was soo  blahhhhhhh!! no flavor AT ALL!! I got like 5 small pieces of ravioli 10 peas and 15 itty bitty tiny pieces of bacon ahahahhaha for $15.00 bucks. DOES IT LOOK LIKE I DONT LIKE FOOD Bottega Louie?!AND LET ME TELL YOU CHEFF BOYARDEE RAVIOLI HAS MORE FLAVOR.At the end i ended up coughing up almost $30 for nothing and took my butt to the nearest taco stand! never again!

Overrated.  I think people just get excited about this place cause its new-ish, in downtown, and looks kinda swanky.  Since downtown is undergoing a revival, the first pro place that moves in gets rave reviews on quality that would be considered lower tier anywhere else in LA.  The food is average-good, not fantastic.  The service is bad.  Servers who know people will come back even if they don't do a good job...so they don't.  The one main hostess on weekends is a stuck-up ____ (also happens to be really ugly, so maybe that explains her crappy attitude).I would go back for a to-go snack, but not for dinner, lunch, or brunch.  Not to mention, the acoustics are terrible in this place!  They should have sacrificed some of the faux marble on the walls for something that would absorb sound a little better.  Its like a sports bar atmosphere in a nice-looking restaurant.

My review is based from about a month ago so hopefully things have improved because I'm not sure where all these people eat - maybe everyone who has posted raving reviews is used to eating at the CPK level? The food is good but nothing spectacular or extraordinary. I think their portions are too big, which is why I think most people, (and this seems to be a common thing) think the food is reaallly good....it's good, but again, I don't get what the hype is all about. Maybe I expected more from reading all the reviews.The plus side is that there's an option for a dine-in in the downtown area that isn't CPK. They have alternatives and that is definitely a big plus. The space itself is beautiful to sit in - I do like their coffee very much  and they have a drink called the "Green" drink which is really nice to have first thing in the morning. Breakfast has meager case pickings throughout the week but I have not yet had their brunch menu. I've had some of their take away from their case and it seems someone has a sweet tooth in the kitchen! Everything I tried was slightly sweet - never really savory -- or bland. I can't explain it and I know it's hard to make food from a cold case taste good, but Tavern in Brentwood does a great job, and so does Joan's on Third with some of their items. I think they have some tweaking to do on their recipes. Drinks are good, but if you go across the street to 7 Grand or down to Cole's or the Golden Gopher, you can get the same style of mixology drinks, too.The pasta with bolognese and the sauce was not meaty tasting enough, and some of the pasta was undercooked. It was decent enough. We had the Pizza (Pepperoni) and the pie was decent - good but could be a bit thinner and crispier - not bad, and the tomato sauce was good. I don't understand about the Portobello fries - they were bland. The Calamari was not fresh tasting and too salty on the breading - although not greasy at all. The Roasted Beet Salad was good, with a good dressing. The marinated shrimp smelled a little ammoniated so although tasted ok, I decided to play safe and not pursue them any further. The service was decent but I think she checked on us just once. My friend got a box of the macarons on the way out and they were good but again, too sweet, the filling should be balanced with the macaron cookie. She also got a meatball sandwich to go for another friend of ours and he swears he got sick off of it! I will be back with a group of friends to explore the menu more and see about their sandwiches and some of the other pastries.
This is an extremely expensive restaurant for mediocre food! I would recommend another restaurant for sure
The service was great. The place is wow but the food was not amazing. I did really like the vanilla macaron!

I come here quite often & usually everything from the service, to the food is top notch. This recent time I stop by, was a different story. Service was not as it is usually, whomever is at the bakery register on Thursday evenings, was very rude and not open to questions on food items, ingredients. Will still return but service makes the restaurant experience, because we deal with service  before food.
Food is good but I don't know what all the hype is about.
Great stuff! Really good and will most definitely come back here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Long lines on the weekend and I feel the pricing is a bit substantial for what it is.
more hype than actual experience. the area is interesting but otherwise I'm not particularly impressed. Kind of loud and busy too
For the name and price it can be way better it's so nice inside but I feel the food can be a better for the prices
Good place , too expensive Got a pizza and water and bill was 150 Out of their mind

Call two days in a row, good luck with anyone answering their phone to take a order for you. I get the world is understaffed but how do you expect to make any kind of money if you don't have someone answering the phone? Smh.
Ok but too expensive. Macaron is way overpriced Almost unaffordable
Sad.....but they are temporarily closed due to Covid-19. I stopped by today to pick up some pastries and coffee, but they are not available for pick up.

Food is okay. The venue is very loud. Its supposed to be an intimate fancy dinner place but its very very loud. The bartenders were great, but the bar was packed, so we had to stand while we waited for our table. We had a reservation and still had to wait 20 minutes.

Beautiful pastries, food ok, they forgot to put  the bacon on the sandwich,  busy ambiance, a bit crowded. Unfortunately, the waitress was absolutely horrible, we had to ask for water, the ticket, cover refill, which I never got and  for the price of a sandwich and beignets they should do better.A bit  after wanting to go there with sister. Being a foodie, it has to be bad for me to write a review.

Great place for a date. Their display and desserts are beautiful and absolutely stunning.But I'm not a fan of their food, nor prices. Parking is also extremely challenging. Would rather go to the Whole Foods next door to get a decently valued meal.
Very loud, long wait and bad service. Food is not worth the price.
Too expensive!! and the food... is not that good.The place tho is very cute and clean, waiters are nice
Beautiful place but very expensive, $20 for 3 macaroon that are basically cookies....I just don't think is worth it.
Not the greatest place to have to go to. Didn't like the way the waiters acted with my group and I wouldn't go back unless someone asked for it specifically
address: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Simple Italian food highly decorated restaurant but the food is just okay Really nothing special
While the space is really nice I found it extremely noisy, I had a hard time having a normal conversation in the space.
too noisy...like a street market
This place stared off great when it opened but honestly the service isnt the same anymore, and i hate to say it: the food, too.

50/50 in my opinion, the lack of more stars is because I have never been there and when I can in, I didnt know where to go, and was a little lost and staff made eye contact but just walked by and ignored me

Good atmosphere, Good Service, Good food. Nothing spectacular or unforgettable. People might like it because it is a chic and cute atmosphere. Don't get me wrong, they are good. But, you may find this kind of food in almost every city. Thank you and enjoy!
cool store but not sure why it's so crowded - this is just overpriced items that taste very average to me. Will definitely not come back to fight the crowds for more
Nice place~ many choices for dessert, but to me, it's too noisy, and the food worths only 3 stars...

Overall this place looks really good but unfortunately the quality is not on par with the looks. They totally copied La Duree for the design of their boxes, and displays but lack the quality of the food served there. If you don't know how to make a macaroon then don't make it!
It's alright. None if the main dishes are very special, but the pastries are tasty. good atmosphere, but their food is cold most of the times.
meh ok idkmmmmhhhok !boring
the french crepe was great! Good food
Food is great, servers are nice. The pasteries are great. The room is very open and it gets very loud!
kind of overrated. macaroons are good though.
I don't understand the hipe around this place. It looks cute and french and all. Not the food, not the dessert, nothing is outstanding.

I have to say the food was amazing my service on the other was awful! It was 25 min after the hostess seated me and I had to ask to get services before anyone even brought me water. I did say something to the waitress about her service. She did apologize but the service never got better.  A great place if you have plenty of time to wait. The pastries are incredible!

Bottega Louie is top quality if you ask me. Cost of their food is inexpensive and you don't wait very long for your food. There is parking available and their location is easy to find. Staff is a different story. They don't come over to you when you need them. They Just ignore you.
the food is really good but the employee's (except servers) are really not good lolI get that it's LA and you're tired but it's not good at all

Had an ok experience! Not thrilled but I would go back to give them another shot. After living in this town for over 15 years I finally decided to explore the culinary world downtown and wasn't truly impressed with our choices but maybe round 2 will be better!

The food wasn't that good but the desserts were. The interior style was very "aesthetic" and very LA but it was just very overpriced and wasn't worth all the hype. The staff and service here was also very nice, but I was disappointed with the food overall.
The food was interesting, but the noise in this place was very off-putting for me.
Ahhh the food was cool. I'd probably go back.

I've had their salads, macarons, assorted cakes and desserts- they all taste OK, nothing special as everyone makes it. I just can't fathom dragging my butt in the middle of DT for anything at all, really.

The place looks fancy, I won't deny that. But the service once you get a table is a little bit disappointing. I waited for so long and for what? Tiny portions that cost a lot of money. There are a bunch of places around that on my opinion are worthier. I don't want to sound as a dummy, the food was good, but they should try to feed you better. Isn't it the idea when you go out to have a meal leave with a fool belly?
The restaurant is very good, the pizza are amazing but the macaroons aren't tasty. The pastry are good too but very very expensive.

Good food, nothing that screams "I need a Michelin Star", but lively atmosphere. A bit pricey and the place is LOUD so expect to be shouting all night. I've come here for brunch when the place is half empty and it's still loud.
The tiramisu is not worth $14. I've had better tiramisu.Fried portobello is good though.

I've been here a couple of times for dinner and it is always pack. The food is good but not exceptional. I dont think it is worth the wait. The place is huge compared to the restaurants in the area. They sell a bunch of pastries, breads, olive oil and other food for to-go. If you want to pick up something to eat and dont want to wait for dine in. I think the staff should be managed a little bit better. After waiting for close to a hour, I would expect quicker service. It took a while for them to get me my drinks and to order my meal. I think I got there at 7pm one time and I didnt see my food till almost 9pm. (BTW this happened 2 times and I only been there 2 times) I think this is not the place to take a girl on a date because it can get a little noisy inside. It's not a bad place to hang out with a few buddies and grab a slice of pizza.

It's a classic for a reason. Definitely not the place I would seek out on a regular basis, but I love taking people down here who are in from out of town. Particularly if they are fans of pastry. Simply put: the patisserie here is impeccable, and it goes far beyond the maracons (though they are delightful, especially the earl grey). If possible, visit during a weekday as the brunch will have you waiting for a long time.
I had a very pleasant experience here.  There were some people that were rude but that is no reflection on the business.  I am simply sharing my experience

Last time I was here,  the wait was long and the food wasn't as I had expected. We ordered pizza and portobello mushroom fries. I have to say the portobello mushroom fries were good but too greasy and the pizza was just all-right.
Much too loud to hold a conversation. Good if you want to stop in a get a dessert to go.
Classic tourist trap. Absurdly expensive for what you get.Forget about it.

The make the dough and fire up the pizza in house and fresh.  Macarons - Rose and violet cassis were my favorites. It tastes better after you refrigerate them and then leave at room temperature to eat.
Over rated, good food, over priced.  Sorry so many other wonderful places to go.
the sweet, beautiful girl this place was named after. Loved that this is a family run place!
Great food . CUstomer service is really slow. But I get it there was many people so cant accomodat everyone. But they have the best macaroons.

Food Is good, parking in downtown is not cheap, average parking rate is $10 to $15 and what's up with the 4% Benefit Surcharge on my bill, it says To Defray the increased costs of wages and benefit, what's next ? are we going to pay more for there increased rent and utility bills.

The wait for our food was extremely long. Then when the lemon ricotta pancakes arrived, they were cold. The hostesses were very friendly and pleasant. My server was absent. He came to take the order and that was it. The bus boy was more attentive. And it was my first time there we weren't impressed. I might try once more but seems highly overrated
Very nice atmosphere.  However, food was just average.  Nice selection of desserts.

First time coming here. Came here after watching a Laker game. Heard so much about their tortufa pizza and had to check it out. I didnt realize how high end it was!! I felt super underdressed with just jeans and a Kobe jersey. Lol anyways this place is HUGE!! Hella packed too
Went for brunch and Loved the ambience but food was subpar. Great baked goods and cocktails but was disappointed in my main mean

I've tried this place a few times and can't seem to love it like so many of my friends. I find it a little overrated. The service is decent, I feel like it depends on which day you go. Some days it's great and some days I feel like I'm putting out my server. I haven't had anything that blew me away! I've tried the pizza, pasta, desserts and was left uninspired by it all. The interior design is beautiful and I love the atmosphere, but that's about it. I recommend trying it. I find people either love it or "kinda like it"
address: Northeast Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Great date spot! The food is good. The service and ambiance is great! I've been here on many occasions. It does get very busy, so I recommend making a reservation for lunch.

the pork & lamb chops are good but the grilled marks are not brown it's black - hate black - cancer causing the cookies are pretty but still perfer the chocolate chip cookie of papa john's the brownies & cakes are good but would perfer dark belgium - 80+% cocoawill go again - love the interior much

My wife loves this place & I like to take her. I like their savory foods but we really go for their sweets. My wife will stand at their counter or a good 30 minutes just in awe of their displays. We have to buy separate macaroons because she won't share & I won't either! We've been going for 2 years now. Great place.
It's a very nice looking place, but the food is a bit over priced for quick lunch during the week.
Tasty, I suppose, but rather overrated.

Delicious desert, fun ambiance, overly popular. Bad place for romantic dinner or a chat. Enter, order food really loudly, do not attempt to talk with your companion, just eat, and get out. I like Bottega Louie desserts, but not the venue.

It isn't my favorite place in town, but pizzas and desserts here are pretty good. The atmosphere is pretty noisy but I really enjoyed the vaulted ceilings at this place. Waiters were fast and courteous.

Quality has deteriorated quite a bit and prices increased. I've eaten there a few times and while the food is mostly tasty, the price is a little on the high end for what you get. The short ribs are my favorite from there.

At first i thought this place was very nice with the interior design and how spacious it was, when we went inside it was nothing like looking at it from the window. it was pack, and we waited awhile to be seated i wasn't really too impress with the macaroons. i prefer the ones in Paris.

Now I must say I have been a fan of this place for a very long time. But the last time I went it just wasn't that great.The service was OK.I wont lie the food is good and I most likely would be back.Next time!
Fun once in a while:) Eat too much and you will end up like the fat German kid from Willy Wonka:)

eh im not a macaroon fan but people say they are amazing so i tried it. they are open until 2am which is a plus for someone ... but i def would not go here for that sweet tooth.. their earl grey and dark chocolate ones were a little better than the other flavors.. waste of money but the selfie was worth it.

It's ok. A little pompous. Cool architecture. Some unique dishes but the taste and portions are lacking. Very expensive. Getting a table is a strange disorganized experience. Your first time you'll likely wonder around the crowded place or stand in the pastry line. Instead your supposed to walk to the middle too put your name on a list. Confusing theme. Is it Italian French American? I guess... Stick to something and get good at it.
It's a cool looking setting with average food and good dessert.
I thought this place was a little pricey but the macaroons were delicious. Service was friendly, I will be back to sample more macaroons.
Food liked, did not like the service.Service 3 *Interior 4 *Food 3 *
great stuff.good selection. tasty.

We came here from a friend recommendation. I have to say the interior is very nice - spacious, high ceiling and modern. The food is what disappointed us. I guess because we expect too much from the look and the price of a higher class restaurant. The bakery section look very impressive but we were reluctant to try as the food was not up to bar.
