I've never been too impressed by Bottega. I'm not really sure what the hype is. However, you can't leave without getting the macaroons. Those are deginietley the best part of the eperience.
a little noisy but good food.
The pizzas are great , salads a little bit over dressed but over all a great experience.
It's def an experience. Place is pretty amazing. If you are downtown, oput it on your list.
the cakes are good but it is incredibly expensive!
Excellent food. Fast service and at a reasonable price. The employees were very friendly.

Came here several times, still was not impressed. Sandwich was ok, but the Napolean and eclaires were NOT fresh, even though they charge $4.95 per piece. The dough is hard and chewy, cream is not a bit sour. The best part was the display.  The look is much better than the actual taste!
pas mal.

Love the ambiance but definitely overpriced. I've been there thinking second time around, ordering different dessert will blow away my flavor palete but it really didn't. Hard to find parking, expensive but trendy!

The chicken sandwich was amazing!! We started off with their popular fries and they were pretty good. My friend had the burger and said to definitely get it next time, which I will. However I was super happy with my chicken sandwich, it was perfectly cooked (not dry at all) and all the added toppings inside went so well together.
Came in to get Macroons but they were overpriced.

I found the food was good, but not excellent. The building architecture is what is impressive. It's marble and very open. The problem with this is that there is not a way to contain the sound. It's incredibly loud. I could barely hear my wife over our night out. It kind of ruined the vibe for any romance over dinner. When you're shouting at each other to be heard it ruins the sexy vibe, if you know what I mean.
A bit overprice!   Great ambiance.

Ok, this place is really nice. Service is pleasant, not amazing and not bad. However, this place is always packed regardless of the day. They have really good pizzas and macaroons! They are amazing! Also, very good place to stop by and have a cocktail with bread and butter! The rest of the food isn't something that I care for. Overall, its a good place to stop by for macaroons and cocktails. Not really caring for the dinner and the options provided.

What sold me was the CHOCOLATE SOUFFLÉ, it is a MUST. Definitely worth the 20 minutes, maybe try to tell them you want to order it ahead of time so they can have it ready. I love the lava cake from Chillis (I know... I am basic), but this is in an entirely different league! The cake is so soft you can barely taste the chocolate but it combined with Crème Anglaise to make it amazingly good.
Ambience and service is fine but I wouldn't say that the food is great. It is ok to there for a change of atmosphere but you won't think the food is good.
okok
Nice food, but really, really, really, really, really loud.
It was okay
The macaroons are delicious but so over priced. The atmosphere is really lovely though, but good luck with finding parking.
Came here for lunch. The waitress forgot to put our order in so our lunch turned into 2hours.

I don't get what the big deal is about this place.  For Italian food I prefer Macaroni Republic in DTLA on Broadway.  Bottega Louie is very loud, trendy, hip, the view of the turn-of-the-century architecture outside their windows is quite nice and a conversation starter.  The food is more than adequate just not outstanding.  There is some sort of Euro deli where you can buy charcuterie, cheeses and French macaroons.  People who care less about their palate and more about being in a cool, well-known place I send here.

Many friends were telling me to come here. The place and atmosphere was cool. But I was expecting much better food and service. The dessert was the highlight. I may try it again or not. I am not too sure yet.

Their food is extremely good. Beware though: they will refuse to serve you if you're not dressed in business casual or more formal. Went here alone, with a small group of women friends, and in a group of friends from culinary school (from all walks of life). They refused to serve us in the latter group. Be careful.
Great place. I think it's worth the trip.
Good food.  Great atmosphere
Very average everything except for the macaroons. Did not live up to the hype!

This place is always solid, but not always worth the wait Its very crowded and the front desk staff can be a little snobbish. Its definately a place to go check out if you have never been, but not somewhere i frequent. There are a lot of great places in downtown.
It's a good place and I would go back more often, but I don't like that they don't take reservations.
I only tried their macarons but it wasn't as good as I expected.

I ordered pasta (orecchiette) and it was Ok. Nothing special. Portion was very small, flavor kinda plain and service mediocre. I would go back if the dish was like $10-$15 or something but it was over $20 so I don't think I am going back.
Food is good, but ridiculously loud.  Too noisy to ever go back.

The place is very eye friendly. Beautiful decor, nice/clean servers and the dessert area is truly remarkable. However, the food was way below expectation. Had the cioppino, crab beignettes and spaghetti bolognese. Decent but not up to par in comparison to other restaurants with the same average ticket price.
Food not that good,no flavor,service not good either,3 stars only for bakery,cakes are good and macaroons!!
Plan on waiting for an hour to be seated.  Food is good but not worth the wait.  Service is hit or miss
Good food but typical LA service. Felt a little rushed out. I know they wanted to turn the tables quickly.
The portions are kind of small to my taste.The service is OK and the order arrived quickly. Everything is a bit overpriced though.Overall, Just OK...
very clean and nice place I say! And their Pastries such lovely to look at like I dont wanna eat them but once you get to taste..it was Awesome!! I wanna live here inside lol
Nothing special. 1 star for the building. 1 star for the food. 1 star for free water. Nothing special
Very expensive! no parking and always full.
Fun and delicious. But loud and crowded at times as well.

This is an overall O-K place to dine at. I absolutely love their sweets, especially the princess cake. Th princess cake has a macaroon on the bottom and it tastes great! Although, when I dined here, I found their service and food to be bad. I did not like their foods; I got a pizza and it tasted very bad in my opinion. Their portions are also very small compared to the prices they have. The only reason I come here is to eat their desserts, but I do not recommend to dine there.
amazing place. loved it!
I would have given 5 stars for the macarons, except that when I got home, there were only 5 macarons and not the 6 I paid for.
The place is great! The people are great! Just do not like the texture of some of the sweets!
Good food but I wait too long, was waiting with my girlfriend for like 30mins.
It's good. Not great. Not exciting. Not worth what you pay for. But it is good, clean, and worth a visit every now and then.

So, so, so unspectacular.Pretty cool place to visit and see once but this food is just not good. The entrees, the salads, and the desserts - all of them are average.I always wanted to come here and now I'm disappointed that I did. In full disclosure, I'm not a big macaroon fan, so it is possible that those are great. I wouldn't know and I won't be back to find out.
Way too noisy.
Service was greae but food is not!Stay away from the hangar steak.Pizza is food And so is salads...
wait there twice at the weekend. It is hard to get a table
average. not bad not great
3-star for over rated overpriced macaroon. Seriously Bouchon has better ones.5- star for the ambience tho.2-star for the parking, its actually non-existent.
Pretty good. Over-priced, for what it is. I've had better. But it's cute.
Decent Food...Too Loud
Pretty expensive even for downtown. Nice place though with good eats.
Super good, super expensive and beautifully presented and fun to go.  It's tough to be a regular at this place cause it's so expensive.  I have to ban myself even though I'd love to eat there more.
What was all that hype about?

I have yet to try the actual food, but I'd say I enjoyed the macarons. I got the 5 flavor packet, which was pricey and as expected. I think the only reason why bottega's macarons are so highly praised is for the creative flavors and the fancy packaging. Sorry but I dont think I would buy again. Be back for the food!!

Used to be a five star restaurant over the years it's sort of dwindled down. The atmosphere is great and the pastry section is just awesome goodness. For italian, i'll pass. Go to Drago instead unless you want the hype of Bottega.
hello how has your weekend been?????

I find Bottega Louie the absolute cutest place! From ideas, to decoration, to being creative with the choice in food overall. I just feel that it may be over rated as far as taste. The scenary is really cool, I just wouldn't go to eat because I'm hungry or because its good catering.
its really great as i experienced
The thing that ruins this restaurant for me is that it sounds like an overly noisy cafeteria!
Noisy, crowded and the quality of food used to be better.
their food is very good and service is ok. very loud so be prepared!

Kinda expensive for what you get.  The prices were better when this place first opened.  It's kinda loud cause the ceilings are high and no separation between the tables.  Not an ideal place to take your date but a cool spot to go with a group of friends.  Oh wait, might be hard getting a big table because this place is always packed.  Plan on waiting at least 20 minutes.  Grab a drink at the bar while you wait.  Service is friendly enough.  The Portobello mushroom fries are tasty with the sauce.  Mushroom pizza is also a good choice.  No opinion on the wine because I don't drink.  Designated driver and all.  :)
Food is different and quite good, BUT TOOOOOO loud.

Food was really quite good, as was the service. But it's so hip and busy, that it's really hard to have a conversation, and we came with friends that we only really get to see once a year so we'll be smarter about picking out a place next year. It has to do with the acoustics as well, given the type of building it is and the way they've chosen to furnish and decorate it. It's a beautiful place to look at, though, esp. with all those lovely macaroons!!!!
Overrated. Nice atmosphere, high prices

nice, fancy place, but a little extravagant. this is a place for people who have money to burn--the buff and the beautiful--maybe a little bit of that could go towards one of the many good causes out there in the world
A little on the pricey side for me!  But definitely gets the job done
Food is good but not great. Would taste better if it was hot like its supposed to be. The beignets are really good but the other desserts are just ok.
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere. Ver loud inside and foods are overpriced. Expect to wait more than 1 hour.
Fantastic
Food is ok compared to the selection in DTLA nowadays. They need to work on their sound proofing! I always feel like I'm in a high school cafeteria.
Food was good but the restaurant was very noisy!  Too loud to converse!
This place is all hype. It was so salty, me and the food. The food is mediocre at best.
Menu quite limited for vegetarians & Menu never changes.
The place is great lots of pretty things to look at , down side its very crowded ! the pizza was great and mostly i enjoyed the service thank you guys def will see you next time in dtla!!!
pasta is plain
An Alright place
Food is okay, but not good enough for the prices.
Great food, just too damn noisy.
oh so delicious.
Horribly crowded and not worth the wait.
nice for an afternoon. good food nice service

Kind of expensive. Food is pretty bland. But it is definitely worth looking at. Nothing like this exists anywhere else in Los Angeles. If you've never been here, give it a shot. Just don't expect the best meal of your life. Or the cheapest.
Great looking place but the food was ok I had there macaroons they where great service is good to

I just dont get why this place is so popular. Sure the food is good ish, but the wait is super long, its in a really busy area, and the servers are average.There are many places that i would prefer. We got the brussel sprouts last time and they were ok. Make sure you get a pizza and try a pastry!
Steak was mediocre to be honest
My food was cold and out of 5 of us all ordering something different the lasagna was the best! Not worth the wait!
Feels a bit like Disneyland to me.
The food was good, but not memorable. The service was sub par. I would come back here for the desserts. The macarons are amazing. Expensive, but amazing.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in downtown.  But lately, it's gone downhill, to the point that it's dropped off of my top places to eat in LA.  For one, quality control has gone WAY down.  Recently, my pasta came out uneven/cold and hard.  The flavors were off and you could tell it was rushed.  The best things there still are the macaroons! I love their boxes.
This was a great experience.
Nice place to buy bottega
Food has started to suck lately. Quality has just went down unfortunately. Their bread remains the same, thankfully!!! Their desserts are beautiful and their macs are just amazing.
LOVE their dessert.However, the place is way too loud that i cannot hear the conversation i am having with my partner.The food is good and dessert is good but atmosphere is not so good.
A OK entree.  Only came here for the pastries.
Nice but expensive!
romantic space...pizza is awesome..
Not too bad, a little loud but it's ok....
The food is decent in here. But it has a very lively environment; this is a great place for business meetings.
Meh
i love the bread their service is good they need to work on their cleaning a bit more
Too much of a hype, the food was good tho, I will give them that much
just ok.
There's too much hype for their food... I would suggest brunch more than dinner. But their macarons are definitely one of the best. It's worth it.
Very sex in the city! Love the macaroons. The food it alright. Service is spot on! Will definately come back!

Decent food.  I tried a wide variety of the menu here.  Worth visiting once, more than that your either have money to burn, you want to look good in the building, or you've never tasted these dishes anywhere else.I was just slightly disappointed, due to the fact that this place that this place is in a premier spot in LA, and I got meh food.  Nevermind the ten bucks I paid in parking.

Restaurant is BEAUTIFUL and very unique. The food is good, not great, but good. The only problem I had was when both my friend and I ordered Salmon Benedicts for brunch. They came at the same time, hers with 4 pieces of salmon and mine with literally-one. I asked the waiter to look at it and give me more so he brought me one more piece in a cup. Ok, fine. I'll deal with it, but then he had the nerve to charge me $4 for it!!! When i told him, he was super rude about it and was like "what do you want me to do?" but as soon as the manager coincidently walked in our direction, he decided to change his tone. Super rude waiter. Otherwise, cool place, a must see for LA locals.
Good food. Too loud.

3.5 Stars . Great place I totally adore it. I always come here for the atmosphere and deserts. I lowered the ratings since the food is very so so at the most. I don't mind paying their price but please fix the food, we tried couple entrées one of them was sea bass which was watery tasteless and more like a fast-food taste rather than a restaurant. Service is great here and I really liked our waiter. deserts are my favorites here, macaroons as advertised, I love em! thank you and pretty please fix the food ;)
I like the food and the coffee, but its to loud.  The to go sandwiches are really good.
this  place was nice and all but didnt satisfy
Over rated. Do not get the lobster bisque. The portions are very small!
hmmmm..... it's A-OK! :)
Used to live close by - bakery great. Noisy and can get very crowded. But a good place to go downtown.
Thank you loves your service!

Bottega Louie is listed as offering gluten-free menu, but, the menu is limited. The ambiance is 'cool and funky' but it was very hard to carry on a conversation. It is very loud and echo-ey. The food and presentation was excellent and met my expectations of a trendy restaurant in downtown LA.
Macaroons are good. But honestly way too overpriced for me!
I really like the people who work here.

It's so loud in here, it's really difficult to even hear the person directly across the table from you.  Nonetheless, this place is constantly packed, so something must be working for them.  The food has always been just fine, but never worth the wait.

I wish I liked this place more than I do.  Its beautiful and the pastries are beautiful.  I really like their Louie Salad and its fun to share the small plates with your friends.  The biggest problem is that it is so loud in the restaurant.  I can't hear what anyone is saying.  Its pretty much unbearable.  You should come here if you have to eat dinner with  your weird cousin who talks to much.
Good food but noisy atmosphere.
Pretty Colors
Love the dessert windows! food is ok.  Will still go for ambiance.

Not knocking the service because it did exist despite the hustle and bustle for this place. The cost for brunch is absurd. Maybe if it was a little more special I wouldn't complain. Maybe I didn't eat the right things (oatmeal and lemon ricotta pancakes), but still a hefty price tag. Not to mention the robustness of this restaurant. It is loud. I mean very loud. Overall the place is okay. I would not go back for brunch. Maybe to try the pizza.
Cute place but foood is not verygood. I like their macaroons though! The choxolte is very yummy! Good for gifts for family etc. Good for girls brunches!! Yay
havent tried all but the macaroons are good
it was good
Nice restaurant in the middle of downtown la. Food is good. Pastries look good but was a little disappointed with my choices.
Overrated, and to crowed.
Nothing special...and unfortunately I do not like Macaroons. They look awesome but not for me.
No comment
Overpriced.  The selection of sweets is huge but nothing really exciting.  But they do have a scrambled egg dish that will change your life.
A very hip place. Beautiful interior and big crowds. The food is expensive and not that great. It's a good 'looker' spot and that's about it.
Been here a number of times, but really, it's too crowded and noisy to enjoy.
Good Food. Terrible Noise.

Pretty good food. Always a solid meal. It is just SO damn loud. You can't go here to talk. The place is very pretty and happening. I made the mistake of taking a client here for a meeting. Food was good but we couldn't talk. We had to go for a drink after just to get the meeting done. Luckily downtown is filled with great places now. Lots of good little bars and great restaurants. I actually lived in a loft close by for 8 months and when you are dinning alone this is a great place.
I came here and tried the pasta dish it was ok.
good
good
Nice place. A bit overrated from the taste stand point.
food has been hit and miss but the desserts amaze
Nice ambiance and the food is pretty good!
expensive, it was ok. food was good, service took for ever!!!!
Awesome food.....but takes a long time to get seated.....very popular place

This is a beautiful cafe! The pastry case is filled with  little works of art that look better than they taste.  It can get really loud and crowded at times, but still not a bad place to go if you're in the area. The pizza is pretty decent, but the Kobe burger was good but not the best I've had.Overall, a nice, cool place to go for lunch or dinner when you're DTLA
Loud for the cost, but food is great.
It's a nice place, with tons of food selection...anything to choose from but not made for older crowd. Many of the patrons are in their 20's, loud and there to be on their phones.
Food is just ok, ambience is WAY TOO LOUD.

I only come for the macarons, everything else was over priced and taste bad. The opera was dry, the hazelnut tart was dry... just dry. They were so dry that my friend and I threw it on the ground and they shattered.

Beautiful location and a perfect confectionery presentation if you love desserts. Each of my visits to Bottega have been a little disappointing due to the slow service and the food falling short.It is a hangout spot and the bar is fun, if you are into  bar scenes.If you are hungry its probably not the best choice, small portions leave you feeling and wanting more.The overall presentation is on point and I would recommend Bottega for a first date or a business meeting as the food is not the main focus or shouldn't be for these types of situations.

Pastries yes.  Food.....its OK now.  This use to be the spot 3 years ago.  Now its a cesspool of tourists.  Loosing the charm.  But hey, the macaroons are great what can I say.  The price is $$$$ for a pastry, but the quality is there so worth it.
Just tried the macarons. But will not go and pay for parking just to get this. Will just get it from another shop.

I expected more from this restaurant. My family and I came here for my cousins birthday. I brought in a cake prior to my cousins arrival and asked the hostess to give to our server. It was a weekday, so the restaurant wasn't too busy yet the service was a little off. The end of the meal is upon us and awaiting the arrival of the cake we bought to come out. But instead of our cake making it's grand entrance, the server brings out some not so appealing chocolate blob. The surprise was ruined, as we had to remind the server in front of my cousin that we had brought our own dessert. He promptly blamed the hostess and we were on our way to singing a Happy Birthday encore. All in all, not the best experience.
good but noisypizza are greatbut unfortunatly there is no saoul in this place, it is when a regular pizza place  takes places at Laduree from Paris.
First foremost I absolutely love sporting community bushiness and I really wants d to give the 5 stars  especially after reading the great revives
Warm greeting, good service, hit or miss food, horrible acoustics!

I had their linguini pasta, a Margarita Pizza, and a couple of drinks...The food wasnt very good the pizza dough was kind of weird for my taste.My linguini didnt seem very fresh and I've had much better linguini at marias kitchen.However if you are looking to take your friends somewhere with a great atmosphere this is the place to go to!

Dining out on a Sat. p.m. is always risky and this restaurant posed the added risk of being "popular". We arrived early enough to snag a table rather quickly. That was the only "quick" thing the whole evening. But, there is a difference between not rushing service and slow service. The idea of a leisurely meal is to enjoy company and it's difficult to carry on a conversation in this place. Reviewers have pointed this out and they are right. I would have been willing to over look the noise if the food had been fabulous, but it wasn't that good. I hope they work over this.
Overrated and extremely loud.

This place is so popular! And just a few words sum up the experience - Portobello Mushroom Fries! These were the best part and the saving grace for this spot.Entering to a wall of desserts and maccorons with the high ceilings and busy atmosphere, it couldn't be bad.  But this place was rather disappointing. Service was slow. We had a mixup with the order, in which the server said "No, you said (enter wrong dish)" after we had brought it up to her. No sense of being polite or anything which really irked me. One person asked to clarify if the sparkling water was complimentary and she looked at us and responded like we were idiots. I ordered the belgian waffles which I expected to come with a bunch of fruit, but it was two huge waffles and just a small handful of berries. The cream that came with it was the only thing that got me through the dish. We could tell later on that the waitress was trying to make up for her rudeness by trying to be nice to us but it was already too late. If it wasn't for the portobello fries this place would've been 2 stars for me.Others in my group enjoyed the eggs benedict though so fyi maybe the dishes are hit or miss.

I know this place get super crowded, but when I went there, the food was only "OK" - it was a bit oily and it basically took nearly 2 hours for us to get our food and eat.  It was just too packed.  I am sure it would have been more fun if I had been in the mood for it, but we just wanted to eat and go, and it took forever.

Overrated, but still good.I don't love eating in the actually venue (good god it's loud and stark white!), but I LOVE the to go market.  The little sandwiches are damn good, as are all the baked goods.  The only problem?  When I order a bottle of water to bring with me, it costs like $6!!!Favorite thing in the whole place - the ham and cheese sandwich in the to go mart.  Get it!
The macaroons here are nothing to rave about. They were ok~~
its pretty, but it's too loud. the macaroons are nothing special.
Nice huge place but so damn loud!  Voice echoing everywhere but nice place :)  wear ear plugs

OK, so the place looks great from the street.The desserts at the counter are gorgeous.The food at the table is good, but really nothing compelling.Again, the desserts - grab some on your way out..they are not why you would go, but they should be.Service is above average.I/we will be back in hopes o better treats at the table.Side note: HOW DOES ANY ONE RESTAURANT GET THIS MANY REVIEWS?
Good place to eat downtown.
Too expensive and too loud.  Food is great.
too loud.  Can't hear anything.
Honest food, Nice place but way too loud!
This place was ok ...a lil pricey...
just o.k

This is one of the trendiest restaurants in the "new" Downtown LA. The patrons are young and hip and the location is perfect. However, this converted bank has such a bad acoustic that you can't hear yourself, let along your table mates. The food selection is very limited in selection and presentation, but very expensive in price. Come for the desert, but skip the main dish.
Love their desserts! but the food isn't that good. a little too pricey

Bottega Louie is really okay. it's pretty delicious, but super pricey. I went there on a Sunday and the place was packed. If you're into New York style branches this might be the LA spot. For me it's worth checking it out once for the experience, and maybe going there again. I wouldn't make it a regular habit, though.
Nice clean atmosphere, but their food isn't that good. friendly workers and pretty good desserts though!

While walking by I saw the sweets that they had from the window & could not pass by without trying some.They have lots of delicious looking desserts, I got one of the chocolate filled doughnut hole looking things, and a macaron. It was good but nothing to rave about. It looked much better than it tasted. Overall I think this place is too crowded and over priced.

A five on the food. I recommend the pastries for take-out. ...they are BEAUTIFUL and delicious! This is one of loudest restaurants I have ever been to in my life. I sure wish they would bring in a sound engineer....but they seem to be quite successful without great appeal to all the senses.

We stopped by for cake and coffee and in the morning, and it was really great. So much so that we went for an early supper later in the day and it was not so great. One of party ordered the lasagna, which arrived cold, and on a cold plate. it was returned and a hot one promised. But it did not arrive until everyone else had finished eating, and even then the replacement was lukewarm, and again on a cold plate.

This place looks amazing! The multi- colored displays of desserts can set your mouth on drool. Then you are in there for a bit and notice How cold it is. Then How noisy it is. Then How long you are waiting. Then How mediocre the food is. The ideas here are intriguing but the execution is off. Too greasy sometimes and others just boring. The pizza is good but I can get better experiences and just as tasty pizza elsewhere.

I would say 4 stars, but the prices are a bit high.  I do love the large dining area, high ceilings, and the friendly wait staff, but the food is not on par with Little Dom's and the pricing is higher. If you're stuck downtown and need something tasty, go here, I wouldn't recommend this place as an actual destination, though. I had the pork chop and it was good, but I felt like it was about $5 bucks over priced. I'd go back, but I wouldn't lead the charge.
Capuchinno was  good.

This is one of the trendiest restaurants in the "new" Downtown LA. The patrons are young and hip and the location is perfect. However, this converted bank has such a bad acoustic that you can't hear yourself, let along your table mates. The food selection is very limited in selection and presentation, but very expensive in price. Come for the desert, but skip the main dish.
really good atmosphere with lover.their bakeries are good but kinda noisy for dine in and hard to talk with friends.

I went to this location for my birthday, and the wait was about 2 hours for a saturday night.this was partly my fault because reservations were not made :(......other than that-water in clear containers-cool!-bread and butter-great!-the meal-yummers!!
Great baked goods!
tasty but portions on some of the menu items are very small and I'm not a big eater!
ok food
I had the chicken plate. It was ok, but not so great.
The food is okay. I wasnt as blown away as the other yelpers. Howeveer, please be warned the pastry was expensive. The environment was good. I am not sure if I would return.
Not bad of a place for a dinner for two, but the wait is ridiculous! and it is way to loud in there. overall the food is reasonable.
Had brunch have to wait 1h for the table the place is very elegant and big if wasn't for the wait the food is really good
food is great its veggie so its healthy.......even thou its on top of the pizza :) yummy

love the place - the pastries are probably the best I ever had - but the restaurant is very noisy - they should really do something about that by simply using draperies or art on the wall (which by the way are cold as nothing is hanging there)
An Average .
Only here for their macarons and portobello fries, other dishes were alright - nothing special
This place is pretty loud but the food is good.
Just okay. I do not understand the hype. It reminds of cafeterias I would go to with my grandmother.
Over priced, slow service.
Great food, very noisy, slow service, but overall a cool spot
Food was good, extremely loud makes it hard to talk with your inside voice.

Came here with my boyfriend yesterday, we ordered margherita pizza and italian salad first, but they served us pizza with something called caesar, i didnt know why? although pizza's good but we was not satisfied with our dinner. i'm not sure to give them one more time.
Too loud.
A lot of people, but the taste of the food is good, I like it!
Just ok.Pasta's are good.
Yummmmmmmm! But I gotta say, they need to start taking reservations. Thanks
Decent pizzas and overall ok food. The white marble with the gold trimmings is simply stunning, but the noise is on par with any typical high school cafeteria.
yummy foods.
Too Loud!

Very nice looking on the inside, big open space, clean, good ambiance and a good crowed. The food is good, but not all that it's raved about. It could get very noisy at times, and depends on what you order it could also be a little too pricey. It's more of a clubbing or going out experience than really a dining one.

Love the food, hate the restaurant.  the food is quite good, and the dessert is out of this world.  But dont come here if you want to talk and able to hear what your friends are saying to you.  Came with my wife and another couple, and we love the food, but our conversation the whole night was, "what did you say"...

Very nice place to go to. I like they way it's designed in the inside everything is white. I went in there to have breakfast and the food was ok, maybe I need to try the rest of the menu in order to give any more stars. I'll go back soon to give it another try.
Food is good but, very noisy.
Nice atmosphere. Okay food (brunch).

it will always be in my opinion such a great place to grab a drink with a larger group of people. I think its sad though that in the past few years the food quality has gone to shit, maybe too many orders or not enough service
over rated in my opinion. brunch was about $75 w/o drinks for 2. the pastries are good though.

The food was outstanding. They have amazing salads. I loved my caesar. Sparkling water included in the meal was a nice touch. Scallop appetizer was perfecly cooked and seasoned.Price was reasonable.Pastries looked incredible, but we did not sample them.Atmosphere was upbeat. Very noisy and fun. Love the open kitchen and chefs seemed like artists at their trade. Food reflected a well run creative kitchen.Service. Not up to par with the price. I understand great food takes time to prepare, but how about the water? Bus boy seemed to have great hussle, but waiter seemed bored and took a long time to take our order. He did not seem excited about the food. And here is a place any waiter should be really excited about the cuisine. French fries were average and price was $9 for a side of fries. The whole concept of this place is great... atmosphere, location, fantastic food. Not sure why they can't get the service part together.
their breakfast is okay, not the best I've had for sure.
Love their pastry section. I can't get myself to go here often because it's so loud and I find it hard to have a conversation.

This is an amazing space with great food but it has two big problems, at least for me. One is that they don't take reservations and there can be a really long line when you go. Two, it is so darn noisy in that place you can barely have a conversation. The problem is that the beautiful marble that they have everywhere (which looks gorgeous btw) creates an echo chamber that can be deafening at times. It was really hard to hold a conversation with my partner at dinner. Because of that I probably won't go again.

Atmosphere was awesome but other than that, everything else was just OK.We got 2 pizzas, portobello fries and clam linguini. Pizzas were fresh but nothing that special compared to other brick oven pizza joints.Portobello fries on the other hand was really unique, hearty and flavorful. Definitely a must.Then back to the sub-par linguini. Not much to say other then meah.Service was pretty bad, our waitress seemed to not care at all and was just pouring water into the cups without picking up the glass so I had to move. Usually not a stickler about service but being a former server my self, I know when someone is trying to be rude. But everyone has a bad day so not that big of a deal, but just a warning.I mainly came here to get the macarons for friends and family, and everyone that received them from me loved it to death. But hoooolllyyy it is expensive. 13 piece box, 3x 5 piece box= around $80. Really pricey but the box it comes in is very presentable and it tastes good too I guess.Overpriced food in general IMOservice all around, not just the server but the hostess and the person in charge at the bakery could use some attitude adjustment.But nice decor.MEAH

Such a beautiful place but packed as hell.  This place is LOUD.  They have high ceilings and marbled floors.  As we walked up, the hostess wrote out brown shoulder LV bag and white blouse + 3 girls along with my name. 15 minutes later, another person found me and seated us.  I like the concept!  Makes you feel important. :)The gfs and I and had some drinks and some light finger foods - we ordered their yummy portobello fries and sausage pizza!  Both were outstanding.  The bread basket was good, too!  Service was a bit slow and it just took forever for our drinks and refills.On our way out, we picked up a few boxes of macarons and thought they were pretty good, but quite expensive for the quality.  This was my last meal in LA before leaving for NY.There is parking on the lot next to this restaurant.
Waaaaaay too loud in there. A little pricey, too.
So much for a fancy name... Dissapointed

this is a good place. The food is good and the service is good too, but there is this smell all around the place that makes you wanna leave it as soon as possible. Even though the place is nice and the food is good, they will only get 3 stars from me because of the smell.
Recomended

We have always enjoyedLouie's in the past.Was disappointed with our latest experience.Our server tried to "upsell" by telling us bigger or more expensive alternatives were preferable to each of our selections.The food itself came exactly as ordered though and was pleasant enough, but nothing special.The bill was about $135 per person.
long wait. no reservations. pizza was okay.
Overpriced. Not bad, just really overpriced.
expensive... ok food but atmosphere is what u look for then not here. but it is a beautiful place with great customer service. OVERPRICED, not a favorite
Enjoyed the almond muffin! but its a lack of parking around :(
Overrated and loud ...  But the desserts are good.
decent food cool atmospherecould be be betterbut hey im not complaining

I can start off by saying that I am giving this place 3 stars because of the price. I don't believe the food is worth what they charge.On the other hand, their macaroons are amazing. I ended up ordering the Affogato which was amazing.For dinner I ordered the Lasagna which was great but it was a small quantity for the price I paid. I will definitely be going back but not for their food, but for their macaroons.
A okay!
Can't complain..
It's loud

Tasty macarons, but the food here is just mediocre. It's a lot of hype in my opinion. But it's a nice location and service is alright too. I don't hate it but I can't say it's my favorite place for lunch or dinner.

It's a little too trendy and quite honestly, overhyped. The all-white Italian decor is beautiful. But it is just too loud :(  I think it is the type of place where someone who wishes to be seen by everyone goes. The food isn't anything to write home about. If I want Italian, I know where to get real Italian. The dessert section, I must admit, is pretty gorgeous. All the colorful maccaroons are a feast for the eyes, not so much the palate, but they are good... The eclairs, omg the eclairs are a little piece of heaven, both, the cherry & pistachio!!... LOVE

This place is a win/lose situation.Win: PORTOBELLO FRIES. Desserts galore.Lose: Loud, crowded, noisy, can't hear your date or have a proper conversation environment. The way the building is massively shaped creates the most incredible echo and sound wave frequencies imaginable. If I was at an orchestra concert it would be perfect. Unfortunately, I was there for dinner.It is good for big dinner parties where people just end up screaming over each other anyway I guess. But for an intimate dinner it is just too damn loud.Good food though.
I've been here a few times and it's worth going for the portobello fries and desserts.  The pastas were pretty good.  It's very noisy.
Great atmosphere and food love the fries
The Macaroons are on point.
address: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: izz okays.
Crowded, loud, mediocre.
decent meal, nice for downtown

To be honest, I would give it a higher score, but the service was completely horrible!The food was absolutely amazing! The pizza with the proscuitto was simply devine! The lasgna was truly delicious.  The server - he thought he was the best gift to Earth.  Didn't say a word to us, and we had to hunt him down for more water. He was apparently busy chit-chatting away with some girls instead. I guess he cared more about getting laid then making money.But the food was great!
Food is nothing special. Greasy. But the noise level is deafeningly loud.Difficult parking. I went with my family. I might like it if I was 25 years younger.
Decent food and fun atmosphere. However, the service overall was terrible. Heavily debateable if I will come back
Very noisy and hipster-y, but that is some times downtown LA for you!I love the macaroons myself.Parking can be challenging, be prepared!

The 3 stars is for their loud loud atmosphere in the restaurant 4 stars for the food tasting good. 5 stars solely for their macaroons!! Oh my the earl gray tea is the best! Only coming back for the macaroons!
foods great!! the wait is toooo long
They have the most reviews I have ever seen. The atmosphere is great but the food is nothing to write home about.
nothing special in this restaurant...

Given the number of great reviews I have to say I was expecting crazy good.  What I found was not bad to just OK.  Service was friendly but not remarkable.  Food was a mix of flavors and toppings that didn't work well together.  Then we get to the macaroons, which is the real reason I came here.  It's one of my weaknesses that I can't resist.  One of my favorite French indulgences.  But wait, is this a French restaurant?  Hmmm.  That's weird but OK, given the reviews I let that slide and ordered.  So, they were edible but not wonderful.  Kind of flat actually.  I've had way better but if you haven't tried as many as I have over the years then I'm sure you will think they are quite remarkable.  Personally, I wasn't impressed enough to say I'm coming back for more.

Portobello fries... I love! Everything else was meh.. Good but was not exactly impressed. Their pizza, I cannot recall which one, was disgusting. Couldn't even finish a slice and ended up just eating the crust because I didn't want to completely waste it. I am not a la native, so location was questionable and rather odd. The mood inside is rather great though.

Staff was very attentive and nice.  It was very busy and we still received great service.  Lamb chop was delicious and the lasagna was very good too.The desserts looked fantastic, but I was beyond full with the choices we had for dinner.It was very noisy and probably not ideal for an intimate setting.
The lady who helped me with my order was nice...so noisy and crowded...

decent food, decent price, very nice restaurant, but extremely loud. went here around 730 on a saturday night and it was just as noisy as a night club. i could barely hear my gf over the noise, definitely not a good place to take a first date. on to the food, my gf and i got the portobello fries,  pizza (half pepperoni, half burrata), calamari and the chocolate souffle. the fries were great. nice thick cuts of portobello with some sort of aioli dipping sauce. this dish was a little too hearty for both my gf and me. could only eat a few before getting tired of it, which isnt to say it wasnt good, but the taste of it gets old fast. the pizza was good not great. thin crust, minimal tomato sauce, good cheese, spicy pepperoni that being said i wouldnt come back for the pizza. the calamari was such a let down. the breading had this vinegary or something taste to it that made it not as pleasant as it should have been. the things worth coming for are the desserts, the chocolate souffle is made to order and comes out nice and risen. the waiter will ask if youd like to pour the sauce in yourself or if you want him to do it. the souffle is nice and moist and the cream sauce makes it amazing. on our way out we picked up some macaroons, ive never had them before and thought they were pretty good. strawberry and the green tea matcha were my favorites.

I went for the first time this week. Great space - love the decor. -  and the service was excellent. The food is good, but not outstanding. I'm not sure that it is worth the price. I will give it another try, maybe sit in the bar area instead.

The place is a hit or miss.. They're always inconsistent with their food. Do they have the same chefs and products here on the regular? Lol? Most of their entrees are okay, but not really worth what they're asking for. The desserts on the other hand are a completely different story! The restaurant itself is a bit of a 'try-hard' which lowers the rating in my eyes.
Food is good. But it is super high priced. $18 for a pizza????
Bottega louie was pretty good i loved there Pork Chop it was Well worth my money!
This place is trendy, but this is not a real Italian restaurant

We went there on a Tuesday night after work and was given a so-so experience. Our server kept calling us guys even though I was with my girlfriend. I really hate that! The food was very good but nothing to stand up and yell for more. The atmosphere was EXTREMELY loud and it was very hard to carry on a conversation. Maybe they should put some art or something on the wall to absorb the sound.

good for picking up food and chocolatesbad for dinner with a girl, super noisy. unless staring deep into the person's eyes is your thing.the good thing to order is the clam pizza. and thats about it folks :P

Worst part is getting here. I've got to go three stars for how hyped this is. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and the breakfast is good, but just okay.Its become more of a 'thing to do' here in LA. I don't think the food justifies the price, though the presentation is out of this world. The sugary stuff is da bomb (especially the macaroons). Come for dessert for sure. Portabello fries are something to try too.
Coffee is good egg sandwich is really good . Service has a way of making you not feel welcomed. Did prices go up?
We came downtown for this place from the Westside? Service with an attitude and mediocre food.

i really like this place a lot... especially the decor and the presentation of the food when they serve it to you. the prices are really reasonable and they also have amazing pastries and macaroons!! The restaurant is kinda loud though because of the high ceiling but it goes with the whole chic atmosphere.!! Everything about this restaurant is just right!
It's ok really. Kinda not worth it in the long run. Somewhat Decent Italian food.
This place is very noisy.  It's located downtown and parking is a pain.  Food was OK but maybe not worth it.  I would go elseware.
Bit too pricy and manager was rude, refused to give Veteran Discount.However I must say that their Pizza was terrific!If manager is gone i would come back anytime!

Dont understand the big hype. Food is just okay, and the wait is not worth it. I saw the regulars cutting hour long waits. Very not cool. The price is pretty cheap for downtown. But i left the place still hungry. Chicks hang out..

Fun, upbeat place. If you want a trendy place to get some darn good pizza, come here. It's got a nice feel for it. I had the Napoli and very nice. But they also have plenty of everything from pastas to salads. Enjoy.

I decided to give this place another try and it only went up to a 3.5 but still no 4 star. We went with a big group for a birthday and I was able to try quite a few dishes. SOUPS:Onion Gratinee: It was good, not great. The cheese wasn't melted but just a big chewy glob and it was a bit thick for me. Chicken Brodo:I originally ordered the Onion Gratinee and swapped it for this soup with Santa Tsai because I wanted something lighter,. it was just ok. Traditional chicken broth with dumpling type pasta. SALAD: Modena Salad: This was the best dish in my opinion of the bunch. Loved it! PIZZA: Margherita: It was good... but then again, how can you mess this up. Clam: It wasn't salty and pretty good. I would recommend and the rest of our group loved this. PASTA:Pappardell: Mushroom and truffle and I actually liked this a lot. But then again, I love the 2 main ingredients. Tagliatelle Bolognese: Again, I don't think you can mess this up so it was good. Hope that helps. For me, I've tried amazing pastas in New York so this was just okay. I will probably end up going back with a group but I will not be the one to suggest it. Must say that this place does have a great vibe as it was bustling and lively on a Saturday night.

It was OK.  They rushed to get me my food as fast as possible, thus creating my non enjoyment of any of it.  I felt like they wanted me out.  No fun.  So, that didn't help when my short ribs and polenta came out COLD!!!  And i was given the snobby attitude for even trying to get it reheated, so I just forget it and struggled to eat it.  The pizza was fine, very sloppy and probably cold have gone a wee bit longer, and I bet it would  have been better. It was priced alright though.  The waiter was constantly trying to up sale the wine we ordered, but because of the rush to get us out of the door, we were only able to drink 2 glasses a piece, and the 2nd glass practically downed.Would i go back?no.

Good food, less than interesting service. Everytime my coworkers and I come here, we enjoy the food, but not the atmosphere or the wait staff.  But, really, they're not so bad either.Highly recommend:  Penne Gamber, Le Grand Macaron, and any of their takeout selections.

The food was really good, but the service was horrible.  I really wanted to give this restaurant a better rating, but the service was so bad, that I had to do it!  Service was slow, which I could understand, but the server was rude and was missing during most of our visit.  We had to waive down a different server to get our check.

Ok food. Better drinks. really good service. I got one huge square ice cube in my rocks drinks. I've never seen that. I loved it. The bartender explained that it keeps the drink from getting watered down.

This restaurant is aesthetically very pretty & is located in the old Brooks Brothers location. We got seated almost immediately. And then it hit me, the NOISE in this place is almost unbearable. I literally could not hear the person sitting across from me without awkwardly lurching over the table the entire night. While this may be okay for people that don't give a crap about engaging with the people you're having dinner with, it sucks when you actually try to enjoy other peoples company. So, points off there. The hostess was a bit of an awkward bimbo, but the service was really great. Honestly, I would have been happy to just eat my entire meal solely based on the appetizer menu. The bruschetta was delicious. The actual pizza I ordered was so lack luster in flavor I was literally momentarily confused. Whatever. The prices were decent. Basically, this place has the potential to be great, but its lacking in major areas that are essential to enjoying a meal (ie: being able to hear the people you're with & having the proper savory taste that Italian deserves) but for just drinks/happy hour this place would be A+

Been wanting to try Bottega Louie for a while but every time plans did not work out.  I finally tried it out this past weekend because my two best friends treated me out for my birthday :")  I love the way the restaurant is set up, everything is so clean and open.  It adds a sense of freshness and depth.  The prices were very accommodating to my wallet, but that may be on par with the size of the servings.  Margherita Pizza- probably the most bang for your buck.  6 pretty big slices, this should fill you up.Portobello Fries- these fried mushrooms are an interesting flavor and texture.  Lightly crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside.  They are pretty good but after ~5, I could not eat anymore.Lobster Manicotti- don't be too surprised (as I was) when you get one, small lonely piece on a small dish....Modena Salad- I loved this salad!  The candied walnuts and the balsalmic vinaigrette are in perfect harmony with the butter lettuce and the goat cheese is the creamiest goat cheese I've ever had!Le Grand Macaron- Probably my favorite part of the meal.  The macaron is definitely bigger than the small ones they sell in boxes, rest assured.  There is ice cream in the middle and all sorts of berries.. yum!It took us a long time to get seated because I think they forgot about us after they asked us to sit at the bar.. but the service was friendly and the food comes out quick!  Because the restaurant is so open, the noise level is very loud, I was almost shouting the entire dinner and sometimes could not hear what my friends were saying.  The absolute best part about Bottega Louie is the macarons.  They are $24 for a large box but I came up with a free box!  Don't ask how ;)  I've never had a macaron before and when I took my first bite, my eyes LIT up and were sparkling!  They are the most delightful, splendid cookies you'll ever try.  Slightly cripsy, yet soft, yet chewy.. they leave a fragrant taste behind.. it's almost indescribable in words.  Just for the macarons I want to give this place 4 stars, but the food was just 3 stars.  :/Valet, which is located behind the restaurant, is $6....
Food is good.  Pizzas are great, but a little high priced.  Service was prompt and friendly.

This place is a bit over-rated. Yes it's modern looking inside. THey also have a nice display of goods. But dinner menu/ food wise...well I wasn't super impressed. I can't even remember what we had! I know we had the portobello mushrooms, and yes, those are yummy. We also had the lamb special, and that was yummy. But we also ordered about 4 other pasta dishes and a pizza (went with a group, obviously) and those were forgettable. I was thoroughly disappointed since I read all the good reviews on yelp. boo.and it was super loud and crowded. don't get what the hype is about?

This place has great decor.  It's like a different world when you step in from the downtown street.  Beautiful marble floors, well dressed staff, and every other little detail you can imagine has been thought of.  How ever the food is average.  I did not have a sit down meal but rather had a few dishes from the counter at the front entrance.  Everything I has was not that memorable and extremely pricey for what it was.  I think this place is really a place you go to on a date or some kind of special occasion (unless you are filthy rich) It's not a place that you go to to have a regular meal.  All in all not bad but not really my thing.
Good food, good service...but LOUD!!!!!!
Will wrote more when ready............

I guess I don't get it.  This place has all the charm of a Venetian laboratory.  The food is decent but it seems as if everyone is taking crazy pills when it comes to this place.  It's different, it makes you feel as if you are actually in a city, which holds some validity in LA, but come on!  This is nothing of mention except for the novelty and the fact that it's one of the few places where you can see a huge employee to guest ratio, but that doesn't make the food or the experience any better.  This is a true product of the recession and lowered expectations.

Was sad to see this location close a few months ago and figured it was another victim of Covid. Was definitely pleasantly surprised to see the place reopen.Took my better half there on date night as she'd never been and she loved it. While it takes 20-25 minutes to make, definitely get the chocolate soufflé.
Hyped place, food is ok for the price. Staff is very nice. But I was expecting more for the food.
Not many people of color but good food and beautiful restaurant. Food 8/10, Ambiance 7.5/10, Service was good the first time and not so good the second time.
The dishes are brilliant, we have eat all.But service is just OK in such a restaurant
Very nice restaurant..Lovely and delicious desserts.  I had brunch there the food was tasty.
Good food. Food Portion is good and the place is nice. The matcha latte cold was so so.

The food, service, and prices were all excellent. However, I wasn't a fan of the coldness and the enormous size of the room. But I understand that some people actually enjoy that. Different strokes for different people. So, that's my take on it but still a good spot to go to.
Delicious food, too noisy and expensive for what you get.

Consistently an excellent dining establishment!! My spouse and I hold the custom of visiting every Valentine's Day, and even though the wait can be extensive, it is absolutely justified. Their house-made pasta is incredibly delicious!! I favor this specific branch over the one in West Hollywood; it exudes a more classic ambiance and offers superior quality white glove service.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at this charming restaurant, and I must say it was a delightful experience. The ambiance was warm and inviting, with tasteful decorations that added to the overall appeal of the place. The menu, though concise, offered a carefully curated selection of dishes, ensuring that each item was prepared with the utmost attention to detail.One dish that truly stood out was the tartufo pizza. Topped with egg and prosciutto, it was a delightful twist on the classic pizza, and the combination of flavors was simply divine. The richness of the prosciutto paired perfectly with the creamy egg, creating a unique and delicious blend that left me craving for more.What I appreciated most about the restaurant was the focus on quality over quantity. Despite having a limited number of options on the menu, each dish was crafted with care and precision, showcasing the chef's culinary expertise. The staff was attentive and friendly, making the dining experience even more enjoyable.The location of the restaurant was also a plus, conveniently located in a bustling area, making it a perfect spot for a casual lunch or a cozy dinner. While there are other dining options nearby, this restaurant truly stands out for its well-executed dishes and inviting atmosphere.Overall, I had a fantastic dining experience, and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a delightful culinary adventure in a beautiful setting.As if the savory dishes weren't enough, the pastry selection at this restaurant is an absolute treat! After enjoying a satisfying lunch or dinner, indulging in their delectable pastries is a must. From decadent cakes to delicate pastries, their dessert menu offers a wide array of options to satisfy every sweet tooth. Each pastry is made with skill and passion, evident in every delightful bite. The combination of rich flavors and exquisite presentation makes for a truly memorable end to a wonderful dining experience. Whether you have a penchant for chocolate delights or prefer fruity tarts, their pastry selection has something to please every palate. It's safe to say that their pastries are nothing short of heavenly, and I highly recommend leaving some room for dessert to truly complete the dining journey at this exceptional restaurant.
It was okay. Nothing special prices were mehstaff was alright overall had a lively time
Great service-- attentive staff and the food is delicious. I enjoyed the clean atmosphere as well.
Food ok. Service not warm. Great design and pretty inside. The pizza is great, but kind of need chew more.
The service is fantastic! Desserts are top notch! A bit pricey but thats what you get in Los Angeles. A true LA Hot spot.
Yum!! Always classic. Good vibes and food. Fun place to take out of townerrs or bigger groups
Their Pastries are to absolutely die for. Came here with the wife and she truly enjoyed a few weeks ago.Have to say though, the place was a bit dirty when i visited. that was our only complaint :)
Stopped here to try a dessert and my craving was satisfied! I had the fruit tart and it was tasty! Definitely want to come back and enjoy a meal.

So, I've heard rave reviews about this place And I was working in the area so I decided to finally give it a shot for lunch. I called ahead to make sure lunch reservations weren't required, and they weren't. I spoke to a really nice woman on the phone also named Michelle and we had a brief conversation about her favorite food items that I should eat. I walked inside and was quickly seated. They brought water immediately and placed the piece of bread in the center of my small table. I ordered the "Calabrese" Pizza by recommendation and since I'm pescatarian, ordered it with no salami. I also ordered the gazpacho.The bread was good, however it wasn't warm like I thought it would be and the butter was refrigerated, so really hard to spread. I asked my waitress for some soft butter and she brought some back in no time! I was still kind of sad the bread wasn't warm but I got over that pretty quickly when the gazpacho arrived. They placed a large white bowl in front of me with flowers and herbs on the side and a man with what looked like a wine decanter poured the gazpacho into the bowl. It was a very cool experience and the gazpacho was absolutely delicious. The pizza blew me away way more than I thought it was going to. The spicy with the mixture of the honey drizzle on top was absolute perfection. The best part about lunch by myself here, having plenty of leftovers for later. I look forward to coming back and will update if my experience exceeds my expectations.
It was pretty good. Would recommend.
Pretty and tasty dessert! Tried some of their cakes and macarons. Their packaging is also so pretty. A little pricey. Nice seating and ambience inside.
all the food here tastes good.  Almond croissants are like Paris.  The place is seemingly busy often.  Location downtown is harder to get to then in WeHo.  Try it you will like it.

I thought Bottega was kind of overrated. I had heard a lot about it over the years but never had the chance to try it until the other night. The place was packed and we didn't have a reservation -- first mistake. We waiting about an hour for a table, so by that point I was starving. I ordered the steak special they had with a salad. My steak was a little overcooked but the salad was really fresh.The customer service was also great.
Very nice placeLovely staffsHigh endLove the vibe there Thinking about coming back with family Nice
Food is decent, a little on the pricier side but wait times can get very long during the rush hour!!
I love the atmosphere of this place, and the food is great.
One of my favorite bakeries in LA!! I've been coming here for years, and I'm never really disappointed. Love coming here.

I love the vibe of this place and the food is well-portioned. It's a really nice place to get brunch and the service is great! The only downside is that it's very very loud! I had to yell when I went there with my girlfriends, and ended up losing my voice for the rest of the the weekend.Parking can be a challenge in downtown, so plan on looping around for 10 minutes, or you can pay $10-20 for Valet.

I came here to eat and enjoy some drinks. The food was great but the whole time a homeless man was banging on the glass right outside of our seats. It was uncomfortable and would give 5 stars but the eating experience was extremely awkward.
Great Pastries Y'all....Its like France....in LA....Merci!!!
Good food but it's loud. The acoustics in this place is grating.

The food here is always so fresh!!! I love the Dorothy roll, blooming onion, and the Montrose roll!!! Great service and if you come at the right time it is not too busy here!!!

The food here is always so fresh!!! I love the Dorothy roll, blooming onion, and the Montrose roll!!! Great service and if you come at the right time it is not too busy here!!!

I love that place they have the best desserts !!they have great pizza as well. can be to noisy at lunch time baside that great place really recommended.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and the presentation of the food.For an introvert, it can be a bit overwhelming at first, but you get used to it.There are so many delicious looking desserts--this place is dangerous for the waistline!
Great place to grab a bite when downtown. The food is good the the place is really loud. Hard to have a conversation with your lunch partner.

it's all about the vibe here. the space is cool; whites and golds, ceilings that seemingly have no end, walls that just reverberate sound creating a loud but energetic atmosphere. pizzas are tasty, drinks are solid and service didnt disappoint. and even better, across the street from seven grand!

Nice for evening dinner and dessert.
I just went here for brunch with my wifeSo many people was in there.I waited 35min for have a table.Omelette was so tasty. And place was so beautiful!But there was't parking garage.

What a classic LA gem. I've been coming here for 20 years and I'm never disappointed and never is anyone I bring with me! Incredible atmosphere & macarons to die for...

text: its amazing place the macaroon kind of expensive lol
Been many times...very consistent food and outstanding service...esp. like the pizza...and desserts taste as good as they look...they are works of art...would give a 5 but very noisy when when busy
