I have been here for brunch - be warned it gets so busy and its best to book Food is generally ok -  a little overpriced but to be expected the staff, and management however are super nice - recommended
Love love it here. Food is great! The macarons are amazing!
Food was great!! Also had macaroons and and they were delicious. I will definitely take my family back here!

Definitely worth a visitI've been here many times before. Beautiful space, however, super loud as the acoustics are awful! Prepare to wait... even though the space is huge it's always busy. Love the table bread they give you. The mushroom pizza was good and so was the arugula salad but we didn't care for the chicken Milanese.... could be better. Service is a little lagging felt like there were not enough waiters. Overall, worth a visit and prepare to spend...$$$$
they have the best desserts ever!!!my favorite is the macrons cookies very good service, very clean place .only one little thing that it's always very noisy ,beside thet perfect place for lunch .
Love the service here. The restaurant is huge so you don't need to wait long for a table, I don't think they take reservations.My friends loves the pizza here.
A little bit pricy, but like the maroon and other desserts. I forgot the name of the pizza I ordered, but I like the egg and mushroom on the top. toast for vegan pizza yeah!
Very nice spot DTLA. It's always crowded but they are pretty fast at serving. If you are European and in LA you need to go at least once. The food is good overall but nothing crazy!
Cute spot! It can be pretty loud in there, but overall its a nice place. Their desserts are to die for and coffee is excellent. Little bit on the pricey side but can't complain.

First thing first the zone or rather size of the place, it's very wide and breathable. You'd expect it to be crowded with the place in the middle of the city however, the aesthetic of the interior is quite pleasant. The desserts were tasty and nice, I think this place is perfect for dining in. There's not a lot of people during the afternoons and the only other thing that I've got to say is the menu and the price.
address: Playa del Rey, Playa del Rey, CA

text: Went to Bottega Louie for brunch. It was crowded but a table was found quickly. The food is always well prepared. The coffee is especially tasty if you are a coffee lover. The noise level is high and must be accepted as part of the charm of the restaurant. Pastries are beautifully made. Bottega Louie will not disappoint.
Enjoyed the experience and the environment. Took a little long to get our food but it was worth the wait. We will be back for sure.

Food is good and service is usually great. Bottega has been a staple downtown for a upscale/fancy dinner for 10+ years and shows now signs of slowing. While the pastry showcase is usually what draws newcomers in off the street, I feel their macaroons are more fluff than substance. What keeps me coming back is the beautiful open space and the ambiance, for sure.
This place always greets with great cozy and welcoming. Atmosphere which I appreciate I really enjoy the hustle and bustle of this place. This is great place for people who are great eating

Service and environment were excellent. Food was good but not great and was a little on the cool side for me, (had to have been sitting for a while). Today was first time to breakfast...definitely recommend lunch over breakfast.
Food at the restaurant is a bit meh...., but desserts are amazing! Their  sachertorte keeps me coming back every time.
This place is great, but there's always such a long line. Be prepared to wait.
Loud place, great food and service!

Only been here for desserts, coffee, and tea. So far, I think the dessert has to be top 20 in LA. Its just really good quality and you can tell they put a lot of attention into making every little thing.The ambiance is great. Even if youre going in for just dessert, you can seat yourself at a table. The service is really on point as well.They have a open kitchen design, for sure one day, ill have dinner here. Its more of a date night kind of spot.The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the price. 3 Americanos + 3 pieces of cake was like $60. Kinda expensive.
Good food,.,  go to for business lunches, parking is difficult. I think valet is only real option, bit its.dtla

Bottega Louie - PASTA LA VISTA, BABY!Lynn BentleyOverwhelmed with the city noise of downtown LA, I walked into the high-end crossroads of Italian and French cuisine, where the lights were dimmed. I escaped the car horns and winds from outside, to walk into another chaotic hub. It was almost like a movie theater, yet the voices of the diners were booming. It was the equivalent of walking into the Disney movie, Ratatouille. Waiters in white button-ups and black ties, not one hair was misplaced on their heads. Walking in, it was clear the diners were the priority. The waiters gravitated towards anyone who didn't seem satisfied, checking on them and their experience. I could tell that their goal was efficiency and swiftness. I was seated immediately, even if it was in a corner. It was surprising not having to wait for a table, with the popularity and quality of the restaurant, I'd expect a herd of guests queuing. In fact, there was no seating area to wait for a table to open up, does anyone ever wait at Bottega Louie? Scanning the arranged tables and booths, not one contempt face was seen. Conversations from every table flooded the cold marble interior. The high and open ceilings provided more space for the voices to collide and gather, so loud it sounded like inaudible white noise. Occasionally, high pitched sounds of fire truck sirens would overpower the voices as they sped by, their flashing lights illuminating the large windows and turning the white marble to red. Throughout dining, I felt like royalty. Yet, at certain points it turned to the feeling of being babysat by these waiters, caring so much that it became overwhelming. Asking how the food was when it barely got to my table, looking for smiles and approval, which I did give. The waiters moved purposely and knew what they needed to do, as if it were a choreographed dance, moving swiftly past each other on the marble dance floor. They maneuvered around Gucci purses dangling from the back of women's chairs and people standing to take pictures of their party who posed and smiled in their seats. In this rich sea of people, no two groups of people looked the same. It was a boiling pot of races, ages, genders, tourists, and locals. Our waiter, Molly, clearly had a goal to make us, and all other patrons, special and important. One negative facial expression, and Molly was there to provide and mend. Unfortunately, Molly couldn't fix the struggles of elderly people at tables around, pulling out their iPhone flashlights to read the menu. The dim lighting could be mistaken for a photographer's dark room. Bottega Louie will make a dent in your wallet and quite frankly, your retina. Bank account and eye damage aside, the pasta set before me brought the sensation of being in a sauna as the steam drifted up onto my face. Too hot to eat, I turned my attention towards the abstract bread on the table which looked like a wonky snake, ready to be torn apart. Next to it sat a metal contraption, holding up french fries, sprinkled with parsley with a variety of dipping sauces. The bread and french fry contraption were oddly compelling, but when the orecchiette pasta finally reached my mouth, some enthusiasm was lost. Although the sausage and artichoke mixed in added tang and, might I say, notoriety, the pasta itself was lackluster. Without the spice that came along with the artichoke and sausage, it alone would put me to sleep. A pasta connoisseur myself, high expectations were held for this $22 orecchiette which ultimately broke my bank account and heart. Determined for redemption, I ordered mint chip gelato, and was pleasantly surprised and my spirits were lifted. For some reason, this gelato just made sense to me as I tasted not one hint of artificiality in the spoonfuls. A hot chocolate with symmetrical blocks of homemade marshmallows might've been an odd choice following gelato, but I had no regrets when my spoon disrupted the foam on top. I went in not knowing what to expect and walked out with gratitude and anticipation for my next visit at this crossroads of Italian and French cuisine.

I would give this place 5 stars if the wait time was better.  And the prices are borderline insane. But the bakery is always the best portion of the place here. Who am I kidding,  i'd still come back...

I like Botteha Louis a lot. Not because of their food necessarily. The food is acceptable. I just love the vibe. It's very New York. It's so lively and happening. I like that they have a dedicated Pizza Oven and an open kitchen. The service is spotty and the menu is monotonous. So why 4 stars. The Bakery! The desert section is out of this world, the selection, the taste, the variety! If you like deserts, this is your place!
Love this space so much, service is always on point and the desserts are so good I always save room for it. Had the best server this weekend, Can't wait to go back!

I've been here a couple of times, not too hungry in either of both visits so I decided to order desserts and chocolate (I know, that's a lot of sugar). Had a tasy croissant that had a wonderful consistence but my favorites there, until now, are the macaroons, I loved them and their variety. I couldn't ask for more. Nice store with other options, I will possibly come back for a meal, burgers seems good too. Nice customer service and ambience as well.
all hype, but at least its pretty!

Came with a friend for a Sunday brunch. Parked in a garage structure on Grand and 7th (literally across from the restaurant) normally $7. with validation from Bottega we got a $2 discount. They got our name and number and texted us when our table was ready. They estimated 20min wait time; we waited for 5min and we got seated really quick. The hostess and waitress were so kind and informative! Expect to pay between $8-20 on a plate depending if you order a small plate or a brunch plate. All the drinks looked phenomenal!! I got the potato pancakes which is savory and cooked with green onion in the batter and it came with a sour cream-type sauce and applesauce. Perfect portion and satisfyingly filling (if you're not ravenous) My friend ordered the avocado toast came with cuts of  sausage on top. They have a sit down dessert menu $10-14 and they have a separate dessert option in the front of the restaurant for a quick grab an
Bread bread bread. My kids and I love it here. The wait is the only downside!

My wife and I really like this place. The food is delicious, just the service could be a bit better. We went several times, as my office is close to the Restaurant. It's pretty much always packed, so a reservation is advised.

The food is great and the place is super cool with an awesome vibe. The only reason I did not go 5 stars is because the no reservation policy and it gets VERY loud. I found myself saying what and straining to hear due to how loud the place is. I will be back but not during a busy time
like their creativity and ideas of bringing the mix cultural into one. As it came out really good
Beautiful space. I like to come here for birthday dinners.

Bottega Louie is my go-to place :) I love having my breakfast there! The food is absolutely amazing however, you do take time to finally deliver the dishes. That's my only problem but other than that, you are great :)))
Love the ambience and the food. The appetizers were amazing.. Definitely will go back again.
Love them! All of the food is delish.
Great spot for brunch on Sunday!
Food theater. Go for the desserts. Stay for the show. A very fun place!

They have a really great cheese pizza that I'm a big fan of. Also the dessert options are unreal. Always go for the macaroons. The one thing is that it's a little on the pricey side but you get what you pay for in a sense. Really great ambiance, particularly in the restrooms. If nothing else make sure you check those out. Lots of glitz and glam I always stop in for a pick me up even if I don't have to go. Thanks!
Great food. Exceptional waiter. The only problem I would say is the parking. Make sure you do not drive here! Take ride share or get dropped off!
Awesome. A little pricey but what place isn't pricey in Los Angeles! The food was amazing and drinks were as well. Parking is a little bit of a hassle but just take uber or lyft and you will be fine.

Went here for a brunch recently and came away a fan. Started off with an awesome bloody mary then moved on to a breakfast sandwich which really hit the spot. The atmosphere is lively and energetic. The place gets a little loud but that doesn't really bother me. The wait staff was attentive and professional and made the meal that much more enjoyable. Besides the difficulty parking (it is downtown LA) everything went smoothly. We didn't have to wait in line because we were only a party of two but I've heard the waits can get fairly long. We didn't stop by the bakery on the way out either but I have also heard great things from friends who have stopped by. All in all I have to recommend for brunch and breakfast, you won't be disappointed

I didn't like the interior too much. It reminded me of a cafeteria. The food was really good. The fresh bread was delicious. The beignets are what they are known for, and I normally would never order doughnuts, but I did because it's their specialty. It was delicious and came with their home made raspberry sauce. It was way better than you can imagine. Their food portion was big.

Really enjoyed this place!!!Was visiting LA and my friend was raving about this restaurant. Loved my first impression. Was a good crowd. Its a beautiful venue. High ceilings and nicely decorated. entrance they have all the bakery stuff, macaroons, etc.. The dining area is towards the back. Warmly greeted and surprisingly there was no wait even though it seemed busy. I had the portobello mushroom fries, lasagna, and french toast. I was tourist mode so wanted to try a few things. My friend got the poached eggs. Everything was superb!! I think it was a little pricey.. but i forget as well.. def not expensive enough to discourage me from visiting again should i be back in that area. I highly recommend!!

loved it , great food and really loved the pastriesSuper place for a wedding cake!! Very noisy though, if it was not for the fact that I could not hear what my other half was saying while we had Dinner , I would have given them a 5 stars

We went for dessert and got through the line quickly.   The macaroons felt pricey but were worth the price (about $2.50 each).  I don't know whether it's LA Coffee preferences, but I wouldn't get the coffee there again.  It tasted more bitter than what I'm used to.  That said, I'd bring my friends there for dessert nearly any time.
Love this place!Classy, elegant and tasty! Outstanding macaroons and varieties of different hot beverages.

Elegant, cool and stylish... a place that will change your mood no matter what... life time experience.I really would love to meet the person behind this... such taste and perfection in every corner... what a vision.We were in LA three days..  and ate here at least once every day... it brought peace and joy to our heart and Tommy.The service is warm and charming... on one of our visits, we were surprised with a complimentary box of sweets. I believe this place goes beyond food... it is a landmark and must see when in LA.

I really don't understand all the hype of this place.. Nothing really excites me here.  There is far better desserts across the street at Little sister.  The food wasn't bad and it wasn't great. Just any typical place I've been too.
The most high end bakery you'll ever walk into. Also some of the cutest, most high end baked goods you'll ever experience. Their cupcakes are pristine and make great gifts!
Food was great, but what's the deal with Pershing Square? Who thinks of a name like that??
Great Customer service. Managers were helping to move the long lines. Everyone worked together and perfection is seen all over the Take Out area!!

The reviews about the parking situation are accurate, but it was a friend's birthday and this place was her request.  A bit of a wait for our large group, but well worth it.  Try any of their pizzas and get the lasagna!  We're already making plans to come back here for brunch to try their highly recommended lemon ricotta pancakes.
This place is Fantastic! The food here is outstanding and the service is even better!! Friendly staff, freshly baked pizza, and great pasta! What more can you ask for..
address: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Good food and a good environment, however the service time is long. I've been coming here for years, and over the years the service time has just remained lengthy or stagnant. The servers often disappear int he back or in general. All the food on the menu is amazing though.
Yummy deserts.  Very NY City vibe.

There weren't any pasta dishes offered during brunch. The margherita pizza is still one of my favorite in town.  Seating was extremely quick for our party of two! If you want a quieter setting for better conversation, this isn't a good choice. I felt like I was shouting across the table.

His is one of my favorite places in Downtown LA, a not-so-hidden gem, that's a real treat to dine in! I love the ambiance- it's big, open, like a huge New York flat. The interior is classy and sophisticated with white marbles, gold accents, infused with the old charms of the building it is in. I also love their Portobello fries! I cant start my meal without that appetizer! And their thin crust pizzas with exotic flavors like clams are really good ! Their famous macaroons are a must have. Almost any new cafe or boutique in LA is trying to come up with their own versions of macaroons, but theirs really tastes amazing. Waiters too look so elegant they might be actors moonlighting as waiters. Overall it is a good place for brunch or dinner that has its own charm.
address: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Nice variety of small plates, salads, pastries. It's a good time! Bright atmosphere, nice people. Can't complain! Would recommend!
great place in the center of downtown . so good in fact that we ate there several times during our visit to LA. They have quite a variet menu . The place is beautiful itself and the food is delicious
Was looking for a quieter place this place is very loud inside but other than that food was delicious

The sausage, however, had an unusual flavor that I didn't care for.  Nothing bad, per se, just not to my liking.  The potatoes had a real nice flavor, though.  My husband got the same food as I did. . I just finished brutal workouts, so I feel justified eating anything and everything but NOPE,will keep calm and just do a Look Seeee ;)
address: Central Oklahoma City, Oklahoma City, OK

text: The sausage, however, had an unusual flavor that I didn't care for.  Nothing bad, per se, just not to my liking.  The potatoes had a real nice flavor, though.  My husband got the same food as I did. If you're hungry for more than macarons, they have great service and a unique menu.

Portobello fries were a hit at the table, and I loved my lemon blueberry pancakes. Don't get the lobster hash--the lobster was overcooked to the point where we ate everything BUT the lobster! What a waste of lobster..  The recipient loved it. I insisted we taste it and it was as devinely Dacquoise delish! I want one for me...maybe not, I don't want to put in more gym time:

They make beautiful pastries that taste so good! Very beautiful to look at but taste even nicer! I like their restaurant too. Very delicious Italian food, pastas and pizzas and salads. Perfect meal for brunch or dinner. Very beautiful restaurant. Nice for special events.

In terms of food: top notch. Had the farmers market scramble, my girls had the waffles and wife had the salmon Benedict. We also got coffee and hot chocolate. All around great food, great atmosphere. Totally recommend! Large spaceLoud ambiance Great for big partiesKid friendly Large bar area with open seatingValet parkingGreat wait staff Always busy
Came here for the Macarons. Although a bit pricey still very delicious. Staff was welcoming and busy with all their customers. Parking is hard to find to prepare to pay for parking.
Great food, Great pizza, Great desserts Great atmosphere. I live in Encino and this is my Go To for somewhere cool to take friends, Try the Jelly or hazelnut Beignets OOOOOHHHHH
Worth the wait. Pizza is excellent and I would recommend the steak salad will be back for the salad. Great prices and large portions.
This place is super loud, but has a great ambiance and even better pizza!

There's little I would add except to say that the food quality, in my experience (and that of some of our other colleagues), can be a bit uneven. It's not quite Magnolia Grill. But when it's great, it's truly superb.
For starts because of the experience.  one star for the food and pricing.  So, although the food was mediocre, the experience was fun. makes sense?

Bottega Louie always offers its customers the bestest quality food and service. I come here after work and have some coffee and dessert. Servers are also way too much welcoming. The only thing I didn't like about this place was that it was pretty difficult to find a parking spot near the restaurant.slSo I had to park my car a little far from the spot and then walk there.
The only reason I come here is for the dessert, and let me tell you, they are amazing
The menu is excellent. You can not go wrong with their desserts. It is felt that the celebrity is simply in the restaurant. Definitely worth the price.

Fantastic place in the heart of downtown with an eclectic menu of delicious bites. I highly recommend the sausage pizza, burrata pizza, as well as the brussels sprouts and pistachios for dinner.  They also have a great selection of desserts and pastries.

This place is amazing! Great atmosphere and ambiance, and the mid day brunch mimosas didn't hurt also.     I had the eggs bennedict and my girlfriend had the french toast! Which she said was so good that she wouldn't even allow me one bite!! I guess it was that good!

Stopped here for some desert and drinks with some friends after a concert.  We were lucky and walked in to some empty tables.  Ordered a few drinks and then on to the sweets.  I ordered the strawberry tart, which was perfect!  I dont really have a sweet tooth and this pastry wasnt overly sweet.  It was just sweet enough where I can still taste the natural flavors of the strawberries....and they were delicious.  We also ordered some macarons...which I found to be overly sweet, but my friends thought they were amazing.  I guess to each their own.

My all time favorite place. Whenever I'm in DTLA, this is the place I go to. Not only is this place super clean, but the staff is super friendly, the food tastes great, and don't even get me started on the desserts. Always get their macarons. My favorite go to flavors are: earl grey, rose, and violet cassis.
address: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Had an amazing dinner here. This place has amazing truffle fries and great service and interesting menu choices. The only complaint I have is due to the grand ceiling and the acoustics this case can get pretty noisy on a Friday night!

Love this place. Fun vibe, great food, and amazing desserts!!! It's close to the Sheraton so you can walk over for a yummy eclair after a long day of meetings. The pizza is really good also. Fun kitchen to watch them cooking.

Great bloody Mary's and a beautiful atmosphere. Come here for brunch but hopefully when it's not too crowded because it can be too loud and you can't here the person next to you. Frankie the server was amazing and the customer service was beyond satisfaction.
Awesome place but too loud.  The macarons deserves 5 stars.
love this place.  the pastries are really really good.  i wish it was a little more quiet.  but its definately a yummy place

A long overdue review for Bottega Louie!I came here for brunch a month ago and love this place!It's rather pricey for their menu but the food is amazing.  The dessert selection is amazing.  There is a long wait, so do come early and not during rush hour time.
Good food.  Service could be better.  Not a good place to go if you want to talk, very loud.

If you ever find yourself near Grand Ave in LA you should think about stopping in to try some Bottega Louie.  They truly offer a great take on all classic Italian dishes.   Only negative is pricing but last I checked most nice places cost money in LA.  So expensive here lol.   Normally I'd give 3 stars with good food and higher prices but the friendly wait staff and atmosphere made me give 4.   My waiter Mario (I think that was his name) was a gem.   Very attentive to all of our needs and was tipped nicely because of it.   The food is amazing.  You can taste they use quality ingredients and they're always fresh and it shows in the taste.   From their pizza to classic Italian dishes I can say I've never been disappointed with their menu and food.  Will not disappoint.
friendly staff and good food but a bit pricy

Great date spot! The food is good. The service and ambiance is great! I've been here on many occasions. It does get very busy, so I recommend making a reservation  for dinner. You can sit at the bar and have a drink while you wait for a table to open.

Bottega Louie was on my way out of DTLA so I opted to pick up a box of the prettiest macarons because, why not? I'm happy that I did, they were so yum and did I say so pretty? Need a gift = these are perfect. Minus 1 star because the man who "helped" me was a bit on the salty side.
one of my favorite places to go have a bite to eat everthing is really good
amazed by the atmosphere here :)

Yummy desserts, great coffee and some appetizers. Way too loud for romantic dinner or date, but definitely cool spot for unusual and eclectic desserts while visiting Downtown LA. Would highly suggest their Beignets and macaroons! Must try!!!
Loved the experience. A lot of friends have recommended, will come back for sure. Portions are fair as well as price. Macarrones are a must.See you guys soon!
address: Northeast Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: I haven't had the chance to dine here yet, but would love to in the near future! Came here for their pastry (macarons, to be exact). Lots of flavors to choose from and they're all delicious!
This place is always crowded. Rarely eat in the dining area. Always come for the pastries though. The beignets are amazing, get them every time
Good atmosphere and great service.Pizza was very good, meatballs were not that good and Louie salad as ok.

Chocolate suffle yummy pizza muh baked goods nice.  Our service was great and lunch was fun a capable place to serve you and get you some good food to be on your way with the rest of your day.Now back to the grind!

The staff is attentive and the kitchen is quick. Quantity of food is a good at the quality. It is pricey but you don't mind because it is worth it. I had the rockfish and it was great. You won't regret it.
I liked the water it was free. I was on a date so the whole night was free. Love it!!!
The food and drinks were both very very good, but the prices were a little high. Thats to be expected for a location like this downtown though.
LOVE this place, but it is loud.

Enjoyed going here after dinner for a spot of tea and dessert. Their macaroons are absolutely delicious. We tried 12 different flavors and there are still more to try. Would definitely recommend others to try. Nice ambiance as well.
Nice place! Breakfast is delicious! Dinner is good!
IF you dont mind a busy busy busy type of attitude.  The food is delicious but dont come in a with plans you wont make it and they dont care.

Good food selection, not great  but definitely good menu choices and tasteful. Service was good and prompt. It wasn't too crowded when I was last there so service was pretty fast. Nothing to complain about. Our food all came out correct, well cooked, and tasted good. Come here regulary and will be back again. Maybe some new menu selections will be good, as i'm always interested in trying new stuff and don't mind taking risks with food.
Food is fantastic and wow desserts are my favorite especially beignet , Cashier was friendly and had a smile on her face!

My wife and I go here at least once a month and we just love the place. It's a bit loud but the food and ambience certainly makes up for it. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is that the hostess can be a bit rude. The woman that usually takes us to our table is nice but the lady that takes your information is a bit of a pretentious entitled twit. Good thing you don't tip hostesses in LA. She wouldn't last a minute in NYC.

I just love Bodega Louie! I have been there only for dinner with my boyfriend but instantly it became one of my favorite places for a romantic dinner. At night the ambiance is set thanks to the candle light of each table and the dim lights of the place.It get really crowed, so I would recommend get there with time to get in the waiting list and spent some time looking at the cute pastries or after dinner rush hour.We got there a little late so there were a lot of available tables. The staff greeting us and took us to our table right away. I order the Chicken Parmesan and my boyfriend the lasagna. But to be honest regretted my choice after watching one of the chefs tossing the dough in the pizza station, their pizzas look amazing and in my next visit, you can bet I will order one.Unfortunately the pastry section was closed at the end of our dinner, but it was because it was quite late when we left, and we were one of the few people still in the restaurant.

I would've given a five star review, but there was only one vegan option. However, I'm still giving Bottega Louie four stars, because the one vegan option they have was amazing - would absolutely recommend!

Honestly, the macarons are just pretty. Idk why people come here for anything beside aesthetic, ahaha. Apart from that, it's very clean here and I love how cold it is in there for some reason. The food is decent and although it is on the pricier side, it's an experience.
Great lunch in a very nice atmosphere. Cappuccino was the only disappointment.  Would go there again any day.
ok the food is amazing but the noise will give you a headache.

SO SO! I went to this Italian one last week and did not feel any special about this restaurant. It is just a traditional Italian restaurant and the dessert is not very tasty. I felt kind of disappointed.
You'll have to deal with long waits at peak times. The desserts are to die for, and you've got to try the truffle with egg yolk pizza.

I came here for dinner one night on a date.  She picked the place and I was pleased (I wasn't even that displeased when the check came.)  It's a big restaurant, but you can hear yourself talk, and the size of the room means you have some valuable elbow room.I was my usual boring self and opted for the Margherita Pizza.  I realize I probably made myself look like a total nerd for ordering it, but I can say that it was good, as tomato and cheese pizzas go.  It's definitely a $25 restaurant pizza, and not a $12 pizzeria pizza, and, if you like that kind of thing, you'll like the one at Bottega Louie.  I tried the crab beignets for an appetizer.  They sounded more exciting than they turned out to be.Cocktails aren't my thing, so, when it came time to start out with one, I couldn't resist ordering something the menu called a Smog-City Saber-Toothed Squirrel Amber.  (I just looked it up on their website to make sure I got the name right.)  Maybe I should explain that it's a beer.  A good one, not too heavy, but a lot more flavorful than standard beer.  I'm just not sure where the squirrel comes in.I'd like to have tried a dessert (the beignets were calling to me off the menu), but my date was the type that had just come from the gym and avoided carbs after 6:00.  Maybe that's what made me order beer and a pizza.Maybe that's why I ended up having a dish of ice cream at home alone half an hour after I'd paid the check.  But that's not Bottega Louie's fault.
It's decent place, too much hype, but not bad.

I have been here a few times lately and it doesn't disappoint! The good thing is I had some family members in town and they were impressed, too!  I felt soo cool like I know LA restaurants.  I loved the Portobello mushroom fries and the pizza is especially good.  My group got to try a little bit of everything including salmon and pasta etc..

Me and some of my co-workers stopped by to get some lunch. Inside was busy, but they were able to get us a table for party of 8.I ordered Fried Calamari, Cestini Gamber(pasta). Fried calamari tasted little bit old, it also came almost witin 4 minutes after we place the order. It might be sitting there for someone i donno but still taste ok! On the other hand Cestini Gamber was just perfect. The basil gives an amazing flavor and  is a great match with Shrimp.

A go-to favorite. Not on a weekend as they do not take reservations and waiting around for an hour is not our cup of tea but its great for a pizza doing the week. Food is consistent and for some reason I love this place for Sunday brunch...and picking up some fresh bread and pasties before heading home :-)

Please see my full review on my blog...I visited Bottega Louie for the fist time this last weekend. The entire staff is very polite and friendly. Going at the "wrong" time will force you to wait a little while for a table as there are many people that go here for brunch, but it is easy to grab a drink while you wait.We ordered mimosas and a couple beers to drink. The mimosas were pretty standard and I would probably try a different cocktail next time.To eat, we ordered the mac & cheese, Lobster Hash, Burrata pizza, and macarons. The mac & cheese was excellent. I would probably go with a different pizza next time and the Lobster Hash, while good, had little lobster and an overbearing taste of potatoes.The macarons are amazing! We ordered 8 for here and 8 to go. My favorite was the birthday cake and salted caramel. Overall, I would visit the restaurant again. However, I would probably make a few different food choices for the main course.

_____SERVICE_____For the macaroons there is not much of a service. You get the fill-in sheet and select which flavors you wish to purchase. Then hand it to one of the workers._____PRICE_____Man the price here can depend on what you get. The macaroons are $2.50 each. Even when they give you the bundle up price. It still adds up to $2.50 each - don't gotta do the math, I gotchu._____PRESENTATION_____The place is big and spacious. When I went it wasn't as busy so it was chill._____LOCATION/PARKING_____My peeps let me tell you, free parking will be difficult if you don't go at night and find an open meter. You'll have to pay at the meters or close by parking lots._____MEMORABLE MOMENT_____Trying to find cheap/free parking to get to this place lol, good luck!

I stopped by to try the colorful pastries they are pretty yummy!! two thumbs up I would say. They also have other things on the menu to try. Like the macaroons which is great quality and taste. People that work there are friendly and courteous. Looking forward to coming back and trying something else on the menu.

Their macarons on the other hand are amazing! My favorites are the salted caramel and coconut. Definitely coming back for those macarons!

text: This place is a great place , the atmosphere , the service are all five star , its always fun and it a must go place If you are in LA for breakfast lunch or dinner .The food is the only thing thats just a little hit or miss its never been bad ,but some things like the pizza are delicious and others like there Bolognese pasta was very average to say the least, the bass was also ok , the chocolate souffle was great , the cakes all look so yummy that they sell and the bread is yummy .For a casual meal this is on of my favourites in LA and I love it so if you are ever down town you just must go to this place always buzzing .

First time at Bottega Louie today! After years of hearing about their French macarons (not macaroons, please!), I finally decided to stop by as I was in the neighborhood for the day. First impression: they're obviously super popular as the place was PACKED. I had a quick lunch: egg benedict (delicious... but how can't you get such a simple dish right?) and quiche Lorraine slice. The quiche was ok. Not bad, but nothing like they taste in Paris. I guess it's just a matter of what ingredients you're using but it tasted more like bacon than like Parisian ham (probably because it was bacon...).Best part of my lunch were the French macarons... Not as precisely baked as the ones I got from Laduree's on the Champs Elysees, but clearly the best I've had in Los Angeles. The pistachio and Earl Grey ones are especially delicious, both with intense aromas, crusty shells and chewy interiors... Magnifique!Parking: valet is the best option.

Such a fun tourist spot.  A must for LA visitors who are looking for a bustling, sexy French Bistro with an Italian influence.  My friend and I ordered two glasses of the Michel Chapoutier Belleruche Rosé, the Caesar salad, the smoked trout rillettes, the Cestini Gamber, the crab beignets and the grilled octopus.  Our favorite dishes were the trout rillettes and the Cestini Gamber, though the other dishes were tasty.The food is delicious given the volume the kitchen produces.  The price point is appropriate given the portion sizes.  Strong wine list that pairs nicely with the menu.  Loved the market in the front with the beautifully designed packaging of the take out bags and such.A very sexy and energetic space.  The only down side was the service.  We found that our server didn't properly pronounce the dishes, nor was he knowledgeable about the wine list. Luckily, my friend and I are very knowledgeable about food and wine so we were able to create a fun dining experience in spite of our server's lack of knowledge.Well work the visit.

CONTEMPORARY GLORIFICATION OF MACARON__________________________________________Spirituality practice needs qualified celebration space, and Bottega Louie is the glorification place of Macaron.  High ceiling, elegant Carrara's marble everywhere, open and wide light spaces for bar and restaurant, large and exposed kitchen and pizza oven. As a modern pagan temple, wide as an Apple store, but more elegant, larger than a Tesla showroom, with less technology and ascendant inspirational white from the ubiquitous marble to the ceiling, the concept of contemporary neoclassicism has found in downtown LA its most celebrated food: The Macaron. Yesterday I went for brunch in Bottega Louise and how to skip pizza with Burrata e Prosciutto crudo?  The topping were genuine and the base well cooked, but missing the flavor of wood oven. So I went to verify and yes, sadly, they have an oven with gas fire! So bad..Anyhow, I came here mainly for the Macarons, French sweet meringue filled with buttercream of various flavors. Macaron are "derived" from the Italian Macaroni (with the "i" at the end) invented in Florence in middle age time, 500 years ago. "Ossi di Morto" (bones of the dead) from Tuscany are a popular version of Macaroni, crunchier than Macaron and without filling. "Baci di Dama" (Lady's Kisses) from Liguria are more similar to French Macaron (also because Liguria confines with French), but they comes in 2 types only (chocolate and vanilla) and they are much less sweet, so you can eat more without feeling ready for dialysis. Not an expert of Macaron though; I had a few here and there, but this time I wanted to go big, so I ordered 15 flavors to taste all of them! I really enjoyed Coconut and Pistachio! The Salted Caramel is really nasty (but this is my personal opinion), all the Chocolate ones can be skipped away. I understand Rose and Violet Cassis are graceful. But, honestly, 15 are too many ... last night I couldn't sleep!  So this morning I called my personal MD (my sister in Italy) asking how did it happen and she explained that is a normal reaction to high sugar in blood.. never happened before! And I've never seen Macaron in Italy too and she told me that a few years ago they tried hard to market them, however they last only a few seasons. Her explanation was simple: comparing side to side Macaron and Macaroni, Macaron fails in both taste and price! And actually Macaron are based on low cost ingredients, but for some magical marketing reason their price is stellar: $3.00 each.  Yes, Paul told me that on Earl Grey they put real edible gold, but it doesn't explain the price of the others. In any case gold is an heavy metal that can only damage my kidney, so why should I eat it? Another marketing magic nonsense!In my opinion, the reason they are so popular in the US, especially among women, is because they are sickly sweet, colorful, and light in weight so - apparently - having less calories, making you feel less guilty than eating a cup cake for example.Bottega Louie is an interesting and elegant place, fun bar, super clean, kind of noisy (I noticed no sound absorbent panels are in the ceiling), pizza is not excellent, espresso is very bitter, but Macarons are perfect in the sense of how they are supposed to be!4.9 for Macaron quality 4.8 for ambient 3.5 for the noise 1.0 for the primitive use of edible gold in Earl Grey (it is toxic)3.55, rounded 4 StarsLuigius - Thor of Yelp Energy________________________Amy N.'s Best Review (Self-Evaluated on 5/17/2016) :

I am definitely a fan of this establishment! I love the food and the pastries. All of the waitresses were very nice and attentive. The only downside would be parking and the open seating and layout of the restaurant, which makes it very noisy.
One of the best macaron places in LA, but pretty pricey tbh! I've never had a bad dessert here. Everything is as decadent as it is beautiful!
I recommend Bottega Louie to everybody!  Pizza, steak, seafood, Bottega Loiue has it all.
Wow so Yammy! I'd like eat this more! Great place, great attitude. I got to this place with a couple of friends on Saturday at around 2pm.
Their macarons are amazing, and they are so colorful. They taste very creamy yet crunchy.
Tasty!!! Sliders are my favorite

Bottega Louie is a fun place that's hard not to like. The interior is vast with tall ceilings, and the front has their cafe where they sell their famous French macaroons in assorted colors. This is one of my favorite places to go when I'm downtown and meeting people from work for dinner. The food is consistent and good, and the ambiance feels brisk and well suited for work related meals. I would want to take a date someplace more intimate and romantic, but Bottega Louie definitely is worth a trip when you're in the area.
Overpriced, always crowded but delicious Macaroons!

When I'm in Los Angeles I have to have at least one meal at Bottega Louie!This Italian restaurant has excellent pasta dishes and an extensive wine list. I've never been disappointed, during my recent visit I tried the veal marsala with a serving of pasta on the side. The portions are better than average, I couldn't finish my dinner. The staff are terrific, very friendly.
yummy but expensive, love their beignets!

Took the fiancée here for an early Valentine's Day, and it was a positive experience overall.The food was really nice.  For starters we shared the Lobster nage, which is a clear lobster - infused broth with bits of lobster, this crazy rectangular 'sheet' of cauliflower (don't ask - no idea how they turned a vegetable into a thin sheet), raisins, and almonds.We also shared a side of their truffle mashed potatoes, which was heaven.  Familiar comfort food with a touch of sophistication.  Nice.Then came the tagliatelle Bolognese.  The pasta was made fresh, but seemed undercooked.  It was really doughy and chewy as I ate it, although the modest - looking serving was deceptively filling.The Margherita pizza came last and we only managed a slice each before deciding to take it home in a box (I had it for lunch the next day, and it was GOOD!).Finished the meal off with a passion fruit sorbet. Love sorbets.  She went with the Pavlova, a blueberry meringue pastry with fluffy passion fruit cream on the inside.  Just excellent.Now while the food was solidly good overall, the undercooked pasta knocks it down a half-star for me.  The other half-star penalty us for the service and ambiance. It wasn't an issue with our server who was a nice girl - but the other guys who served us alongside her.  One practically threw one of our dishes on the table before asking "you want cheese with that?".  I wanted to ask him to ask me that again in the same tone while looking me in the eye, but I kept my mouth shut.  The bro-ski wasn't worth the trouble.  If I wanted the 'by-the-slice' NYC pizzeria attitude I would've gone to one! Whatever man...The other knock is the ambiance, or the lack thereof.  Not really romantic, but more of a buzzy vibe.  The lighting wasn't the issue, but the cavernous ceilings and mostly bare walls basically makes the entire restaurant a large ECHO CHAMBER.  THE clamor of the throngs of people on the waitlist loitering around the front/bakery area wasn't helping, either.Not wanting to end it on a low note we stopped at the macaron counter to get a box of them.  Got the 13-count box, and we chose: 1 mango, 4 rose, 4 earl grey, and 4 cassis.  All were outstanding, reminiscent of the Ladurée macarons I tried in Paris with my fiancée. Nice!
The food is delicious!!!! cannot go wrong with anything you order.  The only downside is how crowded it gets and service can be a bit slow during the rush times for lunch and dinner.
I am a maaroons snob and I can tell you that these are almost the best I got since I had them in France.. I couldn't try all type though..
Me being a lover of Italian foods I have to say it was worth it and I had a great experiance
There Macaroons and pastries are so delicious! My son loves the chicken Parmesan dish and I always order myself one of there pasta dishes.

The pizza... oh the PIZZA. But the prices... oh the prices... lol! The pizza here is really amazing, but the macaroons are over priced, as are most of the desserts. I would recommend coming here for lunch or dinner, then sharing a dessert. Other than that everything is great.
I love this place!!! their macarons are to DIE for
The food is very excellent here! The experience was good but the wait for a table was unbelievable and it was very nosy in there.

I stop here every time I drive by!  This place is da bomb.  Pastries out of this world. I used to live in France & the macaroons are better here than there!Great, breakfasts + desserts. Stop here & have mouth orgasms =D
Tried to go here cannot find it I heard they have the best patties and will go to extremes to get here could not wait will come back!
Love their pizzas, but it does get very noisy around lunch time.
Delicious and was not at all disappointing!
Portobello fries are delicious ! Love their desserts and ambiance. I like coming here for lunch, it's always very busy and loud but thats how I like it.
Always enjoyable with friends or on a date
this place has the best of everything!!!!!! my kids love it great customer service and not too bad on price either
would be 5 stars if it wasn't so DAMN EXPENSIVE!I swear these DTLA places are getting ridiculous with their prices!!

Finally gave in a tried this spot for brunch and it didnt disappoint. The ambience is over the top along with the noise volume. The best part of the meal was the potabella mushroom fries. Very unique and addicting. The worst part, sorry to say, were the macaroons. Dont get me wrong, I have a sweet tooth, but they were beyond sweet for my taste. They looked ao darn pretty though.

I give Bottega Louie 4/5 Stars. I think that they are good but they just do not have that extra little bit of DTLA hipster for me to give them 5/5. I would take a date here but it would be a place that I have in the back of my mind and remember that they can always perform a solid job with my delightful rainbow colored macaroons.If you have a girlfriend who is macaroon crazy, or just a girlfriend in general, she will like this place. However, if you are looking for a good first date kind of place, I recommend something a little more hipster.Enjoy, DTLA! M Man OUT!
Love their Macaron!!!Salted caramel, earl grey and raspberry flavors are the best
love the food, too noisy
Very good food and a fun place to go if you don't go there during peak hours.  Hard to get to as well.
I love to go to Bottega. Great deserts! Last week tried their portabello fries and it was awesome. One star down is for loudness , but overall is a great place to enjoy you deserts.

Love the Pasta & Pizza !!
wonderful macaroons.

The place was lovely. The staffs were very accommodating and really attentive of what we are needing. Another thing was the place, it was very clean and well decorated. I highly recommend this place and I am coming back..

A great place with fantastic food variety and well executed product. For a venue that offers such a diverse amount of food they manage to really keep it together and deliver. Ive heard they are opening in my Weho neighborhood and frankly I cant wait. I will be a regular.

Service and food was great.  I have always walked by there and wondered what it would be like to eat there.  So I gave it a try.

Good Service, great food, the burrata pizza is great with the muscles with a bottle of wine !  I try to sit outside in front of the bar area since its first come first serve, and the wait for the main dining room is always a long ass wait.  Macarons are the most consistent of the ones ive tried in LA. not the best but always good.  BUT aside from the macarons the other pastries are nothing special but they look pretty so i guess thats why they sell.

This place has a great ambiance. The pastries and other sweets displayed add bright color to the white decor. The menu has a ton of variety. The portobello mushrooms are a must! I liked it. The croissants were yummy for my tummy. The coffee was pretty good. Great prices. To quote our former Governor... I'll be back.
great place to play ans spend my extra time

The desserts!!! So beautiful and delicious! I always go out of my to come here for lunch when I'm in the area. It's definitely worth it. The food I've ordered has always been superb. Favorite menu items definitely have to be the caprese salad (2 big cold tomato halves with buttery textured mozzarella), the chopped salad and the pizzas. great food and great location

Delicous. Great snacks. I come here often when in town.
The food was very good and the dessert area is unreal.  Will be back again.

One of my favorite place.I really enjoy come in here. It is pricy, but worth it. Very nice place to go, delicious food and beautiful desserts are just make your day. Parking is a problem, but it's Downtown.Sometimes very noisy, and table are located too close to each other.Staff are polite and nice, always know about menu, they can answer any single question - professionals!
This place was gorgeous!!  Once you walk in you will see a huge array of desserts all beautifully decorated.

Always crowded and a bit noisy, but always a great dining experience. Such good service from the servers, they all make you feel important. Wide selection of delicious, almost too-pretty-to-eat French-inspired desserts. Will keep coming back!

A wonderful place to take people who've never been to Downtown Los Angeles!  Interesting space and ambiance, beautifully plated approachable food for the carnivore OR the vegetarian, and a glorious french bakery with reknowned macarons.  This is a don't-miss!

We got here on Saturday afternoon and the place was packed.  We were told it would be about 45 mins for a table. Since we weren't starving and there was filming downtown with a few street closures that would have had us driving around almost that long to get a meal, we decided to stick around. We "only" had to wait 30 mins.The quality of food and service was excellent. I had the Trenne with rib eye which was very good. My dinner partner had the Casareccia and it was excellent.  We split the Creme Brulee which was amazing, one of the best I've had. Bottega Louie is a must do when downtown.
Great food & atmosphere. Lively atmosphere that's good to take clients or meet for after work drinks. Thumbs up!
Love the ambiance, the food, and servers were pretty helpful though it was pretty loud.

In all honesty, I am a huge fan of their pasta and pizzas. It is a great restaurant, HOWEVER, the thing that keeps me from actually making my way out there is the parking. DTLA parking is not only terrible, but really really $$$$$. With all these courier / delivery apps out there, I tend to choose the comfort of my home (I usually go with RushOrder app (not sure if still valid but try promo code HUNGRY3 for a couple bucks off) - especially after some poor experiences with the other apps out there). Even with the delivery fee & tip, I'd probably be paying more for a stinking parking spot out there. ANYWAY on to the food. They do have a seasonal menu, but there are many core items that are always there. When I order with my friends, we usually get a bunch of stuff and share. The arugula salad and modena salad are very good salads to go with your other items. The mac and cheese with bacon, duck prosciutto corstini, and  portobello fries (so good) were what we went with the last time we ordered for delivery. As for the pizza, I've tried the margherita and the sausage pizza which are all very good (cheesy, thin crisp crust, etc). Just typing this out is getting my super hungry and to avoid the wot, i'll stop here.
Fun place, you can get goodies to bring back to family and friends.

A notorious eatery in DTLA. As many other have noted, the noise level is intense so not the best choice for a romantic date or long conversation with a friend over food. Everyone needs to eat here and I mean every single person on the planet; this place really is that good.

This review is for the bakery only.My friends have been raving about the bakery and deserts here for years.  I finally made it here and was not disappointed.  I was overwhelmed by the choices so I asked for some recommendations from counter staff.  They were very helpful and led me in the right direction.Purchased a fruit tart with vanilla creme.  So delicious !!!!  Portion was small but made up for it with its flavor.  Berries were fresh.  Highly recommended.Purchased a dozen macaroons.  They were out of this world.  Great selection of flavors.  My favorite was chocolate chocolate and raspberry.  Shell was nice and crispy and filing was creamy.  Worth every penny.  I plan on coming back soon for a full meal.Located in DTLA so parking can be difficult.  Highly recommended.

Food and prices are great but very noisy and crowded. I like their pizza. Also their desert selections are good.

Great venue with such a diverse off that is a fantastic benefit for the downtown market. They execute really well, the food is on point and the place is a great buzz despite being really large.

I had dinner here for my 20th birthday a few years back. The building itself is great with the big windows. Although the high ceilings open up the room, it does increase the noise level. The service is decent but the food was very good. The chocolate soufflé is a must!

The coffee was probably one of the smoothest i,ve tasted. Since it was a hot day, i ordered a iced Latte medium sized. It was so smooth, it got addicting. The taste was perfect. Not too sweet and not too strong, but just the perfect hit of espresso. Just 4 stars?? the price...

Ate there the other night after taking in a show at Club Nokia.  It was good--not "Great" as I had hoped but good!  It's a really nice place, well decorated, the service was excellent.  I think what I liked best was the dessert, a peanut butter and chocolate affair that managed to taste delicate and rich at the same time.  I would definitely go back.  Especially for dessert!
who isn't a fan. this place is great! its beautiful here, I love it.
Great service. I love their pizza! Big portion and so fresh! Everything made in front of you. The Marguarita pizza is just amazing!
One of my favorite places to get a fresh hand tossed pizza, and the macaroons are to die for. Just thinking about the food makes my mouth water.

I've been here on a couple of occasions now, and have been pretty happy with each visit. The Lobster Nage soup is tastes like the lobster took a bath in it...beautifully presented with the cauliflower panna cotta. The salad with butter lettuce and candied walnuts is really good...a bit overdressed for me, though. The pizzas are first rate...super crispy crust with the right amount of chew. I love the macarons. I usually come home with a box and the Earl Grey is my favorite.

The Clam Linguini was delicious and the other dishes were pretty good as well. The bread was decent and the waiter was nice. However, he did not give us change when we gave him cash and credit card.
