So cute. Delicious pizza! The wait is super long for a table and it is pretty expensive, but if you plan it out this is a great date spot. Definitely going back soon!

I am only giving this place a 3 star because it is so LOUD! the building is an older building and man do my ears HURT! The food is AMAZING! I love the pizza! they are very well known for their macaroons. I'm not a fan of sweets but yummy!Feels you are in Paris!sad to say, I would not come here on a date. I would definitely come here with a friend I am trying to NOT COMMUNICATE WITH because it is so loud. The foods GREAT!!!
love love love
Always a good time at Louies!
so gooooood!!!!
Great Food!
One of my favorite spots downtown...One of the best white pizza's in town...Only problem is it is very loud and i spend too much money there always...haha..
Bottega bottega bottega louie! Love the spot come here for my daily macaroon dose, love the atmosphere the noise and how this place makes me feel . keep it up bottega!
Can you say EXPENSIVE!! Just for some cookies?!
I really like the quality here

Definitely a Downtown favorite!  What's not to like.  I love the ambiance, yes can be loud at times and always super busy, but in my opinion that's the draw, not to mention the food is yummy.  I have had and enjoyed just about everything on their menu.  I love the portabello fries, clam linguine, short rib, burrata & roasted vine tomatoes, I could go on and on.  For dessert...  Of course the macaroons!  Who can resist those little treats of pure bliss.  I love them all but the lavender is my favorite.  I never pass up an opportunity to head over to Bottega.
Fantastic place for a desert when you're out with friends!

everything looks nice and expensive. stopped by here one time and got one of their apple pie muffins. pretty delicious if u dont mind getting chubby lol. stuff seemed a little overwhelmed, lots of people. good place to show of for a date tho.
Great place, but very loud.
Awesome decor and atmosphere. Always make sure to stop by when I'm visiting DTLA

It has been approx. 6 weeks after my surgery and I am absolutely amazed by the results!My body keeps "shrinking" and I am starting to fit into clothes I couldn't even remotely fit in before.. I highly recomond sonobello to anyone who wants to lose some extra fat .

This place is great!  Their layout is sooooo pretty and everything was sooo beautiful.  The food is great too, but you mostly come here because of the desserts.  It's really busy and the mood is nice; the only problem is that there are way too many other people that can make your dining experience a bit annoying because it's so popular, but that's really not their fault, you know?  Definitely recommended!
love their raspberry croisaints
The food is really fresh but the price is kinda expensive.  My pizza was a little bit burnt but my Cesar salad was really good.

their macaroons are good but i never understood why it costs so much.nice place nontheless and if the gf wants their macaroons i have no choice but to buy them. damn you bottega louie for draining my wallet.
Kind of have to come here if you're nearby, right? The food is pretty good and everything is really very pretty. Our server was awesome and made the overall experience fun!
beautiful place, great food, horrible part of town.

The pizza is amazing and the salads are really good as well.We usually go there over the weekend and the line is kinda long, but we are still ok with waiting.Service is great also.The only one thing I would like changed is if the prices would have been a little less then what they are now :)Oh, the dessert is just amazing !!!
Noisyyyyy but loved the macaroons !also love just being inside ! very nicely designed .
I love their sweat treats here.The only thing is...the price!UGH, i love them though.
I love it!!

The Kale salad was amazing ! I loved the combination of ingredients. The buttermilk dressing complimented the dish very well.  huge selection of deserts, but to be honest I did not even pay attention to that.  I was magnetically drawn to the extensive library of macarons. I ended up getting two box's of a combination of rose and Earl Grey . :)The macarons were good. But not as good as other places I tried before ..  I would give these macaroons a 7.5-8 but it's definitely up there.
2 words.. portabello fries!!!
I love going to this spot whenever I am in Downtown! Try one of their lattes too!
Was here for a friend's B-Day - food was delicious but pricy!
It's admitidly good, but not worth the wait (they don't take reservations).
Went here when I was downtown last week. The pastries are wonderful, but the food in the dining room is first rate. It's a bit of Europe dropped into downtown. I will go again for sure.
Parking is not fun, but the food and atmosphere is really fun and definitely makes up for the difference!
Amazing food. Doesn't matter what time of day or day of the week you come. This is decadence at its area best.
Loved this place!

Love, love,loveme some macaroons this place is delicious and anytime i am in the area sure to stop by. I go here once in a while for lunch exceptional menu and sooo much to do around the area all these bars to go to as well definitely recommend anyone to come here
Great food.  Noisy.
Went there last Saturday. The artichoke pizza is the must - was really good. My fav dessert is a salted caramel macaroon.
Delicious.  Noisy but delicious.
The service and servers were polite and the facility was clean! Thank You Domino's!

Prefer this place for their desserts, but somehow I still come back for their food. Their pizzas aren't anything extraordinary but it's great for sharing. Their portobello mushroom fries with the aioli sauce is soo worth it. Also, get the souffle, but order it early enough. Don't come here if you expect to talk to anyone or have a heart to heart. Despite the great ambiance, it's extremely loud. You'll be yelling across the table most of the time. Might be great to come with someone you don't expect to talk to.
I took my grown children here for a treat and thought the food was nothing special. The ambiance is cool and pastries are beautiful and tempting.

We came here specifically to try to pastries, which didn't disappoint! They had a lovely selection of macaroons, the salted caramel being my personal favorite. There was also seating for dining as well, which we have to wait for next time. The place was great, except it was jam packed and rather unorganized. The huge staff wasn't actually helpful or engaging. Good over all experience!
Good food and even though the place always seems busy I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a table and service has always been quick.
Love the food great place to eat and enjoy with friends
Love this place!
Great pastries and cookies, slightly pricey, and not super accommodating with special orders.
Louie salad. Omg yum.
Great food and service but OMG it is so crowded no matter what time of the day I go there!
The view is amazing, BUT it's overpriced, I hate cocktails in plastic glasses and the staff is not always friendly, particularly when it's packed.

Bottega Louie has a delicious assortment of breads, cakes and cookies. The yellow cake with pink butter cream frosting is absolutely divine! You will be impressed! I wish I had a slice of it right now!
LOVE! Great flavors and options
Love the macarons, the amazing pizza and the beautiful restaurant!
Great food. Lovely place to brunch.  I especially love the deserts. I feel comfortable here. However, the plays can get too busy and it is a little pricey place.
good stuff
beautiful location, amazing amazing build out. came for the macarons.

nice ambiance, city vibe, nice decor.had lunch there. loved the friend mushroom.would like to go back some time if the parking was easy.good to go and have an experience.oh! I really like the restroom.
Great drinks and food but the desert tops all.
Pros:Chocolate SouffleAffordableDesert!Cons:Parkingnoise :(Good place for a lunch date though!

Yesterday we had lunch at a new place for us. Its Suma Sushi on Summitt in Fontana. Its right off the 15 fwy at Summitt. It was a nice experience, the sushi chef was very friendly and the food was awesome! Fresh! I had a Tiger roll which was Salmon and my husband has a Jalepeno Roll, which he enjoyed very much. There is such a nice variety in the menu. Reasonable too!We definately will be revisiting this place on a regular basis.Anita M
Love everything except the noise level.
tasty but pricey!
Awesome Macaroons, good food and very large sizes.
Really good desserts.  The food is alright, but the ambiance and desserts are great.  I love too that they have some gluten free options!
Nice but the ambiance is a little loud and no reservations sucks
Delicious food and expansive menu!

LOVE stopping by Bottega whenever I visit DTLA! It's best to go before the crazy lunch hour because it's really hard to hear! Super loud from open arrangement seating. Food is AMAZING though and the those Sprinkle covered pretzels can't keep my away long enough!

Pretty solid place in downtown. Great ambiance, food is very tasty. Desserts are amazing also. Parking sucks, but park in the lot or on the street if you can find a spot. Also, NO RESERVATIONS - first come first serve basis. Plan to get a drink while waiting if you go during peak hours.
Never disappoints!
Great fun atmosphere for a little spot to get a treat.

First time I went to this place, I just loved it soooo Much. When you first walk in the case of desserts is a festival of color and delight for the eyes.An open flair to this Italian resultant. The pizza is amazing as well as all the side options. A great place to have a drink, go on a date or a fun place to take good friends,
Amazing food, amazing host, and amazing management. enough said.
fun atmosphere - good baked goods!

Our food was FANTASTIC! The waiter forgot to bring my salad, but I didn't need it. The dessert wasn't anything amazing, but the filet and black truffle creamed spinach was the best I've ever had! Would definitely recommend.
Lasagna is definitely good.  As far as service: hit and miss.
Love the pizza, don't like the wait

We were able to walk from our hotel to Bottega Louie which was great. The bartender was super friendly and let us sample wines until we found one we liked. The waiter helped me pick my dinner selection as I couldn't decide. Food was good and the atmosphere was lively yet nice.
pricy, beautiful and tasty
Love it but it is SO loud
I come here for coffee and pastries often, both of which are great. The ambiance is beautiful. You can also pick up nice presents for anyone who loves chocolate, and other food goodies.
One of the waiters doesn't know the difference between a cappuccino and a macchiato. Everything else is good.
its good. People love the baked goods, and brunch there is tons of fun. They have a great bar staff, Although i would pick some other places to go downtown first.
Simply Loves it!!!
Love it here!

Interesting cliche European atmosphere with a twist of Vegas. I enjoyed my chocolate palmier and a selection of deserts ranging from a steroid driven Napoleon and some nice sorbets. Recommended if you don't mind getting ripped off and love to enjoy overly crowded and noisy bars.

I usually go here for the tarts and those are soooo good. If you don't like sweets, you may not like it but some are not sweet that much. I can tell you'll be addicted to it. Pastas, pizzas, and other dishes are tasty enough! but some were not my favorite. You must go if you visit downtown LA!
Bright atmosphere bustling. Service is great. Good food. Macaroons are yum and fresh.

My wife and I eat at Bottega Louie whenever we are downtown. The food and the service are excellent and the prices are average for an upscale, but casual restaurant. The atmosphere is loud, but to be expected given the size of the dining area and the fact the the restaurant has very high ceilings and walls that have no insulation to absorb echoing sounds. With that said, we think it adds to the ambiance and the experience. This is a restaurant that is definitely worth visiting.
Not bad. Pretty pricey but its worth it every now and then

There is something about the atmosphere of this place that I love. It is located in Downtown LA, and it is a big place with very high ceilings and it gets busy and noisy. The food is good, love the macaroons! Very good pasta dishes, reasonably priced for decent Italian food. I will be back when in the area!
Fun place with good food.
If you love Macaroons then check out this place. I recommend asking for the freshest ones. Coffee was just ok, everything else great.

Pretty good food. Always a solid meal. It is just SO damn loud. You can't go here to talk. The place is very pretty and happening. I made the mistake of taking a client here for a meeting. Food was good but we couldn't talk. We had to go for a drink after just to get the meeting done. Luckily downtown is filled with great places now. Lots of good little bars and great restaurants. I actually lived in a loft close by for 8 months and when you are dinning alone this is a great place.
great location.  lots of dining space.  great atmosphere.  pizza was amazing.  gets loud, gets crowded.

I'm a fan of the food and the service is so-so but not terrible. My mother was in town yesterday so after work we met up here and it was full to capacity. One can't help but take pictures of all the pastries here. My mother loved the macaroons. Every time I drive by this area, I notice it gets packed to capacity,  so it's always a plus to get there around 5pm. There will be a Whole Foods in the area where parking was once available so make sure you park on the lot heading north for $10.

Great atmosphere and delicious food. Unfortunately they don't take reservations so that is a reason not to venture Downtown sometime, but generally worth the wait. Little market inside also with pre-made food, desserts and gourmet grocery items.
Wonderful atmosphere, bar and food...a bit noisy, but worth it!!!
The ambiance is amazing, the service is impeccable, the food could be a lot better.
This restaurant is just phenomenal. The wait is long, but well worth it. The food is very unique and the tastes are fresh and just overall good.
Sunday brunch is delish & affordable!
The Earl Grey macaron's are off the hook.
Great place! Come here all the time and I'm never disappointed. Show up before 4 on a Sunday for a special experience.
Excellent service, prime location, and good coffee. A little pricey though.
Love this place for brunch or lunch!
Very good food but come in the afternoon of morning , evening very noisy. Cappuccino is good as well
It's such a delicious place but it's so expensive! :(

Bottega Louie serves amazing food. The only problem at this restaurant is that it is very noisy. The high ceilings don't help. The service is excellent and there is a huge menu of creative food choices!

The vibe was amazing from the moment we walked through the door. I was tempted to skip lunch and jump straight to desert after passing the patisserie on my way to the host stand. The service was excellent, food was delicious, and the vibe was awesome. Definitely my go to place when I am downtown.
Well-cooked pastas and pizza (big enough for 2). Amazing array of desserts and pastries--don't miss the macaroons.
Very good food but come in the afternoon of morning , evening very noisy. Cappuccino is good as well

AMAZING! I love Bottega Louie's classy yet vibrant atmosphere. Best Portobello Fries and Chocolate Souffle in the world. The restaurant can get very loud though, so it's difficult to have good conversations. But other than that, highly recommend!
great place for macaroons! great treats and amazing during xmas time!
Pizza is expensive for having zero flavor.
AMAZING. If i could afford to i would eat here every day. Service was top notch. Food Incredible. They do a vegitarian tasing menu which is hard to come by.
The greatest portabello fries I've ever had! Yes, Mr. Bartender, I'll have another order of those and another delicious cocktail. Thanks!
I love their macarons!
This restaurant is just phenomenal. The wait is long, but well worth it. The food is very unique and the tastes are fresh and just overall good.
good

Nice location and good food. The resturant gives you a mixture feeling of italian and french resturants. I ordered trenne pasta, a crisby pasta with red wine, I loved it. It was very different. Do not forget to order dessert!!!

Overall everything is perfect, good food, good atmosphere, but need to go off hours so you don't have a long wait!! I love exploring the beautiful pastries at the pastry counter! Lots of mouth watering selection, that taste fabulous too!
Faves:Portabello friesBraised short ribsNutella beignetsHoneydew juice
super yummy but crazy busy there's always a wait, but it's worth it
I'm a fan! Visited once with my wife and we love macaroons so it was pretty enjoyable. Would recommend anybody to try definitely worth a visit. Only thing was a long line.. but what can we do?
Love the ambiance here. The macarons are delicious!
great stuff. i'm a big fan. will recommend
Amazing food. The Trenne pasta dish is hands down the best. Lobster Nage is quite good too.

1)  ambiance:  high ceiling-ed, simple yet with a touch of femininity, open kitchen, mood lighting, everything :)2)  wait time:  on a monday night (7:30pm), 10-15 min wait time for a party of 6.3)  parking:  there's a parking garage right across from the restaurant, but there are plenty of metered spots around, so keep your eyes peeled!4)  service:  great team of servers from servers to server assistants.5)  outside food & beverage policy:  $0 corkage fee for first bottle, $15 subsequent bottles.  are you kidding me?!  amazing!  please do not change this policy for as long as you're in business.  also, my friend amie gifted me a delicious raspberry chocolate cake and the bl team set up the candle and cut the cake for us without "cake cutting" fee.  please don't change this either.
Super busy and super noisy - but try an early morning brunch on the weekends. You get all the food (which is pretty good, and decent prices) and none of the noise and crowds.
love this place I would go here anytime
My absolute favorite French Macaron from Bottega Louie, the Earl Grey. Just look at that chocolate ganache filling!
Amazing pizza. Very cool loud place. Wish they took reservations as this place can get very crowded on weekends.

in the heart of downtown surrounded by the deterioration of the neighborhood, shines this fantastic bakery / restaurant. all the pastries are delicious and the place is very nice. We also had dinner and we were very pleased. We drank at the counter waiting to have the table. The person is very friendly, the place very elegant. I highly recommend you spend even just for a cupcake!

We stopped here for a quick breakfast of pastries and coffees. Honestly. for such a high-end looking Italian bakery/restaurant, I was disappointed by the limited and "usual" selection of breakfast pastries. They were fine, but did not match my expectations. My cappuccino was delicious.Notice, there is no waitress service for pastries and drinks only, but there are tables. You order and pay at the counter. Prices are a little on the high side.

We liked this restaurant through against a crazy world! The only downside is that it is noisy but apart from that this place is very nice !!!! Italian fresh and authentic cuisine made before your eyes, fast service, friendly team. A test on a weeknight LA

Ummm I had the Lobster Hash and we shared Pizza and Pancakes... Everything was FANTASTIC. Bring a friend, you'll need the help, we didn't get into the cakes, macaroons and pastries but they also looked amazing. If your not thinking price? It's a fun place to spend hours and hours in. Good atmosphere too...

We had an excellent experience - open late on a Sunday evening, festive crowd, beautiful restaurant, great service and delicious food. What's not to like? Hip enough for the teenagers in our party, but not too outlandish for the oldsters. Can't wait to return next time we're in L.A.

Whoa! This place is always packed, but worth the wait. I've eaten here a few times when visiting L.A. and have had a great experience. Their brunch is pretty standard, with an upscale twist. During my recent visit, I had the beignets with their raspberry compote...incredible! They are light and fluffy and all sorts of sugary! I can never resist grabbing a macaron or two for friends. It's the perfect gift and they are always changing up flavors.
Great place to have lunch when downtown. The noise level is a bit much at times. Had a great waiter named Joey this last time i was there. He was great. Pastries are little pricey.
DELICIOUS! Can't resist. Favorite place for dessert.

We had a very late dinner here thanks to airline delays last week. At 10 pm, the place was not too noisy or crowded, and service was excellent.We split a pizza, half buratta and half artichoke. We also had a side order of brussels sprouts with pistachio. The pizza was very good and the sprouts were tasty, but could have been cooked a minute or two longer.
Great desserts!

There is something about the atmosphere of this place that I love. It is located in Downtown LA, and it is a big place with very high ceilings and it gets busy and noisy. The food is good, love the macaroons! Very good pasta dishes, reasonably priced for decent Italian food. I will be back when in the area!

We had a very late dinner here thanks to airline delays last week. At 10 pm, the place was not too noisy or crowded, and service was excellent. We split a pizza, half buratta and half artichoke. We also had a side order of brussels sprouts with pistachio. The pizza was very good and the sprouts were tasty, but could..

My wife and I eat at Bottega Louie whenever we are downtown. The food and the service are excellent and the prices are average for an upscale, but casual restaurant. The atmosphere is loud, but to be expected given the size of the dining area and the fact the the restaurant has very high ceilings and walls that have no insulation to absorb echoing sounds. With that said, we think it adds to the ambiance and the experience. This is a restaurant that is definitely worth visiting.
Love this place. Too loud for some, so if you are a quiet freak, don't come.
Gorgeous place, stunning macaroons!! Visiting makes me feel culturally intact!

I loved Bottega Louie. Has a cool atmosphere and the food is pretty delicious. Took a girl on a first date, she was probably impressed. The only complaint that I dare voice is that the portions of the food was a little small.
best macaroons !!!
Very fun for dates. Loud atmosphere. Get's very busy for dinner.
really good and the customer service was superb!
This restaurant is just phenomenal. The wait is long, but well worth it. The food is very unique and the tastes are fresh and just overall good.
great food + atmosphere.  a little on the loud side, so kind of hard to have good conversations with friends...
Loud but lovely.

Okay this a late review but from what I remember this place is a bit to overpriced and parking is a issue but I will give it a 4 because of there Great service and Neat style of plating etc but the food wasnt satisfying for me I guess ima bit of a fatass maybe thats why. Its kindve loud there but some people love that:)
only complaint is it's loud.
So nice
Checked this place out with my BF we enjoyed the food!
Great food, top notch service, this place is great!
I Love Botteg-a Louie

Froofy froofy spot in LA everyone knows about and will most likely be filled with at least one C list actor you may have seen in that one time on that one show in the background.BUT, don't let that distract you from the food. If you can get over the crowd and the cliche-ness of this spot, you'll enjoy it.  Really intimate, really busy.  You MUST have a reservation.  Don't set yourself up for failure and, although the wait for it is 20 minutes, do NOT miss your chance to try their soufflé.  I didn't get anything to eat and didn't need to, because the soufflé made up for it. I'd go back for it alone.The dessert display at the front of the store is absolutely beautiful and one of the main reasons why I believe people are attracted to this place.
excellent!
Love the Bakery in this lovely store.
This place should be on anyone and everyone's bucket list. I've tried a fair share of sweets and desserts...and I'm confident to say that this place has the BEST macarons. Must try the earl grey one!
A very nice place to eat. The dessert selection is endless.
Awesome.  Sorta loud.  But still awesome.
Food was delicious and the Service was Awesome!

WOW! Walked into this place and was in heaven! If the deserts don't lure you in, I don't know what will. This restaurant does not take reservations, you just go! It is a huge place, so there are lots of tables, very close together though. Service was very good, our server was knowledgeable, and had a great personality. The food was killer, and the deserts were out of this world. Well done BL!
so good, a little loud but great.
Go for just dessert after a show or dinner.
good macaroons n coffee . fancy shmancy
Great food and  ambiance in downtown LA. Great lunch or dinner place. When I lived downtown it was a great place to walk to.

Food is great!  Atmosphere is great!    It's noisy.  That's the only problem.  Not a great place for a meal if you want to talk to someone.   Otherwise, I would recommend it.  The pastries are really something to look at.   They have a separate bakery and cafe.  It kind of reminds me of cafes in Europe.    A little expensive, especially those pastries.
mushroom fries !!
a LOT of jews here.a lot.

Very fun, upbeat environment. Expect it to be very loud. I do not suggest Louie if you'd like to go on an intimate date. You can barely hear each other talk, however fun exciting place to be. Prime people watching.. Haha. The food is very good. I had the portobello fries and spaghetti. Loved the fries, spaghetti was good if you're looking for a simple go to plate. Our server, Bill and his back waiter were very kind and catered to our every need.

Prefer this bakery for their desserts, but somehow I still come back for their food. Their pizzas aren't anything ordinary but it's amazing for sharing. Their portobello mushroom chips with the aioli sauce is soo worth it. Also, get the souffle, but purchase it. Regardless of the ambiance that is large, it's exceptionally loud. You will be yelling across the table most of the time. Might be excellent to come with someone you don't anticipate to talk to.
had fun, pretty nice place! would visit again.
Pros:-Pizza was AMAZING-great date night atmosphere -short wait for a friday night-yummy dessertsCons:-cocktail prices
Too loud to talk. Too fun to care.
This place's atmosphere is great. I have tried several things on the menu and they are all really good. I would definitely go back.Ryan

This place is consistently good...the macarons are very nice and the food is even better. The only thing I don't like is that its fairly loud, but I don't really mind; I just thought I should mention it.
A little loud and hectic, but great food, and old school vibe!
One of my favorite restaurants in Los Angeles. It looks very crowded, but I've never waited for more than 20 minutes even during peak times. The macarons are amazing!!
ok but the staff can be nicer!
Macaroons and the decor are the best things about this place.
Loud, but quick and efficient service

This is thebest late night or anytime food place you can get in this city. The service was great!I judge pizza spots based on consistency across the mneu, not just their singature item! If they killed it with the thin crust, I for sure know that the deep dish has gota to be even better!At first tase, you can tell tha tall the toppings are great quality.
Nice atmosphere and good food, what else can you ask for?!
Definitely the Macaroons and Mushroom Fries.
Love it!. A bit loud but aside from that the food is great. Becoming a Bottega Louie regular. hehe

If you're in the LA area, this place is a MUST TRY. Not only is the food and dessert amazing, the over all ambience is totally cool and makes you feel like you fit right into the LA scene. My personal fave is the Mushroom Pizza, its heaven for mushroom fanatics like myself.  Don't forget to pick up a box of macaroons on your way out, those things are TO DIE FORRR!!! If you come on the weekend, expect a super long wait... a wait that is well worth it ;)
Nice fresh food.
very good food. try it, you like it.
Cool place. NY-ish. Busy, very busy though..

Macaroons were amazing! Bought the pack of 13. And that Nutella donut thing was so delicious! We had dinner on a Tuesday night. It was pretty packed. We ordered a magarita pizza, Parmesan sliders and a lasagna. Everything was so good. Especially the lasagna, nothing like I've ever tasted before. It was very loud, kinda had to raise my voice to get my point across. Service was okay, but it took about 35 minutes before my pizza was delivered to my table. Other than that, I will return.
I came here for the macarons.They were delicious!  I would go back.Try the caramel.I had to pay for parking across the street, but i know they have a private lot.
Delicious macarons.  Came here twice for coffee and macarons.  Fancy and expensive.
love this place - great food and great vibe
Cool spot
food was great.  yes, the mushroom fries are really good.  it has an ny restaurant vibe but is a little loud for my taste.  parking can be tough but such is the case anywhere in downtown.
Awesome food!
one of my favorite downtown restaurant

Honestly, the food is good. Not the best but good enough. I come here for their cocktails and their macrons. Not the cheapest in town but my kids love them so I drive all the way here in traffic to pick some up for them whenever their heart desires.
Too loud, but delicious.
Great place! Hate the wait sometimes, but other then that, I have never had anything I did not like and always have had great service!!
Perfect place! The best macaroons!
It's one of my new favorite places to go in DTLA.The waitress was really nice my niece enjoyed the sandbox and the food was delicious can't wait to come back
Great macaroons, pizza and sandwiches. Very comfortable space with a high ceiling. Service and wait staff are great! Definitely recommend this place.
So fancy, great atmosphere really noisy though. you should come here at least once.
chicken parmesan**!!!
One of the best nights I had in a while... Downtown at Bottega Louie... Good friends, food, desert and service! What more can you ask for... I would give it a try for sure.

Thank you, David F. for bringing me to this place.  I've had this bookmarked for over a year but didn't want to go through the hassle of getting lost in the one way streets of DTLA and then looking or paying for a parking spot so I never went.  Its so nice to just sit back and relax while someone else does the driving for you.  Especially after a long day at work. I might come back to give their Eggs Benedict a try one of these days.  The pictures look so yummy.And absolutely not a great place for your first date unless if you don't mind yelling over the din.  Or if you're fine with staying quiet and gazing longingly into your date's eyes which I must point out is creepy if it IS your first date.My only negative about this place is that it's so expensive for lunch that I'd not go again unless I were to be the guest of someone, as I was for this afternoon.  I can see how it could get very loud with a large crowd - my advice is to go during the off hours; the staff is available, the food delicious, it's clean and lovely.  Just make sure you have deep pockets!
Love the atmosphere and service and food!

This place can get very loud, with its high ceilings and busy atmosphere.  The service is great, and the food is decent, but the pizza is a bit pricey for what you get.  They have a great desert section and it looks soo pretty!  Parking is tough to find so budget some time for parking.
Came here for brunch on SatThey said wait would be at least 40 min but it was quick.Ordered french toast and NY egg sandwich.French toast, bread was really goodNY sandwich was on point with the egg.

We only dropped in here for a quick look around, but ended up buying some macaroons. They were delicious :) Only downside was that it was pretty busy (was around 730pm on a saturday) so no one really acknowledged us right away... buttttt... it was probably our fault as we didn't walk in with too much direction. Macaroons were DELICIOUSLY soft and chewy, and the variety of flavors to choose from were huge. Will definitely be back to check the place out for dinner soon.
Our waiter was a little rude but the food was amazing!
If you like carbs and sweets, this is the downtown destination for you.

My favorite macaroon place. Parking is so inconvenient though.Food is just average. Noise level is awful.The deserts are the only good part about this place. But I have not tastedbetter macaroons in my lifetime.I definately give the macaroons 5 stars.
Ehh, this place is OK. I like to go here for a bottle of champagne from time to time. The food is pretty good, but also a little overpriced. Overall a good place to take a date.
Love their lemon ricotta pancakes and ALL their desserts!
Great Restaurant. One of my local spots to go. Great food. Service is always friendly but sometimes it can take a little long to get food. That's my only complaint. everything else is always great!!!

I love this place. The food is great. I haven't had breakfast here yet, but lunch and dinner were great. It does get busy crowded during the evenings especially Friday and Saturday. The marble floors and lack of sound absorbing materials leads to a loud environment, but it doesn't bother me. And yes, you have to try the pastries.
Great deserts and great service!
i was yelping for my fun when my eyes stopped and stared for a while on those beautiful macaroons.when i saw your location i was a bit disappointed but i sure will gonna visit your place ASAP.

Great atmosphere, as you walk in you think,you are in nyHigh ceilings and loudThe pizza is fantastic, you can split the flavor in 1/2 and 1/2 on your pizza, great macaroonsThe wait is tough sometimes at lunch, and with the construction in the area, parking is tough
Very delicious.
it's too crowed and noisy, everything else is good
Love Love Love macaron, and I must say, they have the best ones!It gets a little loud inside, so I don't like to dine here.
mmmm for the macaroons! yummm for the food! Can be a little bit loud, but I don't mind because I love the food and the ambiance.

Solid place.  Its a great value spot to checkout.  The lines are long, but its a worthwhile wait.  I ate here a while back and remember it was good and worth returning do down the road.  I also thought this would be a great date spot.I do remember that its a bit loud so it may be hard to have some conversation
it's great, can be a long wait though
Love this place...Get Pizza!!! Great cocktails too!
Buy those for your girl. Never a bad choice. This will make them happy~
pizza pizza pizza or the lemon ricotta pancakes. its loud and busy but a great place to take friends or family.

My children and I love the food here. The pizzas are delicious and the mushroom fries are our favorite. We love it here and go very often. I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 only because they don't take reservations and that makes it hard sometimes. Other than that, it's great!
Over rated, lovely place nonetheless.
Love the desserts and brunch!

Been here for lunch now 2 times and loved it both times. Excellent staff service from the moment you walk in the door. Young and energetic staff is professional. Food is excellent and presentation is great as well. This is one of the best dining concepts I have seen in LA in a long time. Highly recommend the pastas, the pizzas, and the meats - come to think of it, everything is great!
Super cute! I love the food, its amazing. I recommend it!
As long as the wait is under 90min

I love this place.  It's like being at a photo shoot for Vogue.  It's so pretty in here and everything looks good.  The macaroons are great and they have flavors I could not find anywhere else.  Always packaged so nice I recently gave some to a friend and it went over very well.  I have tried macaroons else where but these are always fresh and delicious!  We had a late dinner and it was a bit of a crowd so but it was worth the wait.

I like this restaurant, good ambiance, good food , nice atmosphere, just too damn bloody loud. If i am wanting a conversation during our meal I will probably have to go elsewhere.  The server was attentive and we enjoyed our meals throughly.  We bumped into some old friends we have not seen in ages, and I could not hear half of what they said. So that will conversation will have to be continued.All the desserts were tasty and good.  My wife enjoyed many of the Macaroons and took a heap with us also. I would recommend this place but not for business or an intimate outing.

The desserts are a delight!! There is a fine selection of macaroons from green tea to red velvet, i was in heaven. I was not very impressed with the dinner menu, I guess it's because I'm a vegetarian but the service was superior.The decor was inviting, i did like the open kitchen which allows you to see all the food prep.
always good
Great place to bring friends!
Macaroon heaven for macaroon lovers. :3
Lovely place for a date with white pizza and lovely decor :)
Good
Too pricey; otherwise, great food.  Love their desserts.  Will go back here again.

I have been impressed by the services of agent Ms. Patel from the Woodland Hills Liberty Mutual office. She has been helpful for both car and home insurance for our family in Palmdale, CA. She fixed several problems that might otherwise have encouraged me to walk away. I will return to her.
Delicious!
address: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

text: Pricey but nice!
it is very good food. Loudy though

great service, pretty good food.

One of my best dessert place in downtown la. Two reason why this is not an everyday place for me is parking and this place can get crowded. My boyfriend likes this place but gets annoyed with parking situation in downtown la.I recommend this place for desserts.

Attractive desserts and pastries.  The wait can be too long, and the noise, way too loud.  The macaroons are the best around.  The flavors and textures are consistent.  Brunch is not too impressive.  But come for dinner, for pasta or pizza.

We went here after a long and busy day and enjoyed a great evening. We didn't have a reservation but it was no problem waiting in the bar area and we didn't have to wait for too long. The restaurant was busy and noisy but the staff were friendly and efficient and the food was very good. If you want somewhere quiet for dinner then this probably isn't the right place.
Food is delicious, but a little pricey!
A tad pricey, but the food is amazing!  This is a great date restaurant.
Nice restaurant, with nice food and good service. Ask for the special pizza.
Love the macarons, especially the vanilla!

Great spot.  I love the high ceilings in the place.  Its a busy place, so it may be a little hard to chat, but if you are looking for a nice value place to eat with good food and a nice environment in downtown LA, this will be it.  I will definitely return.

love it .. Yummmyyyy

Nice place in the heart of downtown L.A.
I love the ambiance and service here. The food was good but a bit pricey. I have noticed it is very popular and good if you want to meet someone.

4 Stars because it's an Oasis in Desert of DLA.... if it was in the heart of WLA or Hollywood it would be a half off 3.5 stars.  Open kitchen is always a sign of good cleanliness which they definitely don't disappoint as everything look clean and tidy.  The no reservation thing is kinda of a pain but totally understand as they're a NYC "bistro" feel.  Food is tasty, drinks are good, wine list has gone a little mainstream.  Definitely be back.

Uber cool Italian restaurant. As a fan of Italian food I'm kind of regular customer in this type of places . I had a classic this time(carbonara) and it was really good. As for service they were very pleasant and we didn't wait too long. Generally place is very vibrant, maybe sometimes overcrowded but very positive. Prices are generally ok

Always a favorite place in LA and dessert place. I love the ambiance, loud music, natural light, dark mood makes me to come back to this place every day. I always wanted to come back to this place for birthday and try portobello fries, mushroom pizza and cocktail and plans to come back here for my girl friends as well.
Love Love Love the Desert in this place.... Wow its to die for.  The food is ok but the Deserts...YUMM!!!
Love the food here!
like the food and the beautiful room, but the sound level is awful

it was oright food

Oh how I wish they took reservations because the wait can be well over an hour when its busy. If you're looking for a nice and quiet night out, this is not the place for you. It's very loud inside but its also fun and exciting in there. The atmosphere is great. The food is pretty good as well. I love the portobello mushroom fries.
I drive here many times a mont to pick up some sweets for my family. I did not know that they also serve full meals. Will deffintely drive more often with everyone to try their full course meals!
Love the vibe, bakery, pizza oven, and tall ceilings. Def worth a trip Downtown.

everything is beautiful in the bakery! bring a camera!

Great place. I come to the bar every once in a while and drink bloody mary's, food is good but often there are too many people here and that makes it a little more difficult for me to enjoy. Macaroons are amazing as well, but pretty much anything from their pastry department is.

It was a bit noisy for my  taste but over all i would come back in a heartbeat! The macaroons are delicious and buy up a bunch of them before I head back to Detroit.
Excellent restaurant, took my wife there for anniversary dinner.
A bit of a wait but really good food and atmosphere. Felt like being in New York. Amazing desserts! Good service.
A little too noisy.
Love love love it there.....Never disappointed
love it, the food seems good
I absolutely live this place so much great food and macaroons!

The ambiance here is outstanding. If you're lucky, maybe you'll see celebrities having lunch. When I was there, I saw the Peter Gallagher there with his agent discussing business. The food is delicious and the deserts are definitely eye candy! I recommend this place
Great atmosphere and food

I don't know about the wait time...but the food and ambiance is grateful. There is nothing like being in the city and feeling robust while eating dinner.  Delicious waiters (good looking too) and kind food.  Oops switch those two around and that applies also. Kind waiters and delicious food!  A must try in you are touring Los Angeles.  It has a hint of New York and the grime of Los Angeles (in a good way).
Loud room // Goodeats.

This is a great place to grab a meal downtown w/o a reservation. And if you do have to wait the desserts are so beautiful to look at. We like to order a few different things to share: a salad, pasta, and a pizza are great for 3 people..
The dessert is amazing and the food is good. The service is OK - but for DTLA pretty typical.

Excellent portabello fries! Great service. when me and my fiance came our pizza was very burnt, they tried to replace it and took it off hte menu price. the chocolate fondue thing cake -- souffle? was just great. its ont eh pricier side, but you know, i yo uare celebrating somethign special. Bottega is the place! I will be planning on taking my fiance here for many more anniversaries (just dont tell her that...)
Love love love!  Their brunch is incredible, and though it's generally very busy we've never had to wait too long to get a table.  Their Bloody Mary is one of the best in LA!

Are you kidding me?  Authentic french cuisine in LA??  YEEESS!!  The taste, the flavors and smell all transport you back to a bistro in Paris!  I had the Macarons and they were heavenly!  Definitely coming back next time I am in LA!!

yum

i love it Their food is so good....especially the smoked salmon quesadillas. I love the staff....everyone is so friendly, and they always bring our food out quickly. I love the vibe inside as well. Cool music. Fun bar for drinks after dinner.  Adrien is my favorite bar tender.
that was very best.
Good food, but kind of overpriced for what it is.  This place if perfect for lunch or just drinks in my opinion.
love the sandwiches
Although the prices are a little high, I enjoy taking clients to this place.  Great location in Downtown LA and the food is not too bad!
8/10 Not bad. Coming back.
3 words. Portobello mushroom fries.

A bright overpriced ray of light in downtown, continuing to point the way towards all cities eventually becoming Manhattan, or at least San Francisco. About one in three entrees and deserts are worth the wait and the cost - and those are REALLY worth it - mouthwatering. The other two thirds are pleasant and very high quality, but nothing you ever need to order again. A great date or expensed lunch spot.

Im on a DTLA review run !!Bottega Louie is amazing. Their pizza's are delicious, The brunch is also very tasty, their pastries are fantastic and they cocktails are mixed very well. I would give it 5 stars but their service lacks a bit. Not very quick, attentive or always the friendliest. And its always SO busy in there. But even though there are a few downsides, if I have the chance to stop by, I will even if its just to pick up a few macaroons.  I think the tall ceilings are awesome, but that makes the place super loud, especially when its packed. Worth checking out if you haven't already.

I thought the interior was. nice, only thing I didnt like is the bar area/open seating should be bigger. Id give it 5 stars but there was just something a tad off, still very cool looking, good food, and worth going if you have never gone... the place is all white with about 20 foot ceilings.
Great food
I LOVE this restaurant in the middle of downtown. Always delivers

The french onion soup is amazing, reminds me the original one.The desserts assortment is huge, we tried the choc, suflle and the cream burle.They inject some kind of chocolate syrup into the suflle its a nice show :) The cream burle is 10 out of 10. For sure will come back when in downtown LA
Great place to grab coffee and catch up with friends
Excellent food!  Would rank higher if they took reservations.
kjkd
Good food, busy busy busy- expect a 30+ minute wait. But the food is delicious and the atmosphere is fun!
Good food. Good atmosphere.  It's gets loud though--if that's a concern at all.
great time, great food, great service. what more can i say.
Macarons and chocolate souffle!

Words may fall short while scribbling my experience here. Ah, brunch at Bottega Louie was simply fanciful, absolute no doubt in any case. Came here with my family last night and whoa - this spot literally pulled all the right chords in swaying all us away, especially my mother (Mom, you still look so blithe). Well, Bottega sports minimalistic designing that speaks elegance and sheer brilliance without a doubt. Loved the natty seating arrangement, especially the wide space (some might find it more like a huge hall though). But yeah, minimal interior is what this one carries, which off course got thumbs up from me.Cuisines were quite delish, bobbed up in a filling portion. We had a lot of options from its Sunday brunch - and let me say 'quite a treat on taste buds'. Macrons and Portobello Fries were too scrumptious, just makes you fork out a bit extra than you'd want to. But still, so damn worth every single penny! Would highly recommend it all!
I love their pizza!

portebello mushroom fries? YES please.everything i ate here was pretty good. from the pizzas to the pastas to the desserts.I actually really like this place because it's so pretty inside. simple and classy. i also like the bathroom. haha!
must order the portobello fries!
heartly burger!
Three words: portabello mushroom fries.
great service!
Glorious food, lively indoor environment, located in downtown L.A. Will come back again. Cheers-
great place, amazing deserts!

Sunday brunch was simply whimsical, absolute no ambiguity there. Bottega Louie rather did the trick in making a hit with us. The restaurant sports minimalistic designing that speaks elegance and sheer brilliance without a doubt. Loved the natty seating arrangement, especially the wide space (some might find it more like a huge hall though). But yeah, minimal interior is what this one carries, which off course got thumbs up from me. Food was pretty flavorsome, bobbed up in a good portion. We had a lot of options from its Sunday brunch - and let me say 'quite a treat on taste buds'. Chocolate soufflé was delicious too, just makes you fork out a bit extra than you'd want to. Nevertheless, Bottega gives you a string of good reasons to visit its chamber again. Loved it for sure, gonna put it in a good word!

This is the place to visit for Lunch but at Dinner, be prepared for the crowds. The service was good and friendly. The decor compliments the surroundings and is pleasant. It is a very lively place and does tend to get to be a bit loud as during peak times. The food is not so much authentic Italian as it an Americanized version of Italian food. That's not to say it doesn't taste good. I'd recommend it!

I used to come here a lot for lunch when I was working in downtown LA. The food here in amazing and I love the atmosphere here. It is a little loud so it can be hard to hear people talk but it is the perfect group location for lunch or just a place to get some amazing pastries.
Love this place! The service was great, the food was well priced, and it was so delicious!
very delicious food- VERY LOUD DINING ROOM!! Everything I've ever eaten there over probably 8 visits has been delicious.
great food and atmosphere

I had recently visited Bottega Louie and I really enjoyed there , the food was good. The quantity was more impressive than the quality. But the high lights were the macarons , perfectly shaped and delicious.I would Highly Recommend.

I believe all of the other ten million reviews have said everything you can about this restaurant. I would like to add to the public opinion that this restaurant is great. The food is delicious, so are the drinks. It is also huge, and when I was there is was full. The atmosphere was friendly and social, every one around us was speaking different languages. I'm glad I have found this restaurant
Food is great, but sometimes the wait is not worth it. Portobello fries are amazing!
i love the food.
i love their food but there is always a long wait!!!!!

Pretty nice place. Try the macarons. Also the pizza.

Love the food here! Great place for groups of friends
Food was awesome. It gets really busy. And the macarons are sooo yummy!
Love their desserts!!!
Food is great and it is ambience. Would love to go back and try it again. Must try to Portobello Fries.

Visually stunning place.  High ceilings, marble, glass, and white all over.  I don't usually start a review of a food joint with aesthetic comments but this place is really something.   Food is overpriced as expected but really fresh and well presented.  I'll be back again just to check out the pastry section.

mmmmhmmm.. an LA version of italian bistro that looks like a slice of SOHO in NY!  Love the ambience, appreciate the diversity of the menu, but I'm  unimpressed by the pretty desserts that all seem to taste the same. BOTTOM LINE: Louie's one of your best bets for freshly prepared, reasonably priced, late night grubz Downtown!

Went for my very first time last April and enjoyed it. We had reservations for early Sunday morning and were seated quickly. Food was yummy and best of all they were able to accommodate a tableful of special requests. Will be back!
Awesome food...even better pastries...love the macaroons.
Great pizza and drinks. A little pricey, but it's well worth it.

Really loud inside, but good food. Open Kitchen is a nice touch.

This was a top-notch dining experience.  Everything from the service, to the décor, to the lovely food was wonderful and elegant.  I can't wait to go back a second time and try more items off their menu.

I almost didn't come here because I had assumed and guessed at first based on the generalzing that this place might be pricey and I was not sure cus money obviously can be a factor sometimes and stuff you know what I mean but then it seemed like the brunch was not that bad when it had come to the price and I was like hmm maybe its not that bad and the price for a brunch was cool and so I tried it out and I am glad I did. I didn't feel like I wasted too much money and the food was good I liked it. all i can say is me and my husband strongly endorse this place....go there and do yourself the favore...

We recently spent a week in Los Angeles and stayed downtown for the first few days. We got the recommendation to try Bottega Louie and we're glad we went.The restaurant has an incredible market with take-home entrees and a great assortment of baked goods and desserts!We had a great waiter which really helped. I originally wanted the Chicken Milanese but they were out. So I went with the Mussels & Clams. The highlight of the evening was definitely the Portobello Fries - highly recommend. The pizzas looked really good - as we saw several pass by. We tried the chops as well - which were incredible including the apple sauce that came with it.Definitely save room for dessert. There is an awesome chocolate souffle - be sure to order in advance. We didn't know so we went with a Peanut Butter Terrine - that was a combination of my favorite things peanut butter & chocolate.Our waiter sent back the a dish because it wasn't done right originally so he sent us home with a mini pound cake with cherries - so good!Definitely recommend a visit.
Coffee is great.  The pizza is my favorite.
great place to go for a quick stop
Good food... Love the macaroons!
Love the food.. sooo delicious. A little loud tho.
Great scones. I'll be back.
Great pasta, festive atmosphere.  Super loud.
Great place...I love coming here.
Love it!
I love everything there!

This place is good, but it's hard to get to. There is a lot of traffic and all the parking g is very expensive. But besides that, the food is very good. I had the shrimp cruel and the pizza with arugula on it. I would recommend both!
Really good Macaroons had the salted carmel and grand crew i believe they called it.

Great lunch! Great service. Great clean city atmosphere. Our waiter Benjamin was the best. :0)  He chose the best macarons....they were absolutely delicious. Ive got such a sweet tooth and macarons definitely satisfies. You cannot leave Bottega Louie without having macarons.
the atmosphere is amazing.
Just great!  Great food, great atmosphere!  Usually a wait but worth it!

From the creative cocktails to the amazing menu, this place hits it out of the park every time. I'm a big fan of the brussels sprouts and pizza!  Loved this place!! We are traveling the US from Australia and stumbled across this Italian eatery in down town LA. The food, service and the sweets were all amazing!! Loved the portobello fries. I wish we had something similar this this eatery back at home!!

Passed by last time I was in the town and as usual it is filling, good taste and has excellent service. There was once my girl didnt really enjoy her plate they tried to do everything to make her feel happy like : another plate, desert and a discout.A+++
Try the chocolate covered pretzels.

This spot gets a solid 4. The decor from the outside to inside is very modern and hip. Frankly it's like out of some manhattan neighborhood and I love New York so that is fine with me. The crowd most often is very yuppie in keeping with the shift of DTLA. And it gets quite loud. The wait is usually 30 minutes for the main section but you can sit in the section near the bakery as self seating.The food is very good, no disappointments here. And the baked goods look as good as they taste or taste as good as they look. It's like little edible artwork.I'd say the prices are reasonable and what you would expect from the place, maybe even a little less expensive than I was expecting. The reason it's not 5 stars is the noise factor. It's like a night club where you have to lean in and yell to the person who is like 1 foot away.
only been there once and got a small dish. wish i ordered more. good food. The wait to be seated was long but as soon as we were seated, the food came pretty fast.
Fun place.  Van get pretty busy.  Decent food and service.

Food is good. Ambiance is also good.  It's just so loud!!  You can literally eat here for under $30 if you get water, pizza, and a salad.  Good way to impress the ladies guys!! Get here early and you can order from their happy hour menu.  Love the cubed ice they serve drinks with.

The perfect place for lunch with girlfriends! We ordered several small plates and shared them!  The beet salad with Burrata was excellent, as was the huge plate of Beignets (served with a raspberry sauce).
I love their breads..always fresh from the oven specially their hot empanada. it's really good. I always take one for home!
