Great Italian restaurant and pastry shop but the only problem is the noise level it's super loud and you can almost go deaf in there. Love the deco and clean environment.

Everything I've ordered here not only tastes yummy but like it wasn't made in a restaurant - like it was made for you in someone's kitchen. Usually when the server says 'everything's good' you know they're full of it - not so here :)Prices are slightly higher then average but the portion sizes are MUCH higher than average and you often get a choice of a side or 2.Don't get me started on the bakery case - they make everything fresh on-site and really tests my willpower when I walk by it - probably not a good thing if like me you are trying to watch your waistline!
Great atmosphere, great food, the prices are pretty high though.
Great date place. I feel fancy here and its not as expensive as it feels.
I love the food here but wish the acoustics were better. You have to scream to hear what your party is saying.
yummy
Good place good service I'm a fan!
good but long wait.
Watching the fellas stretch the dough for the pizzas was a blast! I loved the mushroom fries and all in all this place is very impressive.
Extremely pricey but great atmosphere!

Amazing Atmosphere *The tip of the year for this place is get the portobello mushroom fries. They are something that is very different and most other places do not have Everything else is pretty average. The food is expensive, again you are coming here for the atmosphere and not really the food.
Really good
Delicious food and pastries, but a bit pricey!!!!

Very clean inside. Always crowded, so be prepared for a wait. Reminds me of a New York restaurant.  Must try the the mushroom fries, they are awesome. And gotta get a box of macaroons from the bakery to go!Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because our service was slow and the waiter wasn't the friendliest.

I had a really good bite in this place, just had a bunch of appetizers like the brusheta and the mushroom sticks which were really good. Oh and the sweets here are excellent, they have a big selections of macarrons. Also this place is just infront of my favorite bar 7 grand so is perfect to grab a bite here and then have drinks at 7 grand.
Portobello fries are Awesome!
Pasta and Macaroons, can't go wrong.

Amazing food and Great selection of desserts! Macaroons are my favorites. Of course that they a lot of other selection aside from macaroons for desserts.  Recently we had a party and I ordered sets of 6 macaroons for guests as party favors.  Each of the boxes were boxed beautifully in lavender and with a signature white ribbon.Location wise is close to the Staples Center, so it's definitely a happening location if you want to go to places nearby afterwards.  However on the downside, the popular location is also a reason for the Long Wait.They do Not take any reservations, so if you are not there in the beginning you mostly have to wait an hour especially peak times like Saturday night.
Great food but too load for my liking

So the food here is a little bit on the expensive side. I had breakfast here once with my gf, we had two coffees and shared a chocolate croissant and it came out to $20. That being said the ambiance is amazing, this place probably has the best ambiance in Downtown Los Angeles.The food is pretty average, its typical good Italian food.But they have one thing on their menu that is amazing. And that thing is the Portobello Mushroom Fries, I am not even going to explain what it is, just get it.

This place is off the charts--FUN!  it's filled with energy, colors and excitement. While the decor stark white with gold touches--it's the food and drink that pop with color. it's like a concert of foods....Great bakery--wonderfully decorated pastries--delicious to go salads and sandwiches.If you chose to dine there be prepared to wait for a table in the back--in a rush... take a seat at cafe style by the bar....it's noisy-really loud and great for people watching.Great to take out of town guests......this is a departure from the traditional L.A. experience --it's New York and Italy wrapped in one with a bit of L.A. swag.

Just visited this place with my husband over the weekend. We live in Brentwood and decided to do the commute to downtown LA... Was very impressed by the staff, food, and not to mention the chocolate soufflé!! I gave it four stars because it's a very trendy environment, that's not a bad thing at all... just that my husband and I are close to being the big 5-0! The noise level was a bit high, however the ambiance and food were a delight. The only reason why we tried it is because my daughter keeps talking about it... I can see why she enjoys it! I nice scene to people watch.
The Bignets are off the HOOK!!! I started going to meetings!
Delicious food but a very long wait. I would say amazing, but some dishes were a bit below expectation.
Really great place for a simple italian meal

This is as good as it gets for me. Sunday brunch is amazing. I've tried and recommend the following:Salmon Eggs BenedictLobster HashBelgian WafflesToast with jam (amazing for just $3!!)Portabella mushroom fries (very unique. savory, juicy, and meaty)The cocktails are great. My friend loves ordering a bloody mary every time we go.The pizza is ok. It's not amazing like the other dishes.
fun, but loud
very cool space.  Food is pretty good.

I can only agree with the other reviewers who've posted here.  I'm a huge fan on Bottega Louie. The macaroons are truly to die for and the service is fantastic. Great place for a date. I'll be back for sure.
Love it here! A bit crowded, but the service was great!
I luv their macaron!
Nice Place, Good Food... Little loud.
Like the decor, very open..reminds me of New York.The pizza was very yummy, and all the bakery goods yum!A big selection of sweets ;)
Amazing deserts, service.. meh!

Haven't been here in a while, but it's a great sensory and culinary experience! I prefer breakfast or brunch but the after work vibe is great too.  Cool psuedo Parisian-esque menu and service and a visual joy.  Getting hungry just thinking about it.  Good place for celebrations like Mother's Day or a co-worker's birthday.
Only thing I have to say is, quite big crowd but the food is extraordinary
If you are in the area and don't go in for their protobello fries, you have lost your mind.  I agree the price is a little hefty, but it's worth it.
Good pizza.. Good desserts..

Until last night, I was a virgin . . . .  to Louies . . . tres fabu food BUTvery noisey.  This vintage (bank?) space is cavernous.  The high cielings createa distractng echo.  My friend and I wanted to have a nice dinner and conversation.This is clearly JUST a spot to nosh.  Wonderful menu and selections and food.A good value for the offerrings.

I love the atmosphere here and the food is fantastic!!!!! the macarons are great but I've had better at paulettes in beverly hills and pasadena.  I want to say this place is great for a date because it's so chic inside but this place is LOUDDDDDDDDDD everyones conversation carries in this high ceiling restaurant and you literally have to shout to hear the other person.  Other than that the ambiance and food is great.  Maybe try for a less busy time to get it more quiet.
Got the burrata pizza yesterday. Not my favorite one there but still really good. Killer tomato soup.
Go for the macaroons.
Good Good , I try it again
Great desserts, great food and beautiful ambience. The seating is not that great for groups so I would go there with no more than 4 ppl.
Yes, the buzz is accurate.
Are you looking for some Italian recipes? Then Bottega Louie would be best place. Smoked Salmon Benedict with Hollandaise Sauce was amazing. Love this dish.
Macaroons is my favorite
Good food, good desserts!

YUMMY!!!! Pizza is great and I had the Arugula salad and that was great.. my favorite dessert is the salted carmel macaron.  I also tried the mussels and that was one of my faves.  WIll definitely be back for some more cookies.THe only bad thing is I got the worst waiter this Saturday.  The other waiter have been really good.
Great atmosphere and decor. The food is average and the service it good. The desert area is pretty cool. I had the portebello mushroom fries and thought they were not that good.

went here this wednesday and wish we could had reservations but it was worth the wait.  i loved the way they have small plates because i never eat big.  the mussels is the first this i ordered and then we had pizza yummy.  not crazy about the fried mushroom but i will be back maybe tonight again since the mussels were so good. the only bad thing i have to say is it is noisy noisy and hated to have to yell while having a conversation other than that i will be prepared that when i go there is just for the amazing food.  i have  not yet to try the desserts but today might be the day i try the salted carmel stuff and truffles.
Ohhh the dessert!!!! and that's all I have to say about that!
very good
pretty chill!!

I like the feel of this place;  bringing the outdoors in as the place is spacious and pretty massive; high ceiling and huge floor plan.  Food is great and the desserts to die for.  I also like the mixed crowd of young and old.  Not for business discussion or transaction deals as it is quite noisy and does not make it ideal for serious conversation.    Overall, considering everything, a fun place to be while having a good meal..
Great place to eat!

Best place to get macarons in southern california.Their Salted Caramel macaron is almost as good as Laduree in NY. Perfect texture and sweetness.Besides the macarons....portabello fries are addicting.Also a great place to have a fancy schmancy brunch and play dress up. -heo out
Fun spot. Bad acoustics. Great deserts.
Food was delicious.
Brunch
The macaroons!! 10/10 just for the macaroons!!! Honestly, their breakfast items are overpriced and not that special.

I was here a while ago but I definitely remember some key things:Skirt Steak was great. Mushroom Fries make me salivate like a dog in Pavlov's studies each time I think abou them.Service was awesome. Arugula salad was tangy and delicious and inspired to make tangy and delicious arugula salad at home ever since...although it doesnt actually come out as tangy and delicious as Bottega Louie. Drinks at the bar while waiting for a table is a great way to get your customers to like you better even if you make them wait. Macaroons.
Great ambience!!!
Fun place.
Please bring back the cupcakes with the little macaronette on top!!!!PLEASE..................................

One of the best places to eat and to drink in LA.  Every detail is thought out.  The pasta is really made in house.  Great service.The cafe/store part is cool and my girlfriend looooves it.  Great date place, just wait at bar before your table is ready.
I wasn't that impressed with the portobello fries, but the small plates of scallops, mussels, and duck prosciutto blew my mind. Girlfriend liked the macarons.
the desserts are amazing! only complaint is that it's a little too loud.
I had a Macarrone, the peanut butter terrine and a vanilla latte. Bottega Louie became one of the main reasons I'm moving to L.A.
Great food :)
Portabello fries!!!!
I love the bakery, especially the macaron. The food is just okay.

I only heard about this place through friends and family and the basic themes were this: great ambiance, great food, sort of loud, excellent macaroons. On those notes, Bottega did no disappoint. I had a an order of Portobello Mushroom Fries and shared the Margherita pizza. Both were excellent and something unique that I have not tasted before. Also, the macaroons. Pretty awesome. Service was good. The only knock I would have about this place is that it is kind of loud, so if you wanted to have meaningful conversations with your significant other, it might be tough. All in all, I would definitely come back again.
Food is generally good, and the macarons are great.Just freaking loud. Don't expect this to be a date night area.

They're food is good, the place is nice, kinda of crowded but they play good music and the waiters are nice and convenient.  They have the best appetizer which is the portabella fries.  The only reason why I'm not giving them five stars is because they didn't cut my lettuce, which made my salad really hard to eat.
Great restaurant!  Great food...  Atmosphere a bit too loud; difficult to have a conversation.  Otherwise it was a great experience.
Good food and service. Very loud inside.

I absolutely LOVE this place! The space is fantastic and always buzzing like something in New York City. Be warned though, it's very loud in here but the food is great! I highly recommend the French Onion Soup and Modena Salad! Try not to fill up on the delicious baguette they place on the table because you can easily eat the entire loaf before your food even arrives. The servers are not the most personable and can even be a bit stuffy and rude but I guess that's to be expected in such a fast paced and loud environment. For dessert you must try the Butterscotch Budino. It's worth every calorie!  They also have an amazing pastry case with authentic French style macaroons and other beautiful dessert reminiscent of Laduree in Paris.
the portobello fries are amazing.
Portobello Mushroom Fries!!

Love and hate with this place. I can't stand to wait so long for a simple pizza, but I don't regret it afterwards. Hosts are very arrogant and I would give a 2-Star if it wasn't for the food. Bottom line, the food is good.  Please work on your hospitality!!!

I came to this place for lunch, dinner, and to buy party favors. All times did not disappoint.  We usually wait for half an hour on a weekend.  Bottega Louie has a pastry sandwich section that sells macarons, cakes, pastries..french and italian.  Their packaging for macarons are beautiful.  One time I pre ordered ahead of time for a party and they did not have it ready.  I was also in a rush so i let them know ahead of time. They had to prepare the 20 favors in front of me. To apologize they gave me 2 free macaroon.  This is why I cannot give them a 5.  Other than that, I have not been disappointed.  The quality of their food is Delish!  Pizza, smoked salmon benedict, portobello fries., calamari..list goes on..Parking need metered parking usually.  Came here both times with bigger groups.  It is not meant for an intimate romantic setting.  It is a fun loud setting.  Anywhoo..nothing to complain about their food and baked goods.  Very tasty.
great food! great service!
Great breakfast , great pastries and great service !

It would be 4 1/2 I love this place, Awesome placeawesome food!I hate the wait, but its what happens when its a popular place.Love the maracons.Ugh, now I want a souffee!I suggest the portobello fries, hanger steak, &any dessert there!Not a place for quiet dinner date, but fun for friends!
The Burratta small plate is must! Also order the Portabella fries.

Best portobello fries I've ever had. This place is super crowded all the time but the food is worth the wait. While you wait for your table, the bakery is right there as well so you can order some macaroons to keep you from starving. Nice decor, very modern. Their pizza was good,but I liked the pizza from mozza better. The eggs Benedict was delicious.I hate finding parking in Dtla, but the restaurant is right next to a parking lot or if you want to save a few dollars, park on the street.

The gorgeous high ceilings, huge glass windows, and the adorable bakery are reasons enough to visit Bottega Louie. The atmosphere is definitely a big reason I go here as the food is pretty good, but not the best. I prefer getting brunch here over dinner. The pancakes, french toast, beignet, portobello fries, margherita pizza, and fresh squeezed juices are my top picks. The staff is extremely welcoming and the service is fast.
Had dinner with my bestfriend and her daughter here last Sunday. Setting was very nice. I love the desserts and how the decorated. Took away 1 star because I think it is a little pricey.
I love pizza and chocolate soufflé !!!

Pros: - Great service. Love the decor. - Great food. Ordered the Portobello fries, Bianco Pizza, Tagliatelle Bolognese Pasta, Fettucine Belmondo, Pork Chops, and the Chocolate Souffle for dessert. - Loved the Tagliatelle Bolognese Pasta. Probably my favorite there besides the Pork Chops. - Got some macaronis to go at the dessert bar afterwards. Love that they have unconventional flavors. - I've only been to this restaurant for dinners, but I imagine it'd be a perfect place to have a nice brunch or lunch. Cons: - They don't take reservations and it took us about 45 minutes to get seated. - Parking. Had to park valet after not being able to find any street parking. But I guess that's how it is for most restaurants in DTLA. - Too loud.

A trendy place to try in downtown. Simple and clean. Casual and upscale. Doesn't make sense right? You'll know if you have been there. Love the high ceilings as it made it more glamorous than it was. What seperates this place is their SERVICE. Top notch. Everything was received before asked. Also helps that they have a wonderful dessert section. We got free macarons because our pizza, (which you can get half and half), was a little late. Mussels were good, fresh and cooked just right. GREAT date place.
I've been here many many times. I love the sweets they have but never had a patience to sit for dinner and yell over to my date. Way too loud. Pecan pie is to die for!!!

When I first walked into this restaurant, I wasn't mind blown.  It was more like...  Uhhh...  what kind of place is this??  Let me explain.  When you walk it, you see bakery/cafe area, bar area, kitchen prep area where you can see the chef prepare food, and restaurant area.  As you settle into the environment, you realize it's actually fun.  Now, I sat on a restaurant side and ordered pizza and salad.  Yea, a pizza.  I did it because everybody in the restaurant seemed to have ordered it.  And wow....  I believe it's one of the best pizza I ever tasted.  The dough was crisp and chewy, and thin.  The sauce and cheese was out of this world.  When you go to this place, order a pizza, and you won't be disappointed.  As for the water option, they give you option of sparkling water and just regular water.  Anyways...  Service was superb!!  Waiters were very friendly.  Oh...  The noise level was...  VERY LOUD!!!  Oh, on the side note, bathroom was nice too.

One of the better restaurants in LA. Very chic for the area it's located in. Love the sweet bar. Cupcakes are delicious and very well presented. Macroons are a little more dense than what I would have liked. that may be due to the region of Europe where the owner or baker is from - they tasted like my grandmothers who was from French Belguim. Interesting flavors for the Macaroons. I still prefer Lette in Beverly Hills, but some were yummy and they were all very colorful and nicely presented.Presentation for Bottega Louie is at it's best. The food comes very well set and the desserts you buy come in cute little boxes. FOOD FAVS: Portobello Fries, Eggs Benedict, Shrimp Scampi, Flatbread BreakfastPARKING: Parking is behind the restaurant in a lot for $7. Paying that much for parking does not thrill me, especially when it's for the restaurant your eating in. The valet doesnt park your car- he directs you where to go. Plus, also be aware - walking from the lot to the front door of the restaurant (which is not far), you will be approached by at least 1 homeless person asking for money and they will sometimes follow you to the door. Although not a far walk, I wish it was more secure with security outside at least watching. Lord knows if your mugged the valet aint coming to your rescue

All time favorite of ours for pasta and pizza! Top choice for us is the clams linguini. No corkage fee we love. Beware, the atmosphere is loud so don't expect a quiet romantic dinner for two. Better to enjoy it with a group of friends. Expect to wait at least an hour. No reservations. But it's ok, just hang out at the bar and grab your appetizers there with your drinks. On the way out, don't forget to take home a box of macaroons!
Chicken parm! moscato wine.......beautiful ambience and desserts galore! need i say more?
Love this place! Their Macaroons are amazing.
Macarons!
Best macaroons in LA!!
Great desserts.  Front room nice place for coffee and snack.  Bread rolls are great.
The food was delicious and the service was excellent!

Wow, this place is GORGEOUS!!! Came here on a Thursday after working in DTLA and the wait wasn't as long as I thought it would be.  A few of us came mainly for drinks, but we also ordered the following:Japanese Sour: We had a round of this~ Portobello Fries: OMG.. this was amazing! It's a MUST ORDER ITEM, here!Burrata Pizza: This pizza was great since we all shared.  I've had better, but this was living up to it's standards.We also picked up some dessert on our way out!  Their macarons are quite expensive for $2 a pop, but I got a box full of them~ I've had better macarons at 'Lette's, but these are pretty decent for the area.

Its a good place for decent food. Was a little disappointed with the Portobello fries, but everything else was very good. The line is always long and they don't take reservations. I like to watch the people in the kitchen preparing the food. I will always come back.
Great food and atmosphere. Definitely go back.

Bottega Louie was overall was fantastic but a few things held me back from giving it 5 stars. To start, we had the portabello fries with aoili dipping sauce, this was amazing and different than anything I have had before. We then had a salad which was good but the cheese in it was still frozen, rendering some of them inedible.  Then, the pizza was a great although I think Pizza Mozza is better. Our waitress then pretended  to comp us macarons, even though others received macarons with their check, to make up for the frozen cheese in the salad.  Macarons are not something I would usually choose to eat-  I  am not a huge fan. She also said she gave us flavors that would sell out (which was not the case- there were hundreds there).  We did have the chocolate souffle, this is my desert of choice, which was delicious although a bit pricey.  Overall, it was a great it, could have done without the lying and the frozen cheese- she probably should have comped the salad.

It was very good food, but super loud and packed, i went back, this being my second time and wad more impressed the first time,most likely because it was slow. but none the less service was excellent and the food to. I could also do with out the people who go there to eat because they think its expensive, its cheap and affordable for most middle class people. the bill was barley over 120 dollars.
Great Place, great pizza, good pasta!
Lobster Hash!  Lobster Hash!! Lobster Hash!!
GREAT food and desserts in downtown LA! This place is great and has a great environment :)

This is a fun place.  The food is consistent {not too pricey} with a good weekend brunch.  It is visually appealing...clean, open, white w/gold colorway {mixed with the confections' pink packaging}, high ceilings, a bit french not over-the-top.  I like the salmon benedict as well as the burrata and prosciutto pizza.  The raspberry beignet was fresh and flavorful.  And don't forget the linguine vongole.  Ingredients are fresh.  The staff is always friendly.  This is a great place to take out-of-town guests.  It is downtown LA's must-go-to restaurant.

I really like this restaurant. The food is delicious, the open kitchen continuesto keep all the cook staff motivated to perform and put out great, interesting and well prepared food. Service overall has been good. My only gripes are that the staff always seems to have an aire of being too rushed, and that the high ceilings make it so loud at times you have to turn up your volume! Love either sitting at the bar or the dining room. The pretty people watching is at a premium here. Come early or be prepared for a bit of a wait for a seat. Definitely worth the wait.
Great classic Italian that my husband and I both love.  We order take-out constantly form these "GUYS" and love the smell in the car on the way home.  Everything tastes as good as it smells.

Seated quickly, greeted well and the clam pie is AWESOME ! it is noisy but, if your having fun you are part of that noise. Its aplace to go if you are upbeat, and not upset about the level of noise.. a little swanky. Water glass was never empty. They do push appetizers so be assetive and say no.. otherwise A+ pS check out the desserts on the way out! Ymmy-- powdered donuts were delicious!

Bottega Louie. Since joining Yelp last year, I've heard so many great things about it. With 3000 reviews, there really isn't need for another, but I have to admit that after finally going here last week for dinner that it really is a great meal for the price. My friend and me shared a modena salad and a burrata pizza. The salad was marvelous. I loved the lettuce, nuts, and goat cheese with a perfect balsamic vinaigrette. For the pizza, I have to say it was good. Maybe not amazing. Just good. And good is good.The atmosphere is nice. The crowd was relaxed. Being downtown (except parking) is always fun these days. Bottega Louie. I'm a fan.

Bottega louie is located in downtown los angeles and is a pretty famous and well-known restaurant. Before I arrived, I thought the restaurant would be small and crowded (like most downtown restaurants) but I was pleasantly surprised to see that the restaurant was very spacious with high, white ceilings. When you first enter the restaurant, you will see a case of goodies that will automatically make your mouth drool. we came for their brunch on a weekend so the wait was about 40 minutes so we decided to indulge ourselves in their macaroons while we waited for our table (efficiency at its best!). We tried a variety of macaroons: pistachio, espresso, earl grey, salted caramel, vanilla, lemon, and raspberry - all were very delicious and baked perfectly (I know how difficult this is!!) and my favorite were the pistachio, salted caramel, and vanilla. For brunch, I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes which was served with house made blueberry syrup. It was very moist, soft, and delicious. My friend ordered the eggs benedict which was good however the portion was small. We sat next to the pizza oven so we had entertainment throughout our meal and got to watch the cooks toss pizza dough high into the area while we enjoyed our brunch. In fact, all the servers were all friendly and nice.

Loved this place! Coming from Seattle it reminded me of this organic breakfast/brunch shop we have called Portage Bay only it was a couple notches up. I really enjoyed their fresh fruit juices that they offer until 3pm along with the sophisticated breakfast options.I went with the Salmon Benedict (how can you not?) and my date went with the French Toast. For an appetizer we indulged in the Portabello fries. I didn't realize that the fries themselves were actually mushrooms... I just thought they were relished in them. Wasn't too much of a fan for that reason.Don't make too many foodie assumptions when ordering. I was expecting an english muffin w/ my benedict and it was made out of hash browns instead (I am not a fan of shredded potatoes for the most part). Guess I should have read the fine print eh?My girl enjoyed the french toast but had sudden impulses to go with the waffles instead although she enjoyed herself regardless.Overall I loved the bustle of the venue. The restaurant was cleanly, classy, and had a great vibe. The food was good and I definitely want to come back for more. I know it seems like I have a lot of gripes but I'm actually pretty optimistic about the place other than the slight surprises. Our waiter was awesome as well!After lunch I couldn't help but purchase some of their fabulous macroons. Unbeknownst unto me I would spend over $20 on those bad mamma jammas.I didn't expect to spend as much as I did but overall it hit me for around $120. I suppose it would be less if you exchanged the cocktails for coffee and the macaroons for something a little healthier :)Next on my hit list: Bottega Louie sausage pizza
love

Great food at a decent price. It's always busy so dont expect to have on overly intimate dinner. But I think it's the perfect place to stop and grab a nice meal and feel like you are in a refined city.

Took my eight-year-old son out to an evening snack here to celebrate some school achievements, and they really made our nite out an exceptional one. Warm, engaging hostess and waiter, and even the bus staff was incredibly friendly. The atmosphere was lively but not too loud. Enjoyed the best sausage pizza I've had in years---fantastic crust with lots of character, crispy outside, chewy inside. Superb, fresh toppings and the homemade sausage was excellent. A nice caesar and sangiovese for dad rounded out the meal. Dessert was a rich chocolate soufflé with creme anglaise, which was full of dark cocoa-y goodness. Minds were blown. Looking forward to a full evening here sometime soon!
The food is is deliciously awesome. Bottega Louie just gave the right service that we want. I love everything here. From Mojito, Chicken Carcioffi to their amazing Macarons, it's just perfect.

Just a little trendy, and sometimes very loud, but the food is good and the servers very nice.  Absolutely loved the pizza, but they have lots of menu choices, all kinds of pasta, and so far everything I've tried has been good.

Based on the reviews I read here. I went to this restaurant hoping to get the same feeling like some reviewers here and I am not disappointed. The Food is great tasting. It is a money's worth. Love their pizza, fries and desserts. Simply the best. The pricey and yet good.
Desserts were amazing.  Took my wife here for lunch.  Looks a bit stuffy but really down to earth people.  Great experience overall.

An island of sanity (with bar) in downtown LA.Can't get-over how great and on top of it the service is here.  No really, the service is as good as the much talked about food.Pizza made to order with ingredients that would make Padma proud. Freaking delicious touched (croutons on the salads).  I don't know how you make fresh ground pepper taste so good-  but they have managed that as well.   And if you are fortunate enough to visit while they have the chocolate souffle on the menu with creme anglais-  order it!You sit fishbowl style as the up and coming as well the downtrodden pass by.The restaurant reminds me of something transplanted from Tribecca, oddly happy with its new town and friends.

I just love sitting here in this airy and light space.   The people are beautiful, the space is beautiful and the food... oh dear god!  It reminds me of a low-key Kate Mantelini without any of the Bev Hills industry riff-raff.  But the food.... the drinks... ! How can I manage to keep my composure while I write?!?  I think that the pastas are the strong point here (Trenne) as well as some beautifully measured salads and small plates.  Things change with the season, so I am glad it is autumn again so I can get the roasted squash soup. Technicolor maroons make starting a night, or coming off of one a pleasure!  They are a perfect party gift!  Weird and bright  The often cited s'mores bon bons.... I didn't want to believe, but it is true!  They are yum!This place is great for breakfast, great for lunch and great for dinner/ late night.  You can be "dressed" or look like you rolled out of your loft and you'll fit right in. For those of you with no time to sit-  call that order in and have your friend pick-it up while you circle the block.
i like the meddeteranain food there.

I thought I had better write this review before I forget all of the wonderful things that I like about this place. The crowd is diverse and the place appeals to everyone from tourists, to families, to couples, to businessmen/women, to gatherings with friends (the latter was why I came here).  It's cute and clean and the impressive array of desserts that you see upon arrival really sets the tone for what you are about to experience. The  we tried as much as we could get our little hands on. Here are my favorites: (i) The smoked salmon benedict on potato pancakes. Probably the best I've ever had! Genius really and not as heavy as the traditional eggs benedict with ham and english muffin. Price for most of the entrees were under $20. I thought prices were very reasonable with one caveat -- the $2 box that you pay for the macarons, which are already $1.75 each! Okay, I gave in and paid it because it was just too cute to resist and who knows when I will have the opportunity to come back. The service was very good. The wait and bus staff were all very friendly and unassuming. I like that.

I went here with my godsister the other day and loved the feel of the place. It was a very clean and open space, decorated all white with dark furnishings, giving it a grandeur type look. I shared the Orecchiette pasta and split the pizza between pepperoni and mushroom. The pasta was okay, but the pizza was BOMB. I think it was the mozzarella cheese that definitely made the difference, eating other pizza with the usual cheese may not be something I want to go back to after eating the one from here. After lunch, we went over to the colorful bakery section that featured so many beautiful desserts and macarons in a variety of colors. Since this place is known for their macarons, I got only three because they are a bit expensive for some little things (1 for $1.75!); I tried the Rose, Vanilla, and Salted Caramel which were all good! I need to go back and get me more for sure. Overall I love the ambiance of the place, the only downside is that it's pretty loud in there, so you need to speak a lot louder for whoever you're with to hear you.
2nd time around was a much better experience.

I love this italian restuarant. Love their pizza and the deserts they serve. The food is great, to reiterate and the service is great. As for the price? Reasonable. The entire staff at the dining area are friendly and helpful.The eclair is a must try. Enjoy your dine here.

Nestled within the vibrant city of Downtown Los Angeles, lies this place  called Bottega Louie. Known for its traditional Italian confections and desserts, not many people know that it is also a quality Italian Restaurant.When I first walked in, I thought I stepped into an air craft hangar since the place had a really high ceiling and it was really loud. I feel as if I had to shout so that my fellow food critic friend could hear me over the other people. I'm glad I am Asian because my voice pitch is pompous anyways. xD We waited a good 10~15 minutes to be seated since we came on a Friday night. My friend ordered the Penne Gamber while I went with the Clam Linguini. I must admit when the food came, I wanted to dig in right away. BUT before that, we took out our trusty cameras for YELP review proof. A glass of Pinot Grigio (white wine) with our food made our meal enjoyable and sort of romantic, wouldn't you agree? General tab here is about $20 per person excluding drinks for dinner.Service: Attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. I would definitely come back here if I am in the area again. Best to come here for dinner for two or for a party of 4.
The pizzas here are baked in the oven and brought right to your table, so it's warm, fresh, and has that delightful crispy crust.  The service is great.
Great Place
It's loud in there, but always packed.  Pizza is excellent, and other dishes are from decent to amazing - all depends on what you get.  Can quickly become expensive, so beware if you are on a budget.

This place is awesome! I love their pizza, I am definitely hooked! My  friends recommended this place and it wasn't disappointing. The food are all tasty. I especially love the pepperoni pizza. Delicioso!Aside from pizza, they also offer a wide array of desserts. Which was to die for. Forgot to mention that I like the Salmon benedicts, portabello, scallops and many more. I like the ambiance of the place, not so formal where children can play and act their age without peoples complaining about it. The place is clean and the attendants were nice.Had a great time in Bottega Louie!

I was visiting LA for a friends wedding and a good friend of mine took me here. The space reminded me of back home in NY except that the ceilings were so high. It ain't that high in NY! The food was good. Had the eggplant fries, the bruschetta, lasagna, and shared some margherita pizza. It's not authentic italian food, but a nice place to chill, get a drink, and just hang out and eat. I'd want to come back here the next time i'm out in LA.

I didn't come here for the desert although I wished I had tried some, but when you're doing nothing but eating while visiting LA, sometimes a break from copious amounts of calories need to be portioned. And so I ordered a salad.It had chopped lettuce, garbanzo beans, tomatoes, black olives, pepperoncini, provolone, pepperoni, onions, cucumbers & red wine vinaigrette. It was a little too salty, a little heavy on the dressing, and the pepperonis were ineptly cut in my opinion but it was pretty darn fresh. My sis ordered the Modena which had butter lettuce, candied walnuts, crumbled goat cheese, shallots, fresh herbs & creamy balsamic vinaigrette. This was the better choice of the two and the goat cheese just did wonders for this plate. I was pleasantly surprised at the right proportions of salad given to us - not too much, not too little.I'll have to come back and try their pastries and other dishes to appreciate the fullness BL has to offer but for now I think a 4 star rating is suitable to the apt service.

For the price I paid, I expected a little better. Yea, the food is great, but price needs to be cheaper. Portion was small too! But my friends and I had a great time with such soothing ambiance. I would definitely try this place again if I'm nearby.
Best Pizza. gets crowed it.

I went there on a Saturday night, for some tea. I found the place inviting for either a drink or a full dinner.Being from New York, I felt at home. The only draw back is the noise,which made me constantly lean forward to hear my husband.

this place is totally fun.  i love the music, i loved people watching, the food was good, its totally a place to see and be seen.the only downside is the noise....but i think that's kinda what some people likei liked it too4 stars!
Marguerite pizza was great
pretty damn good!
Nice decor, great food...deserts to die for!!!!!!!
Good but pricey

Went for the second time this past weekend and it was slightly disappointing than my first trip. I think that the wait staff mostly contributed to that feeling. I felt like they disappeared for long stretches when you needed something. The food at dinner was good but not amazing. Just like most of the other reviews, the mushroom fries are a must, along with the pizzas, and desserts. There is definitely a wait unless you go early. The bar can be tight if you are a few people, and the noise level is going to be loud. Don't expect a quieter tone to eat. All in all, it is a really cool environment and place to eat.

They say it is nice to go out when you are alone, so you can meet people. I would say, it is best going to a party when it is spent with friends. Here, my friends just had a blast. The drinks were outstanding. The food is high standard. The crowd? Oh well, don't even start... Those things are better left unsaid for you to discover on your own.

If you are the type of person who is not used to holding back, then, go to a place where you can bare all. Bare your desire of food or drinks. Or just bare your appreciation or disgust. Put away disgust because this place won't disappoint you. It will in fact give you all the reason to enumerate things that you love about food. Watching the people eat in other tables assured me that, yes, I bared it all. I didn't restrain myself from ordering more just like everyone did.

Burrata and Clam Pizza, Meatball Sliders, Lobster Manicotti, and Portobello Fries were all delicious, but a little salty. Still great though.The overall atmosphere is fantastic. Expansive, minimal, and gorgeous. It's definitely a nice place and has a very casual and loud vibe. Typical LA style.The macarons are adorable and I bought a gift box for my Mom. She loved them

Great food and bread is marvelous.  I tried the pizza and I really liked it.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere.  Great place for a lunch date.  Not very private and yes very loud.  The staff was very friendly.  I didn't try the desserts but I will on my next visit and post a comment.
Good place to eat. The pizzas are great. The only bad thing is that it is really loud inside.

I adore this place! The interior is absolutely lovely with the high ceiling and cute decorations. I've been here several times and I've tried different dishes each time. The food is mostly simple and fresh Italian cuisine, but I think the two things that have me revisiting are the Portobello Fries and the Macarons. The fries aren't super oily and heavy even though they're deep-fried, and I like the dipping sauce they come with. The macarons are just a nice treat to bring home after your meal. Though they're a little pricey, I definitely think they're worth it. They come wrapped in cute little boxes. :) I'd recommend coming early in the day if you want the best selection of macarons. By the evening, they only have the nasty and rejected flavors left (like banana.. ew).

Kaitlyn (sp?)She was an excellent server. I arrived early for a business meeting (which I KILLED!), and she accommodated me with a smoked porter and a burrata, pesto, and roasted tomato tapas plate. On the menu they're not called tapas plates, but that's what they are. this was simple, clean, and delicious. That's overall how I rate this place. 4 stars for a gem of a server, and simple, clean delicious food. My client had the Mache salad, I had the Torpedo (on a side note, I"m on a quest to find the best Italian sub in LA and so far this one rates only behind Mario's in Glendale). Both were substantial and delicious. Next time I'll try a Pizza that it seemed EVERYONE was getting. Cheers to the Management and Kaitlyn. I hope that was her name, because she was a doll. -JH

Pro's- good bread, good pizza, close to many bars and near Staples center.  tasty pastries and cookies.  good service.  oh and PORTOBELLO FRIES!Con's- really really loud.  Advice- go for breakfast/lunch.  nice bright space and high ceilings make it an ideal spot for 1st meal of the day.  Bring hungover friends!  mimosas available
omg the macaroons are to DIE for!  i love having their Sunday brunch nearby! yummmmy!!
Butterscotch Budino!! "nuff said
The best cupcakes ever! Place is a bit loud for my taste. Food and service very good.

this place is def fun! they offer anything you want!  you can grab a drink and sit at the bar, you can grab breakfast and a coffee, lunch, or dinner!the food is good and the service is excellent.  great people watching too.  the only downside is its a little loud.great for socializing not great for an intimate dinner with a date

We first learned about Bottega Louie's by watching Huell Howser on KCET. We have now been there 3 times in the past 6 months and each time this wonderful place delivers Great Food and a wonderful experience. We do not have issues about going Downtown at any time of day or night and we enjoy the free street parking after 7pm during the week. On our most recent visit we availed ourselves of the Valet as it was raining......money well spent!The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. The food arrives quickly compared to other comparable spots and the quality is extraordinary. From the amazing Portobello fries to the pizzas and the fresh veggies....Bottega Louie's has something for everyone.We have not yet been to brunch, but are planning to this year. Happy New Year to all...and do yourselves a favor and check this place out...you will not regret it at all.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!Although it is a little pricey, this place always hits the spot!

The Portabello Fries are to die for! We also got a pizza (can't remember the name), and it was also delicious. I felt bad for ordering so little between my girlfriend and I, so I got some dessert. and it was awesome! Mina was a great help at the dessert station, and picked out the best macaroons for us!Thank you!

I admit I am a lover of a great aesthetic.So I was waiting with great anticipation for this gorgeous restaurant to open. What was it going to be ?A beautiful marble wonderland with a slight architectural nod to the Romans ? Hmm... interesting.Ventured in here for a fun Friday night, sexy date in tow. A word to the wise, if you are not a lover of the loud, lively, what I consider fun eating establishment, this is not the place for you. The place was packed but we were seated quickly and graciously.I am a lover of almost all things bruscetta and Bottega's was good, not the best Ive ever had by far. VERY fresh ingredients which of course are great, but really didnt have enough garlic or flavor for me.Fried mozzarella was presented beautifully, as were all the apps. Seriously who knew an appetizer known to grace the microwaves and sports bars of America could look so pretty? Again, it was good, but maybe not exactly something to write home about.The basil, margarita pizza was delicious however. Warm, and fresh, bursting with flavor. Definitely worth a try and my fave thing of the night.Service was in my opinion close to impeccable even with the heavy traffic flow of the night. These servers obviously understand the importance of giving patrons an experience and not just a meal. ( extra star addded for the great service).Again, this is really not the place for a warm, cozy date. The acoustics dont lend themselves to that kind of atmosphere.

Something about that giant sign in book scares me away each time and hearing the dreaded wait time. i've walked out twice unwilling to wait, but i still feel drawn to this place! I think it's those darn colorful macarons that call my name each time. Well, i'm not real up for eating neon colored macarons, but the pink one enticed me at $1.75. They even fooled me into buying four as a gift for 8 bucks! Atleast it came in a pretty box. I saved my macaron to eat work the next day and i have to say that it wasn't the perfect snack i was so looking forward to. It had a strong raspberry flavor within the chocolate filling, but it was all too sweet. TOO SWEET for me? yep! my friends enjoyed the lemon one. i've definitely had better macarons in my taste, for less $ and bigger size. 3 stars for their macarons.i upped one star for insurance.I still gotta cross their portabello fries off my list...
Sexy and Chic

Went to BL for my birthday and had a marvelous time and a marvelous meal! Be sure and try the pizza and roasted chicken.The street can be a tad dodgy, but it's places like Bottega Louie that are helping turn downtown around!
Love the place. Good pizzas and appetizers. Totally recommend. No prior reservation can be frustrating but the food is worth waiting.
One of my fav restaurants in downtown LA. Pizzas, portobello fries, salad, pasta, and burgers... you name it, they all taste amazing! 4 stars because it gets really loud at night.

Food is awesome! Worth the wait...if you can get a seat in the bar.Makes me feel like I'm in NY.... love that! BUT, because of the sheer size and acoustics of the space, it does get loud! Prices are pretty reasonable, and as a result It's always packed, plus they do not take reservations - bummer!

This place has some really good food. I come here at least once every 2 months, and each time it doesn't disappoint. There's usually a line (esp for brunch), but the wait is well worth it.The setup is nice, very casual yet a very chic at the same time. The high ceiling, marble floors and white on white decor is something else, some people may think its plain, but I think its very elegant.We ordered the penne, the lasgana, the club and the torpedo sandwhich. The pastas were great. and you can't go wrong with a club sanwhich. The torpedo was a bit bland, it tasted like something you could get from subway, but hey, it was my fault for ordering something so ordinary.There's plenty of parking in dtla, and if you need to, you can pay in the lot. I've come back many times, sometimes just for their desserts, their macarons are ridiculously good!Recommendation: Lasagna, Pizza & Macarons

The food was delicious, although not your regular American size (a little small portions). The place was very cool, light, simple, yet inviting. The wine collection was pretty impressive. I had a sparkling white wine, which was more like champaigne, very sweet-just what I wanted :)O, also, one thing I noticed, was the loud noise of people which I guess was caused by the lack of the walls and the high ceiling.

ok so , im not a much of a yelper and im not much of a foodie, but after my second visit to this place i decided, maybe its something i should write about.so i came to bottega louie on a sunday night with my friend hannah. it was her birthday and she really wanted to eat there after hearing great things from coworkers. i had tried to talk her out of it because i had been in once before and just remember having to wait. for everything. but she really wanted to eat there and since she was the birthday girl i couldnt say no. so i resolved myself to a night of a 40min wait to flag down a waiterwhen we get there, hannah immediately goes crazy for the pastries, it is quite a beautiful display case, not to mention the workers in the funny little hats. i walk over to the host desk and give my name for our party of two and the host this really tall guy, very sweetly replies that it would be about 20 -30 min. yay.......we killed time people watching and the like had a drink at the bar. f.y.i the best margarita ive ever had.EVER!shortly after seating, our server came over, i dont remember her name but i do remember she had feathers in her hair, she walked right up smiled and addressed me by name even knew that it was hannahs birthday. scary but wonderful stuff.and the rest of the right was all downhill from there. i could tell that it was must have been busy whenever our  server wasnt at our table she was moving like lightening. but she still had time to talk to us about the menu, make recommendations the scampi,  buratta, trenne, all her suggestions all awesome! when she was at our table we felt like we were her only guests. even finishing the night with our dessert sporting a candle and hannahs name with happy birthday. needless to say perfect nitebut once again the only thing i could complain about was the noise, it is so hard to have a conversation in that place wouldve given it a 5 outta 5 but the ringing hasnt stopped so i held back. needless to say bottega thanks for a great night, i will be back but this time with ear muffs
I liked this restaurant. They have really creative dishes. Most fun.

Loved the space. It was simple elegance and a touch of sweet-tooth heaven.small dishes, try the heirloom tomatoes, if you love mushrooms like i do.. the portobello fries and if you like spicy.. the broccollinimust get the macaroons with the cute boxand must try the chocolate souffle.. a taste of moist chocolatey deliciousnessand bring your own wine if you have a fav..no corkage
I loved thier pizza. I like pizza in general so this place is a keeper.
This review is based only on the one time I visited this place. The food Was good and the pastries were exceptional. The wait was kind of long thou and parking could be trouble.
I went here last week. They had great soup and I loved thier chicken.
Great vibe, nice decor, attractive staff.  WIth that, who care's about the food, ha haa!  It is good though :)
We're a regular.There's something for everyone.Macarons: Rip off!

Finaly I went to Bottega after all the hype.  My take on it is that it is a nice place with soothing white walls with a lot of character.  The food was good and pizza is amaizing.  I did not like that the seating was close to each other and sence of privacy was non existant.   Prices a little high considering everything is al a cart.

Been here twice already- once for lunch on a weekday, and once for dinner. Nice venue. Very, VERY large and white. Gets REAAALLLYY loud after awhile... But kind of adds to the experience. When we came here for lunch, it was mostly businessmen in power suits and frou frou ladies with high hair and a higher nose. It was very crowded, but there wasn't a wait.My friend I ordered the Bianco pizza, the shrimp gamberi(?) pasta, portabello fries, and calamari (yes yes, quite a big spread for just the 2 of us, but we wanted to try EVERYTHING). Now I love arugula on pizza so the bianco was great! Very garlicky and cheesy. Just hoped they had crispier crusts... The pasta was good. Basically shrimp scampi. Portions look kind of small, but with all the other food to try, I did't mind. The portabello fries were very good. Not what I had expected tho. Thought it'd be more seasoned and crispier, like real fries... Hahahaha. Calamari was just your standard fried rings and tentacles. I really liked the free bread they give out. I judge a lot of these restaurants on the quality of their bread because honestly, if I know you're not skimping out on the free stuff, I know my paid stuff's gonna be pretty darn good.The service was good but it DOES take awhile to flag someone down at times.My dinner experience was almost the same. But instead of the shrimp pasta, I got the trenne, which was kind of odd... They were like french fries. But it was still good. Got beers tho and their beers are pretty pricey. $6 for the domestic cheap beers...For dinner on weekends however, you have to go after 5 to order from the full menu, otherwise, you can only order from the limited salad and pizza menu...
This is the best pizza I have had in LA.

This place is hard to miss. It reminds of a modern bistro I see in NY. Its exterior is nice as well as the interior. I like the transparent kitchen and the moldings. The walls are also white and pristine. I ordered mMargherita pizza. It was great and I love the crust.  It was crunchy and thin. I had also coconut macaroons. Portobello fries is also to dine for.What I don't really like is that the place is usually crowded during peak hours. The pizza also needed to be reheated though it was good. However, I'll still be back and will try their other dishes.
Had a lovely meal with great service at a reasonable price.

Bottega Louie has been extremely popular since it opened up almost a year ago, being called a 'Best New Resstaurant' in LA by numerous publications. I had been once when they first opened and thought it pretty good, though the service was poor. It was time to re-visit, for a Friday lunch.We were told by the server that the portobello fries are one of the most popular items on the menu, so we had to give them a try.Although I really don't like mushrooms too much, these were pretty good. The portobello was battered, fried, and tossed with herbs and parmesan cheese.Next up, we had the sausage pizza. The pizza was wonderful, and pretty authentic Neapolitan. It had a light, thin crust, a tangy and sweet tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and a delicious fennel sausage. The only thing I didn't like was that it was a little wet towards the middle of the pizza. Potentially the best pizza I had all week, and I had Mozza this week.Mussels and claims in a white wine broth was next. A very generous portion here, with some nice crusty bread to sop up the broth. The seafood was very fresh, and the broth was delicious as well.Then we had a 10-layered Lasagna with a lamb and veal bolognese. I like a lot of noodle in my lasagna, so when I heard "10 layers," I was totally on it. However, this dish was just okay. There was probably just too much noodle, and not enough meat and cheese for me . Another generous portion.Although we were quite full, we weren't leaving without the souffle. It's a chocolate souffle, made-to-order, with a side of creme anglaise. To me, there aren't made dessert combinations better than chocolate-vanilla, and hot-cold. This is a really good souffle.I had a very pleasant experience at Bottega Louie, and could easily see why it's so popular. The first time I came, the service was rather mediocre. However, that was when they first opened, and they've really streamlined the process. While I think some of the dishes can be hit-or-miss, as there's just so many options on the menu, there are probably more 'hits' than 'misses.' I'd definitely just come back for the pizza.

Bottega Louie: Downtown dining at its finest, without the Fine Dining price tag. When first stepping through Bottega Louie's gilded, glass doors, you might be forgiven for mistaking the place for Willy Wonka's factory - if Wonka had the design aesthetic of a Park Avenue princess. Rows of multicolored confections greet you from shining glass cases as soon as you enter; from red and purple macaroons to petite vanilla and red velvet cupcakes presented in golden holders, your mouth will already be watering, your eyes trying to take in the marbled splendor of the surroundings.Restaurant, bar and gourmet market blend seamlessly together thanks to the open-plan layout, lending the establishment a frenetic energy and - less appealingly - a sometimes deafening soundtrack. The kitchen is also on display through a glass partition, allowing guests to witness the culinary acrobatics and catch a whiff of the tantalizing scents that combine to create their meal. Wait times during peak hours can be nightmarish, with very little space at the bar available, but patrons looking for a late lunch or early dinner can usually find the place calm and quiet - perfect for a business meeting. If you're fortunate enough to snag a table, there are a number of tempting lunch and dinner options; a personal favorite is the Filet Mignon Arrabbiata, the steak seared to tender perfection in a juicy tomato sauce. Louie's pizzas are also a treat; loaded with toppings and undoubtedly filling enough for even the most insatiable appetite. If, however, the crowds seem too daunting for a lengthy stay, many of the restaurant's best dishes are available in the gourmet market section; from fresh Kobe sliders prepared right in front of you to a host of takeaway salad and pasta options, you're certain to find something to satisfy. And don't forget to grab one of those red velvet cupcakes on the way out.

Great atmosphere and huge space for a restaurant..Can get loud but truly a fun place to have great food and drinks...Pizza was on point as was there salads...Highly recommend this place if you are in Downtown LA.

Most people have done a good job reviewing the food here, so I'll skip that. Quite simply, they make a stiff drink! And that's why I keep coming back. The bartenders know what they're doing, and their house drinks are creative, tasty, and pack a punch. The food, decor, and overall vibe are just icing on the cake. It will lose a star though because it gets crazy packed here on weekends. Be prepared for a bit of a wait on certain nights.
Great place to have lunch. Beautiful atmosphere, though it gets loud.I would go back again.

the service was impeccable, theplace is stunning high ceilings everythings in white and gold, fabulous ,the food was soooo goood and the best part is they dont do reservations first come first serve , I like it...

Portabello Fries, Portabello Fries, and Portabello Fries.... Four stars for the best fries in downtown!  I can definitely eat them everyday. Bottega Louie is one of the best I've ever seen. Pretty nice place and really nice employees. My girlfriend and I just love it! And their prices are reasonable.

Portobello fries = heaven.Don't need to say more than that, really.(Well, except a couple other things.  The lemon pancakes at brunch are unbelievable.  And the service:  WOW!  If you wait 2 minutes for anything, they almost freak out as if you have waited an hour.  Good stuff.)

Please Please Please find a way to deaden the deafening roar of this restaurant.I love it, but leave with a headache and sore throat after the noise and having to scream at the table for my friends to hear me.Though the stark decor is nice, you really need something on these big ugly plain white walls.  How about a mirror so when facing the blank white wall I can look out to the room?  Or a huge tapestry to absorb sound?
Coming soon.

Here goes my first review on yelp. :)Living close to 7th and Grand in downtown LA, I have driven by this restaurant numerous times. Finally, during my lunch break from work, my boyfriend and i decided to check this place out. I couldn't sit and dine in because i was already running late. the Restaurant is divided into two section: the restaurant and a section where you take-out pre-made food. they have a variety of selection from lasagnas to chicken breasts, they also have sides like potato salads..... i think it was the prime rib sliders but they are $2 and delicious. also, their mini fruit tarts are the best tarts i've ever put in my mouth. it was incredibly scrumptious and i enjoyed every single bite. a month later, my gf and i decided to stop by bottega louie for some desserts and we ended up feasting.We shared the:1) the server recommended the ravioli for starters (House made pasta stuffed with spinach and ricotta in a light cream sauce with pancetta, sage & peas), i've had my share of good ravioli and it was okay. it was extremely light but i don't think i'll ever order it again.  2) portobello fries comes with aioli. it starts off delicious but ends up being really oily. 3)  the branzino (Imported sautéed boneless Italian sea bass,micro herbs & scarpa sauce) for our main dish. the presentation was nice. it was bland and a little fishy. i've had better branzino.overall, i love the vibe of the restaurant. it's so spacious and the high-ceiling gives it more of a majestic feel. the gold trimming outside of the building and the large wall windows allows you to people watch and enjoy the sun. Finally we have a cool, hip restaurant in LA. :) BTW, the service is spectacular!

I had been waiting for the perfect time to write my first Yelp......and like someone in a love affair I have thought AND talked about Bottega Louie all day since eating there last night.The service was welcoming, prompt, friendly, genuine...etc. etc. we thorougly enjoyed interacting with the staff!!  our water glasses were always refilled, timing was precise, and we were re-marked with silverware to the T.  Small plates and affordable, yet versatile, menu choices made it easy to share. The food was light and delicious, but my friend and I (the amazing elite yelper below me!!) decided that the apple torte dessert was the best part. The only drawback were the rosemary potatoes which were a little on the dry side.Complemented with a sophisticated sleekness and New York lofty feel, the ambience is A1. (how i met your mother fans ;) Everything from the walls to the bathroom is a pristine white.However, I will warn yelpers, the restaurant space is definitely an "all eyes on you" place, so be careful not to trip when making a bathroom trip. Bottega Louie stands out with a unique vibe, excellent food, and waitstaff so good looking I was about to ask if THEY were on the dessert menu.

Went to this place for lunch the other day and had some GREAT tasting pizza. They made it fresh right there and threw it there brick oven right in front of me. The beaufitul decor is a plus and its a great place to eat at when you're in the downtown area.

Bottega Louie is one of my go to spots I love this place every time I visit. Their dessert display when you first enter is gorgeous. Parking is available around the area, either on the street or in a parking structure. There was no wait time for 2 people around 12:45pm on a Friday. This time we got a portobello fries, a margarita pizza and a pasta. Plenty for lunch and for left overs.Wheelchair accessibility: No stairs to get inside the restaurant. Plenty of room for wheelchairs and tables.
Good spot, service is good, food is great. Pizza is awesome. The wait time is never more than 20 minutes. I always get a table very fast without any problems.
Great atmosphere, great food and drinks.  Cant miss the dessert bar, its beautiful and delicious!
My son and I come here and have a meal. He's 5. We love the ambiance and the desserts.
First time here and I was pleased by the ambiance. The service was great and the food was amazing.

The restaurant is clean and well decorated. The service was very good, servers were very attentive. They were also prompt with drinks refilling, etc. The food was also great! I had the Chocolate Souffle. I would definitely put this place on my list of places to eat for brunch in LA.

I had a great meal at Bottega Louie the other day. I had the Smoked Salmon Benedict, and it was delicious. The salmon perfectly smoked and tender, and the eggs perfectly poached. The potatoes were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I could have eaten an entire plate of those alone!The service was also top-notch. My waiter was friendly and attentive, making sure that all of my needs were met throughout the meal. The atmosphere was relaxing.  The trenne pasta with poached egg is also great. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice brunch spot in Los Angeles!
I think the ambience of botegga can't be beat! I love the vibe here! the food is also the best!
address: Upper East Side, New York, NY

text: The desserts here are stunning and they taste even better than they look. I always come in when I am out this way!!

He had other tables but never failed to make sure we didn't need anything. My girlfriend and ordered a few apps and a pizza and it was just perfect. Will definitely be coming back since it's such a great place for catching up with a friend.

Feels like you're in Milan, Italy. Marble everywhere. Amazing pastries and a huuuuuge selection of macarons.
place is awesome in every aspect you could imagine highly recommended
Just beautiful inside with gorgeous flowers and the food is great!

So glad we didnt lose the dtla location after the shutdown. Definitely a great place to bring out of town guests for a decadent experience. You feel like you walked into the Maria Antoinette movie (Sopia Coppola) upon arrival. Literally order anything as it will be good. Even the random chocolate and oatmeal cookies at the counter are amazing. In my opinion best desserts in LA. also service is very attentive and friendly. the employees seem happy to be there which hopefully means they are treated well.
I met with friends there which I did not see for quite some time. food was great and our server was amazing, she was super natural and funny and made pretty much our afternoon!

Overall, a relaxed and good lunch. I would expect to wait for around 30 minutes to be seated because it is reasonably priced and, depending on the day and hour, may get extremely busy...But as a pastry fun, we had all the pastries, and while they are all excellent, the caramel one is really outstanding. The lobster hash was maybe the best meal I've ever had.

Being half Italian I feel I can spot a great Italian meal right when I taste it so after stopping in for Valentines dinner tonight I can say that this is delicious food and nothing like so many of the non authentic Italian restaurant chains all around the US. They have a great selection of desserts and many will be stopping in for those, but the restaurant service is the real best part. They don't take reservations, nor can you put your name on a waitlist digitally like they say they can do on their VM, but still we only waited 25 minutes tonight and it was worth it.I had to get an Italian Soda to drink with my meal because they have been something that I have loved since childhood but rarely see anymore, so if you're in the mood for something sweet I would highly recommend ordering one.  For the food we ordered the Carpaccio to start and it was very good and for $18 it was a fair price.  For our entrees we got the Carbonara (which was my favorite) and the Burrata pizza.  I can say the pizza is the best that I've had in DTLA, Pizzanista is my other favorite, I was pleasantly surprised how good it was.It had crisped garlic on top and they went above by cooking the spinach before adding it to the pizza which is the authentic way and sadly many other places don't focus on the smaller details as well.Overall a casual and delicious meal. It's priced fairly and can get very busy depending on the day and time so I would be prepared to wait around a half an hour to be seated. I will be back again soon.
A little pricy for what you get, but i guess it's all about the ambience. We ordered the pizza. Nothing really special, but givin them a 5 star because the staff was excellent

My friends' favorite place to eat, and mine too. When you try the chocolate souffle, it's like the world is yours. When I come here, I try only that, I have to say, the prices are very affordable and that's why they have a lot of customers, and the waiters and waitresses are very friendly. are kind and good
Great food and beautiful atmosphere. Nice time was had by all. I will be returning. Staff was great.
Took my mother here for Mother's Day couple years ago lol but finally download yelp and just wanted to say great place
Love this place but the one in dtla the best

We went for weekend brunch. Highly recommend the margherita pizza. Avoid the Belgium waffles. Hard and dry. They did warn us it was hard. Carbonara was yummy. Belini was the best I've ever had. The smoked salmon hash was also tasty.
Great food and fabulous beignets/macaroons. A bit on the pricey side but very high quality and well worth it. Their pizza is some of the best I've ever tasted.
amazing interior, amazing food, amazing service !!!!!  felt  like we were in europe !!!!
Cool vibe, they have lots of food options, and the service was friendly and attentive!

This is my go-to about three to four times a week since I moved into a loft directly upstairs. Not only is the space beautiful, but the food is uniformly delicious, prepared and served with perfection.Half the time, I sit at the bar to grab a solo dinner. This is where Sonia, Sarah, Stephen, and Gavin take very good care of me. My fave solo meals are the Cacio e Pepe or the meatballs with a side of brussels sprouts or the burger, one of the best in LA.I also have frequent business lunches or dinners here. On those occasions, I always ask for Mariana's station, because she's the best--super friendly, fun and attentive. For these meals, I suggest the Calabrese pizza, the trenne pasta (crunchy pasta with short rib sauce), the carbonara pasta. And if you want a salad, the Louie is awesome!Oh, and the bakery is insane if you like beignets and chocolate chip cookies. I'm a lucky man to live above this excellent eatery.

Bottega Louie is an experience! The ambience and environment make very guest welcome. It has gorgeous floor to ceiling windows. It is very welcoming. The food is amazing especially the pizza since it is cooked in a wood oven.

I always would always come to Bottega Louie Pre Covid. I have to say it's one of the most nicest restaurants someone can walk into. Bottega never lets me down with their food or their service. Food is amazing and their brick oven pizzas is one of the best on the menu. You can see the open kitchen where the chefs prepare your food. Very fancy place to come with a friend group or family. Hands down they have the best deserts compared to other restaurants. Their macaroons are designed so nicely with a fancy box to go with it. The atmosphere is loud but i'm fine with that. They also have two sides to the restaurant. The cafe is towards the door and the restaurant seating is more towards the back. Their high ceiling almost makes you feel like your in a castle ahh. I love their organization skills and how they work everything out real quick. Most fantastic Italian restaurant out there!
We had a great meal with great wine. Our server Frankie was exceptional. Atmosphere is great.
Delicious food! Great service! Lively atmosphere.

text: This is where I want to be every time I need to take my breakfast. My friend and I walk around downtown in LA and found this nice place. I order a french toast and eggs Benedict. I think it's made with knead & co pasta which was a welcome discovery. I also like the building too.

text: One of the best patisseries in LA, and their portobello fries are insane. Just be prepared for a long ass wait if you want a sit down meal.

Great place to impress your out-of-town guests. Having moved to LA 3 years ago, I like to bring my smalltown girlfriends here to enjoy a day of bougie ness and what-we-see-on-TV LA-esque vibe. It's impressive to see everything they have and serve,
Still great.  Ate there last night.  Has a steak and a pizza and both were top notch.
beautiful place and yummy food!
I went with my daughter, for a mommy and daughter date. We had a great day.. food was delicious too.

This is my first time in downtown Los Angeles and i heard about this place thousand times so I decided to stop by!! it surprised me a lot!! The food and the dessert taste beyond good!! the best chocolate souffle I've ever had!! highly recommended!

First of all, I am thankful that we were able to stop by Bottega Louie. This is the wonderful place I've ever been. I love the place and the ambiance. Valet parking is very convenient. First of with the desserts. Macaroons are the BEST. Salted caramel is my favorite. It makes me feel light and happy. Next is the Raspberry Cheesecake, a PERFECT cake for me. Lastly is the Portobello fries. OMG, I LOVED IT!!!! I've never though that I was eating mushrooms. What an AMAZING treat. This is absolutely the best stop we had. I definitely enjoyed the food and the service Hopefully, we come back soon. Highly recommended.Many thanks,- Marjorie

I bought bunch of banana cream pies that melted while I was waiting for my son in drug court, they still tasted great.  My son is guilty of Sexual assault and bottega Louie is guilty of great banana cream pies!
Bottega Louie is the one of a kind place you dream of. Amazing memories. Wonderful place! HUGE. Fantastic! Wonderful!
they have great customer service, the food was amazing!!
They have the best macaroons in town. The earl grey and salted caramel macaroons are the bomb.

One of the loveliest places in DTLA. Bottega Louie is one of my favorite places in the area as well as my friends. This place just screams lovely!The pastries and cakes are a definite must but the menu is just as delicious. I am a big fan of their Mache salad as it is l
Always great! I have yet to eat something I don't like from this place
