Por esta razón la comunidad internacional del Grupo Salomónicos; con el fin de alejar de tu vida la maldad, la brujería, las envidias, los salamientos, el desamor o la falta de suerte; Esta establecido para ayudar, en el bienestar y calidad de vida. No pierdas tu tiempo buscando, hechiceros, santeros, mentalistas, clarividentes, hierbateros, o brujos! ¡Que sin duda alguna, nunca sabrán cual es tu problema real, o peor aun no saben ni siquiera de que están hablando. I brought some friends here yesterday and we all became fans. The restaurant looks very good and the service is just amazing. My chicken milanese was above average but my red velvet cupcake was amazing. All my friends seemed to like what they ordered. I was taken aback at 1st because I got used to the fact that when I ordered something, starch usually comes with it like mashed or roasted potato, etc; so when we got our food, we all looked at each other wondering where the sides were since all we got was only our chicken. I guess I should have read the menu closer because it said nothing that the entrees came with anything. I'm giving them 5 stars because the service more than made up for my above average chicken. I didn't try anything from the bar but my friend did and he said he said their white russian is on point and he's the type of guy that would throw his drink back to the bartender if it wasn't good enough.

Wow! I cannot even begin to explain how absolutely amazing this restaurant is. I visited here for the first time about 3 weeks ago. When I walked in, I had no idea I was about to walk into my new favorite restaurant! Everything about this place; the decor, the food, the service, and the atmosphere was fantastic! I was here with my boyfriend on a saturday night and we ended up having a great time. We've eaten at many restraurants, we eat out a lot, and usually our standards are high. We walked in and obviously had to wait about 45 minutes, just a heads up, even though I am sure others have mentioned the long waits. But I have to say, it was totally worth it. We were seated by a sweet hostess and greeted almost immediately by our server, Tony, who was very helpful with recommendations from the menu. We ordered a couple of appetizers which included their burrata and roasted vine tomatoes, arugala salad, and their incredible tomato soup. Next, we ordered a pizza (when you get there you'll see it's a must!) and the sea bass. Both were wonderful plates with amazing flavors. And of course, for dessert, we HAD to order the souffle. It is by far the best souffle I have ever had in my life. On top of all of that food, we couldn't resist and had to take a few macaroons home along with their raspberry beignets. They just melt in your mouth. Needless to say, I am coming back for sure!!!

We had been to the Bistro de la Gare and it was okay.  We decided to try it again, and to our pleasant surprise it is under a new ownership, Chef Bruno Morin.  What a difference!  We were seated promptly when we walked in, an immediate difference from the old owners.  The Server was friendly, knew the menu, and again prompt.  She asked what type of water we wanted and when we said just plain, she brought it in a lovely bottle with mint in it, so we could refill it ourselves.  I know you might not think it was a big deal, but it just showed the care they take with their customers.  I had Mussels-to die for!  They were so delicious they have spoiled it for other restaurants.  My husband had Beef Bourguignon which thought was very tasty.  We started with a Kir Royal, made to perfection.  The Bistro de la Gare is quaint, has lots of windows, and seating outside.  Please give it a try. Chef Bruno Morin is a very friendly man, who visits his guests and makes them feel welcome.  It is in South Pasadena, right near a stop on the gold line, which is a very short block away.

LOVE bottega louie! Not because it is the trendy posh place to be but because of the quality and the service.  Bloody Mary's and Mimosas were flowing for our Saturday Brunch...Portabella Fries...read about them and had no idea they were actually Portabella Mushroom fried! I thought they would be french fries in mushroom flavor? Amazing.  We ordered salmon eggs benedict and lots of sides of bacon.  Also...ordered macaroons for the table and still had to order more later for takeout at the bakery!  $340 brunch for 3 people but amazing experience.  Server was friendly and he got $100 of that amount!Forgot to check in when we went the first time. Was in la and craving th is place. Went with 2 friends.  One ordered the steak and eggs $25, one the salmon benedict (you can't go wrong ) and i had the lobster hash with eggs.  Server said 2nd best seller.  Of course we started with portabello fries...r he green creme fraiche they give is awesome.  Again, 5 star service, amazing quality food and just overall the best brunch spot in DTLA.  Mimosas and bloody Mary's flowed again.  We got there at 11 and there was no wait...we left at 1 and there was a long line. Go early!

The ambiance may be pompous at first impression, but the setting is perfect, the ceiling is high, and I can "rest" forever in their impressive restrooms.  Although we've had dinner & lunch here a couple of times on separate occasions, we specially love our Monday morning breakfast at our favorite tiny table in that same corner near the bar.  The service is attentive, cheerful and friendly.  The croissants are like "pillows of heaven", the ham & cheese croissant is something to look forward to having every morning.  My coffee fix is satisfied with the aroma alone of their Guatemalan coffee alone and get my refills to my hearts delight.   The turkey bacon tasted like the real thing and one order (3 slices) makes me a happy camper and transforms  me to a morning person which  I am not. The raspberry beignets are a soft sugary delight.   And the calamari - oh the calamari, enough said.  Mondays thru Fridays,  you are restricted to the breakfast menu, but weekend brunches one could order the Portobello mushrooms and their great thin crust pizza that I have customized with prosciuttos.   The place can get crazy some morning and definitely during lunch and dinner, but hey, who cares, I'm enjoying my food so sublime, the crowd can make all the noise they want.  Our favorite server, Eric of course and helping on the side is Cesar.  They treat us like VIPs or at least that's how they made us feel.  Wonderful people.  Great ambiance.  Delectable food.  Perfect recipe for success!  Bottega Louie, my favorite restaurant in downtown LA!  Don't forget your photo-op with the French macaroons in the background.  It is part of the ritual!

I have lived at The Plaza for 2 years and I can say that I have enjoyed it for its location, the fact that Dallas Amsden is a hands-on manager, keeping the place safe and clean.I would recommend The Plaza to all who wish to rent.Sylvia

I've eaten here 3 times in the past year, probably 7 times in the past three, and every single time they knocked it out of the park!!!The most recent experience was a week ago, for dinner.  Started out with a great cocktail at the bar (it was a variation of an Old Fashioned, but I'd still take their Manhattan any day) then went to a table.  We had a slightly larger party, some of whom were more casual diners (not the pretentious foodies me and my partner have become), and the server did a FANTASTIC job both letting us flaunt our own knowledge and also providing some direction of his own.  He was one of the most well balanced servers I've had in Los Angeles when it comes to both being present and also staying out of the way.Of course the food was all fantastic.  Everyone knows the Porcini Fries are a must; I also recommend starting with a pizza.  My absolute favorite of the night was the Duck Prosciutto Bruschetta, but it is so rich I thankfully had people to share it with or else I may have died from the luxury of it!  My friends enjoyed their pastas very much, and we made a meal of small & medium plates to share.We actually did NOT try my favorite dessert this time (Butterscotch Budino; one of my top 5 in LA along with Westside Tavern's Toffee Cake; Red Medicine's Coconut Bavarois; Milk's Oreo Cookies; & a soft spot in my heart for El Coyote's Fried Ice Cream) but we did an assortment of very good macaroons and tiramisu.  Not the GREATEST, but satisfying and a nice cap to a large meal.All told with no alcohol on the main check our bill was right around $300 for 6 people, and I feel like we were all BEYOND satisfied!  Can't wait to go back for a special date night though & drop that amount on just us =)
Yummmmy foood.  Love coming back to enjoy great company and service.  Highly recommend for new fanstic food ppl to come check this place out.

Bottega Louie is by far my FAVORITE PLACE downtown Los Angeles! Entering the space, I walked through the bakery, take-out portion of the huge space. Immediately I felt the weight of the spectacular downtown lofty ceilings. I was accosted by the wafting smells of pizza set against the classic, yet modern incarnation of the brick pizza ovens (in this case white brick). This is the kind of place you would like to call yourself a regular for brunch with the sunday times. Dinner was good, certain dishes verged on great and the experience was excellent for the price.First the musts- the portabello fries. If you order one thing, make sure you don't miss out on these scrumptious, well seasoned, though still healthy (c'mon let me pretend, they are mushrooms after all!) small plate. The regular old potato fries were excellent as well, coated with perfect dusting of salt and crunch. The pizza, eggplant parm, branzino and beet salad where also quite good.The chicken hero and calamari small plate were below average.We enjoyed the assortment of macarons for dessert- my favorites are espresso and chocolate caramel, but all were good depending on your preference.All in all good, service, nice atmosphere, appropriate but not overwhelming number of downtown hipsters and good food with a few occasional misses. KS

While I haven't given up on my mission to try each pizza that Bottega Louie offers (as of right now I'm 3 for 8) I've also added on the very important mission to try each and every macaron they offer...After having dinner at Perch with a girlfriend, we decided to stop by Bottega and have some macarons. Of course I was aware of the hype about macarons, attributing it as the next big "it" dessert following the popularity of cupcakes. Everyone I knew was ranting and raving about it and posting pictures of these round colorful discs all over Facebook.  I quickly dismissed them as an average sweet treat linking them to icky store-bought creme filled rectangular wafers. How ignorant I was (smh). When you enter Bottega, their bakery section entices you with all sorts of yummy looking desserts and pastries, but the macaron display will definitely catch your attention with its organized rows of colorful discs begging for you to look, touch, and finally taste. My friend, who has had Bottega's macarons before (and loves them), easily ordered 8. Me, aka the newbie, only ordered 3:1) Salted Caramel: my absolute favorite of the 3 2) Earl Grey: very subtle flavor of tea3) Pistachio: couldn't really taste any flavor, but that could be attributed to the mere fact that I practically inhaled the other 2 macarons with no time to give my palette a break.   The crisp yet moist texture of the outer shells along with the subtle flavor of the creamy filling was enough to make me wonder what the hell I was thinking in associating this lovely dessert with those icky store-bought, creme filled rectangular wafers I'm just glad that I've now been schooled in what a macaron is, so much so that I'm jumping on the bandwagon and ranting and raving all about them :)

Love it here ! Always come here when I'm around the area. Their macaroons are the best. Pricey, but worth it

My wife and I went for brunch.. We waited a bit to be seated, but it wasn't so bad ... they were very busy, but still very pleasant when they greeted and sat us.  Our server was really friendly and helpful too.The menu has a great variety of unique and traditional items.  I got the smoked salmon napoleon thing and my wife got the arugula salad.  Both were excellent.  We saw so many good things, and wished we could have tried more.We also got a pizza.  It was OK, I'd recommend trying their other stuff.  Not that the pizza was bad, but it wasn't special.We are definitely going back.Be ready for a wait (its worth it) and it will be a little loud (but not obnoxious)
Have to give this place 5 stars. It's a wonderful spot, always busy, they do everything right. You can't say much else. Good drinks, good food, great desserts. Check it out.
Pizza is delicious and you cannot leave without trying the desserts!!

This restaurant makes you feel like your in Paris. The building and decor are gorgeous. We had pizza and salad and it was yummy. If your downtown los Angeles. I would definitely go and eat at this place. The drinks are also very good!!!Our waiter was very cool.

Went here for lunch with a girlfriend and it is amazing!  All the reviews have been correct...the Portabella fries are delicious.  We also split the Bianco Pizza.  The atmosphere was great especially at lunch time.  I highly recommend this place....I am going to try brunch this Sunday!
Great pizza and lasagna...service is great, ambiance is great

what can i say about this place???  they had a really long line, took me an hour to get seated but it was worth it, i loved it the food is great, the service was awesome and lets not forget the dessert... we started off with some fried calamari, portobello fries and the panzanella salad... Everything was good but The calamari was my favorite part... my husband and me decided to try the lasagna and share it since we were kind of full, oh god was i in heaven.. It was very cheesy, juicy just great... and at the end we had the cheese cake, oh boy was i satisfied :) I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE... By the way our server Jason was very attentive all the time and very funny

Loved everything I tasted! Went during lunch time and the place looked beautiful. Started off with complimentary sparkling water then had the portobello mushroom fries, which was unexpectedly great. Pizza was wonderful and the macaroons were the cherry on top! The macaroons were a bit pricey at $2 each, but well worth it. Looking forward to returning here soon :)
Thank you yelp for guiding me to the best breakfast, and dinner spot ever! I can't even talk about this spot, it's fucking delicious!!!!just go in, smell and order!
My favorite restaurant! Try EVERYTHING on their menu!!! The end! :)
Amazing pizzas.  Amazing baked goods.  Highly recommended when you are in Downtown LA.
I went to Bottega Louie exclusively because I heard of their macarons' chefs being trained at Pierre Herme's in Paris.They were delicious. I really enjoyed the pistachio and the hazelnut.
Beautiful restaurant, top of the line service... amazing food. I would for sure recommend it to anyone.

I love this place. I have been here many times. Every time I've ordered something different and NEVER have a I been disappointed. Once i ordred the chicken soup with tortelina i think... that was not to good but everything else is INCREDIBLE!!!
WOW!!! amazin!!!!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in LA! Love the food, the atmosphere and interior aesthetic! Plus the macarons and portobello fries are delish! They don't accept reservations, so I try to arrive before peak time. Nice place for brunch as well; and if you have out-of-town visitors, you definitely need to take them to this restaurant!

i average this place once a week at the very least. If there were room for 6 stars this would be the first place that I would review. Service: pretty sure there are 3 servers for every table in this joint. I have never seen so many waiters/bartenders/workers at the same time in one restaurant. There will be a wait if you come during prime time eating hours, but towards the end of the night (kitchen closes at 11pm) its a breeze getting a table at the bar and/or restaurant.  Food: pizza is to die for (mushroom is a must try). carmel salted cupcakes actually make me want to eat a cupcake - and I am not a cupcake eater, I'll take a man's cake thanks. pasta is ok, bottega salad is so good as well as blue cheese wedge. Drinks: the El Droado drink is awesome. it's not on the menu anymore but just start talking about a el derado, el drada, el drink with tequila and they will know what you are referring to. Then again, I love my tequila...Must eat restaurant in dtla - must. eat.
The Macaron's are delicious!

The first time I came here was when it just opened and it was just crazy, but my experiences have always gotten better and better.  Yes, there were the occasional mishaps but the management and servers have always been more than accommodating to make sure your overall dining experience was a pleasant one.  Occasionally I'll come here for dinner, but I love coming here for brunch!  I always get the eggs benedict and always devour it.  The bellinis and bloody mary is delicious and I usually don't like bloody marys.  The portobello mushrooms are AMAZING and I still order that every time I go.  It is extremely busy but oftentimes the hostess will just squeeze you in!  Oh, by the way, you MUST get the macarons from here.  Seriously, you must!  I think my favorite is the rose but try every single flavor!
great place for a "city" feel for a date of quick lunch. Don't forget that you can sit near the bar and get full service... you dont have to wait for a table!!

I love this place it is supper good and of course it is a bite pricey. It is always busy even at 10 PM night time it takes about 45 minutes to get seated the food is great and I love the fact that they have open kitchen that you can see all the chefs that are working on you food orderthey are supper clean and they try to show off how much they are confident on that the pastry is supper cool and lovely at lunch time is busy, it is better to take the bar seats

This is one fantastic restaurant. This is on my top three list for Los Angeles. The food is great and the location is very young/hip. You don't feel like your in downtown Los Angeles, but somewhere in Europe. This is a great place for about four people max. Don't try to bring the whole crew.

First, a big thank-you to our waiter Bill for his excellent service and perfect recommendations.  My pork chop was the most moist and tender I've ever eaten.  My friend loved her lasagna.  As many have mentioned, the Portobello fries are unique and delicious, and the chocolate soufflé is well worth the wait.  Will definitely return.

This place is so great it inspired me to stop just looking at yelp and actually post to yelp! The food? Great. The service? Great. The deserts? Great. The drinks? Great. Sure Great is a Great work but let me elaborate...Food: yum. the pizzas are huge and baked right as you order them the old fashion way - in a wood fire stove. The salad is beyond amazing (louie salad and blue cheese wedge salad are, for a lack of a better word, Great!)Drinks: I'm a tequila girl and that tequila drink of theirs is oh so Great! You can even order bottles of wine from their to-go section for a not to-go meal. Service: Our waiter danced for us. no joke. Have you ever had a waiter dance for you at any other restaurant? yea, didn't think so!As for parking and the wait I not going to call them cons, just giving a couple tips. Park in the open lot next door, it's like $5. Come prepared to wait and put you name on the list then go next door to mas malo and have a margarita and come back. They will never kick you out of line even if you miss your name being called because you were too busy drinks margs next door!THIS PLACE IS GREAT!
Favorite place for Brunch
Macaroons! Finally got 'em. Awesome!!!
Love it.....
Love it
Lasagna is to die for...French macarons are a must
I love this place, delicious dessert, I love Macaron!
This is by far one of my favorite restaurants.  Great food, affordable and great service.Had the pizza which was delicious and the Creme Brulee that was out of this world!

This place is one of the better restaurants I have visited in Downtown. It's a really bustling atmosphere, and you can't help but get excited about the food. The ambiance is fantastic.The food is fantastic too! We ordered a few of their large appetizers, which was surprisingly filling and delicious. You can tell the chefs take pride in how they prepare the food and in presentation. I'm definitely coming back here in the future.
Tasty. Chic. and a million things on the menu.   Love it.
Love this place. Great food, great ambiance and great service.

ah-may-zing. be prepared for a wait (at practically all times of every day) but once you get a table its your cue to order absolutely everything. The atmosphere is loud but fun and I have never seen more waiters at any other restaurant in LA - I swear there are at most 2 table to every waiter / bartender / manager running around and this place is pretty huge. 1. Order the portobello fries - you shouldn't even be allowed to come back if you don't order these your first time around. 2. Finish off your meal with a salted carmel cupcake - again if you fail to order this I don't even think you should be allowed to yelp about this place. Must try this cupcake because its the god send of all cupcakes. Good for boozy brunch, lunch, dinner, late night, cocktails, small bites, everything except dancing pretty much. I challenge someone (anyone!) to find a better restaurant in downtown LA then Louie's...

Class all the way! Pizza, salads,portabello french fries, porkchops, cocktails, and top notch desserts ! Supierior coffee and out of site customer service! Ambiance in spades...this is the place! Treat your friends,spoil someone special...be good to yourself...Bottega is a choice you won't regret.
Get the mussels. Yum.

I LOVE this place!  I had a family mini reunion brunch and everyone loved it.  The place is beautiful and the food was as always awesome.  My favorite is the smoke salmon benedict and the burrata pizza.  The only negatives are they don't take reservations and will not seat you until the whole party is present and it gets a bit noisy.  I still give it a 5 star because the food and service is spectacular!
Awesome!!! Best part of my LA trip. Kids loved it ,We loved it.
very good place for breakfast!
fun place when downtown!!

Portobello fries = amazing (but very rich, so share!), kobe burger is excellent, pizza is good (the crust makes it).  Try the asparagus with fried egg and the burrata.  I live in the 'hood and haven't explored other places because Louie is just THAT GOOD.  I can not believe how tender and juicy the pork chops are - don't need so much of the potato latkes and other stuff.  Recently tried brunch and the eggs benedict is great.  Went with a friend who had the salmon benedict and she said it was the best she has had and has ordered the dish all over the world.  HIGHLY recommended.  Great that the kitchen is in the middle of things and you can see how fresh things are.  A little noisy, but that adds to the NY feel of the joint.

this is one of my favorite place in downtown la. I work in the area and there are some good places in the last few years that popped up, but this one is top notch! great food great people great atmosphere. I feel like I am in nyc everytime I come here!
Mandarin Macaroons!!!
I would eat here once a week if I lived downtown.
Three words: Meyer. Lemon. Macarons.  That is all.

I came here on a blind date and was amazed with all the delicious food. The wait was a bit long for a Thursday night but the food was well worth it. If you go here, you must try the portabello fries. They are awesome. The lasagna was my dish of choice and I was not disappointed. The interior was a very clean modern look. Loved the atmosphere and all the great looking waiters and waitresses. Perfect for any date.

Love the place - came in today with couple of my coworkers for lunch, there was no wait, we were seated instantly. The food was delicious and not too pricey - was surprised. Will come back again for sure.
This place was amazing. good food good people and good atmosphier.we had a great time. it was busy but big and full of life.we will defenetly go back there again.
Love this place! Pizza is amazing.

Great place for food, dessert and drinks. There are two parts in the restaurant, one where you can just sit yourselves and another where you have to wait for a table. Tasty appetizers, drinks, overall a great experience in a very, very noisy location.
My friends and I came here for dinner - I found it to be so charming!  The food and beverages were lovely and I can't wait to come back for lunch .... or to try their desserts!

Our friends took us here for the first time and I gotta say it was worth the wait. Everything we ordered tasted really good especially the fried mushrooms, wow so good. This place is really hip and dumb people dont seem to go there, so if your looking to have a good time, check it out.
Good
Great place to go with your significant other. Amazing vibe along with amazing food!
Loved this place the food the staff was all wonderful! Kind of loud inside but it was bearable. Enjoyed the ambiance very much as well, this place is a must try!
macarons!!!! enough said!!!!!

This is our favorite restaurant!  The decor is great, at first glance, I thought it was a Louis Vuitton store by just looking at the sign "Louie" on the building.  Staff is great and they definitely want you to have the best experience.  The food, specially the portobelo fries (yum), is great and reasonably priced.  One of the many times, we've been there, it was extra busy and the food took ridiculously long.  At the end of the meal, the manager apologized and discounted our bill and gave us free desert.
Love it!  The atmosphere is very open and clean feeling.  Great service.  The waiter remembered our names the entire time.  I enjoyed my visit.
love this place
I had lunch and I enjoyed the food and atmosphere.  The service was great.  The waiter was great and very funny.  I love the open and very clean feeling and look of the restaurant.

Love this place,My man and I stopped by for a late lunch on Monday of President's day weekend, and the wait was only 10 minutes. We parked on the street (free after 3pm), half a block away.Decor: I really liked the open space, especially the open kitchen, and the place's modern and minimalistic decor. The dessert  setup was absolutely gorgeous. I could not stop drooling when I was deciding which flavor macaron I was gonna try first. (5 stars)Ambience: The only thing I didn't like was the noise level..it was quite loud. I think this would be a good place to take a first date, because it's nice but not super fancy. The loudness would definitely help out with the expected awkward moments. (4 stars)Service: We loved our server! He was pleasant, friendly, and helpful. He came back often to refill our waters, and would even crack some jokes.  (4.5 stars)Food: Yummy! We shared everything. We got a pizza, half sausage for the bf, and half clams for me (4 stars). For the pasta, we chose the Parpadelle (mushroom and foie gras)..it was simple, delicious, but could have used a bit more seasoning (4 stars). Of course, we had to try the portobello fries (4 stars +1 star for the dip)! It was light and crispy, and that aioli was divine. We had more than half a pizza leftover, but of course we had to try the macarons ($1.75/ea)! Earl Grey for me, and Espresso for him..both were good, but mine was way better. Pricey, but it melts in your mouth..and is so good it'll make you wanna slap your mama! Next time, I'm gonna try the rest of the flavors, and have a cupcake, too (comes with a baby macaron on top, so cutes)!It's a little pricey but all the good things in this life are ))

I love Bottega Louie! My favorite part is the pastries. Amazing and fresh, yes it is a bit pricey but just one will be enough to be satisfied. I definitely would recommend their macaroons and creme brulee!!...the ambiance is fantastic as well...
I just like being here, sitting in a beautifullydesigned restaurant, surrounded by loud noise, marble, gold, good-looking servers,and chewing on a portobello fry or a rose water macaroon.

I had a young man named Isaac for my waiter.Great Service, very prompt and well mannered.I recommend the Pizza, Beats, Tortellinis and White Sausage. So many small plates it makes my head spin with all the right revolutions. Oh and don't forget the uuber-authentic Ceaser Salads, BOMB!Thanks for the great meal BL, now off to 7grand for some more DRINKS!
Flat out a great place to go! Food and atmosphere are great.
You gotta try the portobello fries, there fantastic, everything here is reasonably price for what you get and it's a place you have to try once at least

Outstanding food and service.  For such a big space, i'd expect the quality to drop a bit.  But not the case for this downtown gem.Small plates are wonderful to sample--kind of like tapas plates.  Main courses are pricey but you definitely get what you pay for.  Simple and elegant presentation. And damned tasty.The real hidden bonus: cocktails!  What a truly great bar program.  Classics with some flair.  Fresh juice. Spirit, citrus, sugar. Expertly made. Friendly bar staff too. Kudos.

I've been here about 5 times now, and I've never been disappointed.  This last time was particularly incredible because the waiter remembered us. Not just that he'd seen us before, either-- also, that we'd sat over there, and that we ordered everything family style.  Seriously. He sees thousands of people a week-- how is this possible? As for the food, the wait, the space--everyone has already said most of what you need to know, but just to add my own 2 cents:This is not the place to order things that show up on every menu in town (calamari, for example).  It will be fine, but not mind-blowing and you'll find your self wondering why you waited an hour for a table.  Bottega Louie excels at simple, elegant dishes that are creative without being fussy. Here's what I usually order (to share, of course):Pizza BiancoPortabello FriesCorn w/ Bacon & Chard (Ah-mazing!)Arrancini (fried rissotto)Beets w/ goat cheeseBudino (for dessert)The best strategy is to order a pizza or an entree, and a handful of small plates. Then, just enjoy the lovely space, incredible service, and take in the best meal you'll ever find at this price point.

Bottega Louie Pizza is the only reason I'll travel downtown. The texture of their crust is absolutely perfect and I would drink their sauce straight if they sold it in water bottles. I've tried them all and this is hands down the best pie on the entire west coast.
Awesome room!Most attentive wait staff ever.
Two thumbs up for Maria and Harrison last night!!! :)
the food is fantastic.  Trenne pasta.  all the cheeses... the pizza, everything is GREAT here....

In for the weekend from Vegas cant get over the transformation of Downtown Los Angeles (WOW), it feels like NYC and Bottega Louie is what's making it better. The design is amazing, the service is tight, the pizza is top notch and the desserts esp. the macarons are even better. Looking forward to my next trip to LA.
I definitely recommend the Portobelo fries! Wow!This place has a cute little market that you can buy fresh products from. Feels like a New York hot spot.  Service is fantastic!
The macarons are sooooo good!!!! Crispy outside and moist inside.... yumm!

I just ate there for there first time after reading all the reviews.  I did'nt know what to expect and was very pleased.  It is a beatiful space and has just a great energy in it.  It is not your typical LA restaurant (thank god).  I had the margherita pizza, ceaser salad, and a pilsner urquell.  Being from NYC I thought the pizza was dead on and worth every dollar.  It tasted fresh and was quick to the table.  I wish they sold slices!  The ceaser was the classic ceaser and I have no complaints.  I liked the fact that it was not diced up ceaser but with the large lettuce leafs.  Compliments to them for having Pilsner Urquell on tap as well!  Most of my favorite NY pizzerias had it.  On my way out I bought some fried chicken and some meatloaf in their market to try at home.  I now know I can no longer buy my dinner at Ralphs or Whole Foods.  Both items were delicious, large sized, and very decently priced.  In fact, I plan to do a lot of shopping in their market.  I also had 2 oatmeal cookies and they were by far the best cookies I can remember having.  Seriously - try them.  I would like to point out something of interest that no one talked about.  Although the space is huge and this can lead it to be somewhat loud, I liked this energy.  What I noticed was that in the bar area they were playing some very cool music - I even heard some hip hop mixed in among the rock, punk, and classics.  I think it shows that Bottega Louie is something different in that they are not just playing Sinatra like any other Italian restaurant.  It really added to the vibe and I think would be a great happy hour hang out spot.

I love this place.  New York style, for sure.  Even though it looks like a high end restaurant, everything is affordable, the servers are on top of their menus, the hosts make you feel welcome, and everything about it is just magnificent.  This is definitely the newest hot spot in downtown Los Angeles!

This place makes me want to visit downtown LA. It is something that I would expect to find in Manhattan or San Francisco. It has lots of energy with it's extra high ceilings and marble floors. All the voices echo in this wonderful establishment.Their desserts all look wonderful. However, the crust of their tarts are too hard for me. Napoleans are good.The side dishes are incredibly varied and all look very appealing. They make Brussels spouts look good. Or was I just that hungay?!

Bottega Louie is more than a restaurant ... it's an experience.To start, visually it's a jewel ... when you pass it on the street at night,you instantly feel like it's an expensive restaurant and that you need to go home and change into something more upscale.  But once inside, after you peek at the menu, you're suprised to find that the prices are very reasonable, and the dress is casual.The staff is amazing!  They go out of their way to take the experience from fine dining to an experience!As for the food ... you have to try:The Portobello Mushroom FriesThe Lasagne (one serving is large enough to serve 4)& The Sausage Pizza!All of their food is terrific, order to share, and if you need more, thePizza's take 7 minutes!Since I moved downtown 4 months ago, I've dined there at least 6 times.  They quickly recognize the locals, and even though there are no reservations, ask about their Corporate Concierge program, and they will go out of their way to accomodate you.Employees that stand out:Eric & Nicole!Whenever I have guests that come to visit, it's off to Bottega Louie!Can't wait till they deliver.Oh yeah, and I went with a party of 8 one night for a birthday dinner.We ordered lots of appetizers, food and wine ... and it was $35/ea!Very reasonable!!

You know how kids get all crazy excited when they're inside a ginormous candy store? Well, imagine that crazy excited kid as me, entering this grand, white NY-style food palace and grubbing and OoooHing and ahhhh-ing at all the scrumptious desserts, pizza, fresh bread, deli-fixins' and appreciating the classy-modern white decor, pristine marble floors, high lofted ceilings, ornate French custom molding, open airy ambiance, and the whole nine yards at my fave LA dining spot, Bottega Louie.Upon my first visit, my friends and I were literally drooling over the desserts and deli items, and I guess it was pretty obvious, so one of the 220 uber friendly staff members voluntarily gave us a helpful little tour of each area. We learned that Bottega Louie is not just any type of fine dining restaurant. It is ALL of the below and then some. a) It's a bakery/dessert shop that includes but is not limited to the following items: cute mini cupcakes, sweet chocolate squares branded with the restaurant's initials BL, crispy sweet pastries and muffins, gooey fresh fruit tarts and pies, fresh baked french bread and even chocolate bread, skinny mini baguettes, and macaroons that come in all sorts of colors of the rainbow. If you order enough pastries and dessert to fill a box, you'll leave home with a pretty in pink box tied with a bow.b) It has a visible pizza making station! Yup, a really cool pizza making station is located in the back of the restaurant with clean white brick walls and a glass wall that allows you to see the wood-fired pizza getting tossed and then freshly baked in the oven. c) It's a fresh deli that serves the BEST eggplant parmigiana! I had to hold myself back from ordering too much at the deli, but I had my eye on the fried chicken, mac n' cheese, and quiche lorraine. They are so clever with the packaging of their deli items because they give you this white, pristine envelope and card that gives you instructions on how long to cook your leftover food in the microwave and/or oven. It really adds a very classy touch to your carry out items and it makes for a memorable souvenir if you're into pretty stationary cards and arts and crafts stuff like I am. d) It's a fully-stocked bar/cafe that is frequented by various people from downtown loft dwellers and yuppies to hipsters and after-work patrons. So far I only tried their red wine and it complemented well with my dinner. My friend can attest that the bar service was great and one of the bartenders was ultimate eye candy for her while she waited for us laggers to arrive.e) Last, but certainly not least, it's a fine dining establishment that deserves 5 stars for its food! I am still drooling over the crispy portobello fries dipped in their special aioli sauce. That has been my staple appetizer at every single visit. My usual entree is the grilled pork chops (one order comes with 3!) with a side of apple sauce for dipping. I know it sounds strange, but there's a nice balance between the salty and sweet flavors. Many of their dishes are perfect for sharing family style, so if there are 3 of you, get the 3 succulent, grilled pork chops!  If you want something buttery and savory, the trenne is definitely the way to go. It's an amazing pasta that tastes light, but is super buttery and is tossed with tiny chunks of beef and some greens. Other notable dishes:  fresh bianco (basil) pizza and arrianchi arrabiata appetizer (think fried mozzarella sticks but in the form of balls and stuffed with rice and cheese).  Save room for dessert because you won't want to miss out on the delicious warm chocolate soufflé! If you have more room for dessert, try the sweet simi freddo and light orange crepe. Not only is Bottega Louie impeccable and unique in terms of food, ambiance, and decor, but its service is among the best I've ever had in downtown. The highlight of our service was gettin that initial tour by that friendly staff member. I wonder if she gives consistent tours to other people, but I'd like to think we were the special trio that lucked out that one evening. That was a great precedent to what was to follow for our perfect dining experience. Our waitress  was hospitable and knowledgeable about each dish and was pretty attentive in clearing our dishes along with other random staff members who were always quick to clean our table and fill up our water. After we ate dessert, this handome guy who looked like a manager in a three-piece suit just happened to roll by and happily took our picture. He was a mix between Adam Levine and David Beckham, so, yes, they are friendly AND good looking! Bottega Louie truly is a diamond in a rough, as it is located on the dingy streets of 7th and Grand. There's no other place in LA that can give you that same look and feel as if you're dining in NY but with reasonable prices, great hospitality, and superb ambiance and decor.

I am on business from NYC  staying at the standard for 3 weeks and have never reviewed a place before but I must say I was blown away. I am so proud of who ever created and executed this marvelous place.. I wish it would transplant itself to NYC.. this place is perfect from the architecture with the majestic high ceiling to the marble and brass perfect. The service is top notch and great to look at particularly the lovely hostesses.  The coffee bar area where I have spend two solid afternoons on wi fi enjoying latte's and an array of amazing pastries is great, reminded me of a cafe in Paris. Around 4 this place is perfect for a true mixology concoction,the dirty martini hits the spot.  Had dinner there with a large group 2 nights in a row, service professional and attentive. The vibe was happy and festive. The food solid, loved pizza bianco and pizza margherita on par to Grimaldi's in Brooklyn and that says a whole lot. The pasta fresca was fresh and delicious, had a bunch of small plates all very good. Trenne pasta was a particular strand out dish. I seriously enjoyed my time at this very cool restaurant that can compete and beat any establishment in NYC. Los Angeles just got better I will be back.
Loved it.......good food,  great place, nice people, love the chicken sandwich!

After I had been in the restaurant a few times I found out that Bottega Louie caters lunches to offices in Downtown.  I called in to place an order and was surprised to find out that they choose the food for you when you have lunch catered.  I was a little nervous, but they asked me lots of questions like when would we be eating, how many people, and any special dietary needs.  They told me that they'd customize the order because they know what would be new that day and what would travel best.  My group and I were very pleased with their selection.  They delivered it to our office on time, set it up beautifully, and the food was delicious!  Some of the items they chose were Italian Salad, Rigatoni Fresca, and Chicken Milanese.Eating in Bottega's beautiful space is wonderful, but having their food catered for lunch is really nice as well!

You step in and its as you have left downtown. The food was fresh and yummy.  The service was fantastic.  I have gone a few times now and ordered different dishes each time.  None have been disappointing.  The portabello fries are fantastic.I bought bread and a chocolate pastry from their counter.  All of it yummy.

I just moved in to DTLA in this last month and had heard a lot about this place from a lot of my neighbors so I decided to give it a try. I took my mom for mothers day brunch and it was AWESOME!!! The place is very elegant and gives you a feel of classic big city dinning from an era when people actually dressed up to go into the city. Marble floors, high ceiling and brass trim on everything. The staff are all super attentive and really attractive. We came in just the two of us and had a really short wait time which we enjoined at the bar sipping on mimosas. They also have a great market with really yummy looking pasteries, sandwhiches, etc. We ordered the bianco pizza with pepperoni and it was soooo goood! we also tried the burrata and grape tomatoes which was as good as the pizze. My mom had the lentil soup as an appetizers which she loved. The waiters are really  great at describing the food and recommending there favs their service is excellent. the food was great and the vibe in the room was really mellow and fun. Needless to say my mom had a great time and she felt really special. I will definitly be coming back soon.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! Since they've been open I've been several times  and each time it's always a treat. The staff is knowledgable and friendlly, the food is incredible and  the pizzas are to die for! The market has an extensive variety of delectable goods! Sweets, breads, cheese and tasty prepared foods. A definite must!

Just got back from Budapest and had a layover in LA for a few days so decided to check out Bottega Louie. Was I glad I did. I arrived about 7 PM Saturday night without any reservations and was seated within 15 minutes. (Have waited for several hours at some upscale Paris restaurants whose food I can say didn't compare with the extraordinary fare at Bottega Louie) The decor is enchanting and really adds to the culinary experience that awaits you. I started off with the lentil soup, which was fantastic. Just the right touch of seasoning which made the broth light and savory. I had the lasagna for my main course, which I would say was the best I've had. I can still imagine the taste several days later and now can't wait for my next layover in LA to get it again. Had a small sausage pizza, with the wonderful thin crust, cooked to perfection, and just the right portions of sauce to cheese. The service was excellent and the waiters were always easily accessible when you needed something. The whole restaurant experience was one of the best I have had, even better then some of the Michelin 3 star restaurants I have eaten at. I was so impressed that I had to stop back on the way to the airport to stock up on some of the great products in the market and get some coffee and pastries for the plane ride home. I can't wait till my next layover in LA to experience all the other mouth watering delicacies on the menu and do some more shopping, since what I bought only lasted a couple days at home.

This place is AMAZING!! The food is unlike anything I have experienced, and I eat out for a living. I wish I could have tried everything on the menu, but here's a few things that left me in awe. The Louie salad is of the highest quality I've ever seen and the taste, incredible!  Napoli pizza is better than the one I had in Napoli, my husbands pork chop with peas & prosciutto side was magnificent. The desserts make you saliva just to look at, and the taste is unforgettable. This is what great, quality food is all about, and haven eaten my way through all of Europe & the US, this place is one in a million!!
Portabello fries! Rockin
Food is great! Everything is awesome. The best part is they open really early and stay open late at night. A dream!

New york transplant.. I had dinner at Bottega Louie last night and must say that  we had an elegant, yummy dinner from start to finish.   Our Pizza Bianco was amazing, thin crust and perfect. The trenne and bronzino as good as some really top restaurant s in NYC for half the price. The peanut butter dessert is dangerously good.  The service a bit too attentive but I would rather be overserved than my needs ignored.  I think it's sad that there are haters or competitors writing negative reviews, this place is a blessing to the downtown location and a welcome beautiful addition.  Im just glad I now have an affordable, delicious option close to home. Did I mention the amazing gourmet market and pastries to go.
